description:
My favorite go to spot for casual and comfort food. So happy they have one on Union Street. Fresh pasta made daily for great prices. Prices starts at $9.25, can't beat that. 

Always a line during rush hours, therefore I always go before or after dinner rush. You first order your food and then find yourself a seat. Self serve water and condiments.  

My favorites is the meat lasagna. I also order the meatballs, therefore I an split one meal into two. Honestly everything is good. It really depends what you want that day. 

If eating pasta doesn't make me fat, I will go here everyday.
author: Sandy B.

description:
*praise hands* to the temple of homemade pasta (aka this place)

I gorged on a beautiful bowl of papperdelle with meat sauce and meatballs here before running the SF Half Marathon and I swear to god it powered me through all 13.1 miles.

As soon as you enter, there is a guy behind a glass counter making pasta FROM SCRATCH. That's how you know this place is legit yo. 

You order at the counter from a congenial Italian dude and pay at the register. Then, you will be given a number and escorted to a vacant table where the server will bring you your food. The basic concept is that you can customize your pasta any way you like - (1) choose your preferred pasta (linguine, ravioli, spaghetti, etc.), (2) choose your sauce and (3) choose your add-on's (like meatballs which were a tad too salty for my liking).Voila - you got pasta magic.  

Service was quick and attentive. Vibe is casual with a customer based comprised primarily of couples and families. There isn't much seating and it does get cramped at times but they manage to get people in and out fairly quickly. Price point is very fair for SF with most pastas starting at $10 and the portions are huge.
author: Laura Y.

description:
Every time I come to San Francisco, One of the stops I always make is this Italian homemade Company. Located on Union Street it's close to everything from the gym to shopping. you come in and order your food first before sitting. they make it fresh from order. 

so many different kinds of pasta and sauce combinations.  I personally like the gnocchi and meat sauce and a side order of meatballs. 

The staff is super nice and helpful, if any questions just ask. 

They also take out orders and they do delivery. 

I always end up ordering extra to eat later. 

prices are pretty reasonable.
author: Roland L.

description:
I'm typically not a pasta kind of person BUT I loveee homemade pasta especially from smaller pasta restaurants. Freshly cooked pasta just tastes soo much better. My first encounter with homemade pasta was Pasta Sisters in LA, then Il Corvo Pasta in Seattle, and now, The Italian Homemade Company! My friends and I made the trek out to SF on a Saturday through some pretty horrible traffic and I must say, I wasn't too upset about it after seeing and tasting my Taglitalle Pesto dish. 

The pasta was about $13-14 dollars and for the portion size, that's a great price! The pasta had a nice bite and chew to it and there was plenty of pesto sauce to coat each noodle with just the right about of sauce. I'm sooo glad that there is a closer location in the East Bay (Oakland). 

This restaurant is a self seating type of spot. Place your order at the front, take a number, and find a table. The food comes out really quickly. They offer several noodle shapes and sauce types. Definitely check this spot out if you're a pasta lover! 

P.S. Parking is not easy to find, especially on the weekend.
author: Jessica N.

description:
Omg I don't know how many people I told about the amazing pasta we had here! First of all they are literally making the pasta as you are waiting in line to order. Secondly the prices for a bowl of fresh pasta and amazing sauces is super reasonable, especially for San Francisco. I think if I lived in the city I would eat here at least once a week if not more. I know the next time I'm in the area I'm planning on having a meal here- I actually really just want to try their pasta with just a bit of the spicy oil the have available next to the cheese and pepper. 

But for what we actually ate when we visited: gnocchi with pesto and tagliatelle with bolognese. Everything was delicious but if I had to pick a favorite it would be the tagliatelle with bolognese and even took some of the pesto and mixed it in!
author: Evita B.

description:
Here's the breakdown:

1. They hand make their pastas! You can purchase pasta by the pound and make it at home too.

2. You order at the front and sit yourself down. They bring the food to you but you have to get your own water and napkins. It's a very causal environment. Great for quick eats or a quick bite with friends. 

3. I went around 1-2pm on a Saturday and it was pretty empty. People started to fill in a little once I sat down. But no wait.

4. The interior design is lovely. It's very hip and you can watch people make the pasta right in the front. It's nicely decorated but does still a little crowded with the furniture set up (even when its empty).

5. The service workers were kind and helpful.

6. The food is pretty good. The noodles were a little on the uncooked side. I'm not sure if that was intentional or not as my friend said that's the way they eat it in Europe.

7. The prices are well-priced. Very affordable, especially in SF. 

Overall, I would recommend this place to a friend or a co-worker who is looking for a quick, reasonable-priced bite. Maybe not the best place for a date night, since it can get a bit loud. Also, there aren't that many seating available, so large groups are not recommended.
author: Shin L.

description:
This place has such awesome real-deal fresh pasta! 

I don't usually come out all the way to the Marina but this pasta was recommended by a friend. Boy was it good!

Walking in, you already see workers making fresh pasta in the granite countertops! It's as fresh as it gets. The shop is pretty casual--order at the register and the they will serve it to you at the table you sit at or order to-go. Pick your pasta type, and then your sauce and add the price together. With tip and tax, you're looking at about a bit more than $15 for a heaping portion you can eat in one or two sittings. 

My friend and I got the Gnocchi with Pesto and Taggliatelle (flat ribbon like pasta) and Meatball Sauce. Both were super yummy! The gnocchi were textured like soft cheesy marshmallows of pasta goodness smothered in a generous potion of fresh pine-nut basil pesto. The Taggliatelle was very flavorful and surprisingly light even though it came with a hearty tomato and meat sauce. 

I would definitely come back again! It's probably the best pasta I have had in a while and I love the casual vibes.
author: Clarissa C.

description:
One of my favorite spots for casual dinner on a weeknight. The pasta is made fresh in-house, and you can taste it! I've tried almost all of their sauce options (marinara, pesto, butter sage, alfredo) and none of them disappoint. Everything is super tasty and satisfying. My absolute favorite is the ravioli- it is unbelievably good. 

The only reason I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 is the portions can be small sometimes and I've found myself needing to get something extra after dinner to feel full (depending on what you order). Otherwise, I love this place and will continue to stop in for dinner with friends!
author: Nicole D.

description:
What a thrill when youre searching Yelp for a lunch rec, you go to that lunch rec and it's closed for a midday break, then you walk the block to see what else there is, and pop into this place to be immediately drawn in by the mountains of fresh pasta being made to your left, backed by a long menu of words so authentic that you might need to whip out Google translate. 

I loved every bit of this experience:
The food, the Italian accents of the people running the show, the showmanship of making fresh pasta, the fun drink offerings from fresh Italian espresso to authentic Italian soda bottles.

Tagliatelle with pasticciata sauce : 10/10. Perfect balance of pasta and sauce. Pasticciata is a red/bechamel sauce mix with meat, and I got one meatball on the side (that thing was like 2.5" in diameter!) 
Nutella bombolini : 10/10 duh. Tiny Italian donut filled with Nutella. 

It's an hour+ drive for me to this place, and I can only cross my fingers that work pops me back up in the same neighborhood again, because "thank you come again?" Absolutely, and with all my friends.
author: Amanda W.

description: This pasta was some of the saddest pasta I have ever eaten. Eating this food felt like a chore rather than something to enjoy, also the flat bread did not look like flatbread but instead looked like a tortilla cut into triangles. This food was definitely not worth the price... we paid 14+ dollars for pasta that was something we could have made at home. The workers were at least nice enough but that fact did not make up for the lackluster food.
author: Erica C.

description:
I walked over a mile up many strenuous hills for some housemade authentic Italian pasta; so worth it! This restaurant is tiny with only a few tables inside, so not the best place for a large party. Of course, I came with a giant party of 12 were lucky to find 2 open tables for us.

There's a large menu on the wall so it makes it easy to pick what you want. You order with the cashier and pay before you eat your food. I decided on the veggie lasagna and got to try someone's bolognese pappardelle and veggie ravioli. Everything tasted fantastic and the noodles were al dente and cooked fresh! The prices are also very reasonable for Italian food. The music was blasting and I thought it could've been turned down just a smidge, although I sat right next to a speaker. I noticed a line forming out the door after I was seated, so this must be a hot spot in SF and rightfully so!
author: Mindy D.

description:
Freshly made pasta in house, need i say more?

Good food at a great price, thats what i love about this place.

Order at the counter, pay, and they bring it out to you, as easy as that and you'll be enjoying your meal in no time.

Ordered the vegetarian ravioli with butter sage & parmesan along with a Meatball Pappardelle.

Both are solid offerings by this establishment, will definitely come back to try other items if ever in the area again.
author: Steven H.

description:
Love that you can choose your own type of pasta and sauce!  

We went with the meat lasagna, tagliatelle with pesto, and pappardelle with meatballs.  Meat lasagna was a bit underwhelming, but the dishes were overall very delicious. 

We also got the tiramisu, which was surprisingly tasty.  

Will definitely come back to try the other pastas.  :)
author: Christine A.

description:
This was a cute place. You have to order your food at the counter and then once you do they will give you a piece of paper with your name on it and will deliver your order once it's ready.  There are seating inside and outside.  The seats inside are mostly bar stools and if you want a seat with a back make sure you wait for one.

My daughter and I ordered two different types of pasta with red sauce with meatballs.  My daughter thought the meatballs were a bit salty.  We also ordered a side of caprice salad. It was good.  I ordered a glass of cab blend. 

It was worth a try!!
author: Melinda R.

description: You get to choose the pasta and sauce. I had the fettuccini and bolognese sauce and it was delicious! Came out hot and the pasta itself is amazing since they make it there. You order and then seat yourself. You get your own silverware and they have  mason jars so you can get water. I was visiting the city with a friend and it was a quick and easy. We didn't have to wait to order our food and didn't wait more than 10 mins for our food to come out. Overall, great food and experience!
author: Jackie A.

description: Get the pesto. Get the pesto. Get the pesto. Super Italian joint. Love the options, drinks, pastas, sauces, vibe - all of it! I was less infatuated with the cacio e pepe special and bolognese sauce but my compatriots had no problems polishing it off. Truffle burrata and tomatoes was a nice touch too. What a cute place.
author: Priscilla T.

description:
Dinner review. Pasta.

Ordered:
Flatbread
Meat lasagna
Meat ravioli + Bolognese sauce 
Tortellini + Parmesan sauce 
Pappardelle + White sauce

Overall, good options, great quality. "As good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description:
I came here with a couple of foodie friends. Per usual we ordered a few different dishes and decided to share them all family style.

I was a little taken aback when the guy delivering our plates commented that it looked like we "hadn't eaten since 2006." 

For me, this raised several questions:
Why judge the very customers putting more money in his pocket? Who hurt this man? Why choose to be a thief of joy? And what happened in 2006? 

The food was amazing so it's a forgivable offense. Although I wish I had said "yes, I just woke up from a coma."

Anyway. Amazing food! Loved the pasta and the panna cotta. Everything was fresh. I would definitely recommend. The restaurant was a little bit of a tight fit with seating but the pasta made it totally worth it.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
5/5 this place is perfect. This is a very casual spot to grab Italian food and the only complaints are the seating can be limited.

The food tastes so homemade!!! Hence the name, but I am not even a huge Italian food fan and I have to say its worth stopping by if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Mariam P.

description: I came here on a Wednesday night for a date with my girlfriend--it was her idea. Walking in, I could tell it was a nice casual atmosphere. You can watch the pasta being made, it was absolutely mesmerizing! Anyway we ordered two dishes--the pesto and the Bolognese with meatballs. The pasta and sauces were so fresh, I never knew I needed fresh pasta in my life. The portions were solid too so we were more than full!
author: Andrew T.

description:
My friend and I came for dinner one night and street parking wasn't too bad. It's located in a very nice part of San Francisco near the Marina/ Cow Hollow area. When walking in, you are instantly greeted by pasta chefs rolling out fresh pasta. 

I went for my go-to combo of gnocchi and meat bolognese and I wasn't disappointed! The portions aren't too big, but enough for one, satisfying meal. The gnocchi was super rich, fluffy and soft while the bolognese was meaty and fresh. My friend went for a cream pasta, and she enjoyed it as well. 

Overall I would recommend this place for fresh pasta! The store is also an Italian grocery store, so their fresh pastas can be bought and cooked at home.
author: Sandra S.

description:
In the kingdom of sub-$15 homemade pastas and lasagna accompanied by refreshing aperol spritzes, the Italian Homemade Co reigns supreme.

Legit my favorite casual pasta joint in the city serving freshly made pastas and sauces, with veggie options too. And sandos, lots of sandos.

What I love:
1) lasagna with meat sauce
2) spaghetti with meatballs (huge balls, HUGE)
3) pappardelle with bolognese
4) gnocchi with pesto

I like to bring a friend and people-watch Union Street at the window seats.
author: Cindy T.

description:
This place is definitely worth a try. I came here with my friend, Shannin, and two of her friends while we were both in the city. They recommended this place and I want to thank them for it! We walked 1.2 (SF) miles to get here, and I must say those hills leading up to eating to this place was worth it. We came here on a Wednesday night around 630pm. It was packed and the line was out the door. 

My first impression of the place was that it was very urban, typical SF hole in the wall type of deal. When I walked in I saw a chef cutting the homemade pasta and the smell of that homemade pasta was to die for! 

I ordered their meat ravioli with pesto sauce and their meat lasagna. Let me tell you, that meat ravioli was On. Point. It was packed perfectly, it had perfect sauce to pasta ratio, I was living my life up in this place. 

The four of us were all too invested in our pasta dishes that we didn't talk to each other for a good 5 minutes. 

After eating my meat ravioli with the pesto sauce I was filled up. I looked at my meat lasagna took a bite of it(portions are huge!) and thought to myself that I'd bring it home for my partner. Oh, the bite I did take from the lasagna was delicious!

Price was worth it! $11 for the eat ravioli, $3 for the pesto, and $13 for the meat lasagna. 

I fell in love with this place. 10/10 would recommend!
author: Jonathan A.

description: This is definitely my favourite Italian restaurant in Bay Area, comparable only to its other location in North Beach (which I admittedly go to more often than this one because of the more convenient location), lol. The food is always superb and usually comes out in a timely manner. My go-to is tortellini with parmesan sauce, but I'm a fan of the lasagna and other pasta sauces as well. If you still have room for dessert, I'd recommend the panna cotta (although it's been a hit or miss for me lately). The only downsides I can think of for Italian Homemade is that it gets really busy at times (a good problem to have, I suppose) and doesn't take reservations. Oh, and sometimes the popularity of certain pastas (ahem, the tortellini) means that they run out. Still, these aren't enough reasons to keep me away! ;)
author: Bianca C.

description:
For 2 years in a row, this has been our go-to for carb loading before the SF marathon. After our amazing experience last year, my friend and I couldn't wait to go back to continue this wonderful tradition. There were lines both times we've been but it moves quite quickly. Seating is limited but people leave soon after finishing so we didn't have trouble finding a place to sit after we got our food. 

Both my friend and I got the pappardelle (both years) and it is to die for. The noodles are so fresh and chewy and the sauces are amazing. My friend got hers with pesto and I did the special of the day (a sausage/bitter greens/olive oil combo). Both were amazing and the perfect fuel for our run the next day!
author: Jenni R.

description:
Fresh homemade pasta!!!! Delicious.
We got the tortellini with salsa parmigiano and the pesto fettuccini and the veggie lasagna.
The tortellini was my most favorite. It was my very first time having tortellini and it did not disappoint. It was just delicious and the sauce was perfect.
Glad I went to try this place!
author: Maricel J.

description:
Back again two years later. Moving up to five stars. Everyone speaking thick Italian is awesome. Could hardly understand the dude answering my questions it was so real but I still wanted to date him and I'm not even gay. So I'm sure my wife and teenage daughters loved it. Tried the pork tortellini this time and it was much better than everything else's we ordered. Try it. 
Love this place. Line was out door but moved fast and seating worked out. Glad we came back. 


(Old review) 

Great little place we found. Making home pasta while you decide what to try. Great portions. Great customer service. They all speak Italian. Would have given it 5 stars but the taste didn't blow me away. Definitely good but maybe I don't know what true Italian food taste like. I think the price is good compared to what's out there. Nice interior and seating .
author: Curtis C.

description:
I was disappointed with my last visit to Italian Homemade.

The service: Very slow. I ordered takeout on a Sunday night and stood there waiting for my food for almost 30 minutes.

The food: Bland and not as described. I ordered Tagliatelle with Pasticciata sauce which is described as bolognese sauce with bechamel creme. I was expecting a creamy tomato sauce with ground beef but I actually got unseasoned, watery tomato sauce with cheese unevenly spread over soggy noodles. I'm not sure if they got my order wrong or they did a rush job with my food but it lacked any flavor and was definitely not worth $13.

The restaurant itself looks enticing with a bustling atmosphere and a chef handmaking pasta at the front but the food and services were seriously lacking. I won't be going back for what can only be described as tomato noodles.
author: Michelle L.

description:
This is my favorite and go-to Italian restaurant now. I've never had Italian cravings until I came back from a recent Italy trip. This casual restaurant definitely brings me back, and tastes even better than anything I tried over there.

Setting: medium sized, LOUD, and authentic. There's a guy who cuts up fresh pasta when you first walk in, 5 or 6 tables, and bar seating. The guys behind the counter seem to really enjoy their jobs.  Note: This is definitely a casual place.

How it works:  Order first, pay, then find a seat.

Food I tried: (I recommend them all!)
-Pappardelle with the pasticiatta sauce ($11.75): flat pasta noodles served hot and delicious, with parmasian on top.

-Meatballs ($13): delicious, soft, meatballs dripping in sauce

Tiramisu: a definite must order. I almost licked the plate clean because the cream was sooo good. My bf and I had to fight for the last bite.

Portions are big. My bf and I split the pappardelle and topped each of our plates with the meatballs, and we were full. 

I will definitely be back to try the ravioli, lasagna, gnocchi, and of course the tiramisu again.

The only con is the loud music. I came on a Sunday night and it was so loud, my bf and I had to pretty much yell in order to speak.
author: Corinna T.

description:
Holy pasta. That should be a thing. This place was off the charts satisfying in ma belly. Leave with tighter pants, and you'll still be bringing home leftovers. Everything was fresh - from the pasta, to the sauce, to the cheese grated on top. Highlights were definitely the meatballs (HUGE!) and the pesto pappardelle. Pasta was al dente. There are other things on the item - sandwiches, salads, etc, but pasta is the man of the hour. 

So many Italian places in the city are fine dining, and I loved that this was a casual walk-in, order at the counter, self-service type of place. There were a handful of people eating alone! Definitely a new go-to when I'm craving a quick and hearty Italian meal.
author: Vickie Z.

description:
Immediately drawn to this restaurant when I saw they have fresh pasta made in store. 

Very quick service so it is perfect for those who need to get in and out quickly. Good value for the meal.

I ordered the pappardelle with meatballs. Every mouthful of pasta swam in the flavourful bolognese sauce! I liked the texture of their pasta that has a bounce to it when chewed! Will def be back for more!
author: Ava A.

description:
Running through San Francisco during lunch time, you may find it a bit hard to grab a bite that is not only quick, but satisfying. Well, it was an extraordinarily pleasant surprise to come here and be blown away on both aspects. 

The shop is a bit small, but it should be, as it's not a place you stay for a long time. There's a pasta making station as you walk in, and you order at the other end of the glass wall that separates you from where half of the magic happens. 

Half? Well, I'd say almost so, as there's really two major contributors that make this a new must-visit when I travel. 

First is the pasta. Yes, it's homemade, and it's cooked as if they knew how you truly wanted it. What else is there really to say? It's everything that you'd want it to be, at least my pappardelle was. 

Then there's the sauce. I had the pasticciata, which is bolognese with bechamel cream. It was so simple, yet so addicting. 

Finally, the food is out to you fast. They just drop the pasta, and in a few minutes, you have your dish. The portions are definitely more than one person would feel comfortable with for a lunch, especially since I had the heavy pappardelle and the cream bolognese; it's a good thing that I shared with another person and a pooch. 

I'd say I want to go back and try more, but I just can't get over how amazing that one dish was, I'd probably just get the same thing. I mean, if it ain't broke, don't fix it, right?
author: Carlos F.

description:
I'm a big fan of fresh pasta!
This place is the bomb.

We ordered the fettuccine with pesto sauce, and the meatball ravioli, with the Bolognese meat sauce. 

Fresh Parm on top, and nails the spot!

I read some of the reviews regarding the oil level, and yes the pesto fettuccine did have quite the oil, but it was fresh, and very tasty. You need some oil in your life sometimes lol.

Plenty of seating, beers, wine, desserts etc.. 

They also have salads which I would be interested in trying. 

Pay at the counter, and seat yourself. 

Price is pretty comparable to everything around the area, and to get to see someone making tortellini, and ravioli's handmade, is a work of art!

Would def be back to try the other options.
author: Janessa H.

description: I was recommended to try this place out by a friend. With all the reviews, I expected a wait, but I was pleasantly surprised to see plenty of open seating available! I tried the meat ravioli and enjoyed it. I've heard great things about the lasagna and can't wait to go back to try it soon!
author: Erica C.

description:
That was really good, we're definitely going back again.

Nice to see them making pasta, and then the eating! :) Service was speedy on a Thursday afternoon. Dessert was good too.
author: Edward C.

description:
A great 'fine casual' restaurant for authentic pasta. 

Food: For pasta lovers this is an amazing choose. We ordered the pappardelle pasticiatta, (a rich meat sauce and al dente pasta) & the special for the day: king salmon ravioli. Ravioli has minimal sauce but the dill and butter really helped accentuate the flavors of the pasta. 

Ambiance: This is a pay at counter then find a seat establishment, which means that on a Saturday night we were able to fairly quickly order but then had to wait 5 minutes for a table to clear out. Seating is limited and we felt a bit of a rush to finish the food to as there are people standing around waiting to take your table.
author: Demy T.

description:
Homemade gnocchi lighter than a Tuscan cloud in the spring.
Outdoor seating available so you can live out your Bella Vita fantasy on the sidewalks of San Francisco.

Bonus: you may end up meeting a beautiful photographer and shooting a wedding together. I know I did.
author: Christopher D.

description:
I love the vibe of this place! It's laid back but they serve solid Italian dishes. I got the meatball bolognese with noodles, my husband got the lasagna, my friend got the meatball platter with flatbread and we all shared a pesto gnocchi. I definitely enjoyed my bolognese. It was delicious, although the ratio of sauce and noodles were a bit off. There was too much sauce and it sorta drowned the noodles. The meatball platter was equally good with 7-8 gigantic meatballs. Great flavor and I'm sure very filling.

I had really high hopes for the lasagna as my husband and I are big fans of it. When he got the lasagna, there was definitely too much sauce. He could barely find the noodles. Needless to say he wasn't impressed with the dish. He said the flavor is there, but they need to tweak the ratio of noodles and sauce a bit. The pesto gnocchi was ok. I think the pesto had too much basil as opposed to Parmesan cheese. I would have also preferred the gnocchi to be somewhat browned as it adds more flavor.

BUT the biggest disappointment of all is that they were out of their famous panna cotta. I was so bummed so we opted for the tiramisu which turned out to be quite amazing. The cream was so light and fluffy. It was absolutely delightful!

All in all a great place to eat for a relaxed evening with good food and good people. As Arnold Schwarzenegger said best....I'll be back!
author: Em P.

description:
We had the bolonegse with meatballs and tagliatelle, rich and hearty with just the right amont of sauce. I will say the sauce is a little oily. Also had the veggie ravioli with sage butter sauce, which was perfect! The Cacio e pepe was on special, it was not peppery enough for me but I'm Indian so that's probably my preference for strongly flavored food!

Four stars because they brought our appetizer out with dinner, not giving us time to enjoy our salad. Our pasta ended up being cold because of this.
author: Anjali P.

description: Pasta is homemade which tasted amazing. Not a lot of drink choices available. We got a calzone and the bolanese sauce with meatballs. It was good but the meatballs weren't anything special and the sauce was so so. The star of the show is the homemade pasta for sure. Seating is limited.
author: Carrielynn M.

description: What can I say?! Probably one of the absolute nets pasta I've ever had: completely al dente as it should be, the sauce was abundant and just well cooked, portions are large and can shared! Absolutely authentic place!!  They have also multiple locations, you gotta try this place! Can't be missed. Ravioli pesto were also delicious and wine was good! for sure you can tell an Italian that cares owns it!
author: Irina P.

description: Good pasta. Not great. A friend of mine got the tagliatelle with the marinara sauce and I got the fettuccine with the white sauce. I wish there were some veggies we could have added because this was too simple of a dish to be paying $15 for. The service was great. Not too ecstatic about the food though. I had to get a side of marinara to add to my fettuccini Alfredo. It def tasted better once I added the red sauce along with red chilli flakes.
author: Nidhi P.

description:
Tldr - would you like some meatballs with your oil?

I ordered delivery from the Italian homemade company with the rest of my office and was quite excited to try my first Italian food in San Francisco. I was quite happy to lift my brown box and feel the weight of my food. When I opened it up however, my thoughts changed completely.

I'm pretty sure there was less oil at the last orgy I attended. The meatballs were swimming in a pool of oil so large that I'm sure even Michael Phelps would be daunted by racing through it. I'm pretty sure if I poured this sauce in to my motorcycle I would be able to ride for at least a mile. We told a coworker we would pay him $300 to drink the remaining oil from my order and he refused bc he didn't have a bypass surgeon on hand. 

The meatballs themselves were pretty mediocre too - tasted like every other meatball I've had in my life. Except drenched in oil.

Edit - I don't even know how to throw this thing away. I'm afraid it's gonna literally dissolve the plastic garbage bag in the trash can
author: Samraaj B.

description:
+Fantastically fresh Lasagna and Gnocchi
-Raviolli sometimes tends to be half cooked
-Seating is impossible for groups bigger than 4
author: Veggie F.

description:
For a long time I was convinced that ordering pasta at a restaurant is a waste of money and calories. At the Italian restaurants I've known back home, the pasta was mediocre at best, so why bother?

Well, at the Italian Homemade Company you really can't avoid pasta. I gave it a try a couple of times and it really restored my faith in pasta at restaurants. I've had the Pasticciata and the Sage & Butter sauces and enjoyed both a lot. The pasta itself is fresh, cooked al dente and much to my liking. The portions can easily serve two, or at least provide a nice little midnight snack, so pack up the leftovers. 

Service is super friendly and they seem really excited to have you there, like more than usual. I just couldn't help but notice. And while I still believe that pasta is generally made best at home, I find myself coming back here when I need a quick carb fix.
author: Katja S.

description: This is probably my favorite Italian restaurant ever! The environment is modern, yet urban and the music is lively! The pasta is fresh and authentic. Staff was nice and we found a table easily.
author: Sophia D.

description: Best homemade pasta in San Francisco! The ultimate comfort food! They make homemade pasta with a wide variety of sauces. I enjoyed the fresh burrata salad and tagliatelle with brown butte sage sauce. My husband loved the gnocchi. Our friends had the veggie ravioli and loved it! Cute location.
author: Beth S.

description:
So fresh! We came with some out of town guests visiting from Los Angeles and everyone absolutely loved the food. We came on a Saturday night during prime dinner hour so the line was out the door, however, it moved fairly quickly. We had entertainment while we waited as we watched them roll out and hand cut fresh noodles. You order at the counter, then you take a seat, and they bring the food to your table. If you're looking for more of a fine dining Italian restaurant this place probably isn't for you.  

I ordered the parpadelle with pesto and my fiance ordered the meat lasagna. Both of the pastas came out fairly quickly, although, the flatbread my fiance ordered came out when we were finishing our dishes (he had to go back and ask about this). My dish tasted incredibly fresh, but dare I say it, perhaps it could have used a little salt? I was really blown away by the lasagna with meatballs. My fiance let me have a bit and it was one of the best foods I have put in my mouth in a long time. Our friends from out of town raved about their dishes and left their plates completely empty. 

To finish off our meal we ordered a berry panna cotta and a tiramisu for the four of us to share. Holy cow! I wasn't expecting much of anything, but I was surprised at how delicious both of these desserts were, especially the panna cotta. The best part was that neither of them were too sweet, but just perfect. We all loved them so much we ordered one more of each!
author: Sara P.

description: Absolutely amazing! Loved the food and the vibes inside this little restaurant. The pasta noodles were amazing can definitely tell the difference in taste. Would recommend this place and will come back again! Thank you!
author: Cameron L.

description: Love the spinach and tomato cassoni. The panna cotta is nice too...several flavors to choose from. They have real Italian ladies working here and they are so lovely. Just a wonderful restaurant!
author: Denise C.

description:
This is a busy, casual Italian restaurant.  The pastas are all around $15 after you pick the sauce. You order your food before you sit and somehow they are able to track you down to bring your food.  I ordered takeout and both the pappardalle with meatballs and a tortellini with white sauce.

The meatball bolognese sauce was very delicious and the meatballs were moist.  There was a substantial amount of meat in the sauce.  The pappardalle was delicious and soft.  The tortellini had a nice depth of flavor with the prosciutto and pork.  The white sauce was a little thick by the time I got home, but it was still good.

There was a steady stream of customers on a Wednesday evening, but there was a lot of seating along the bar and inside the restaurant, along with a few tables outside.
author: Ring K.

description:
Stopped in yesterday for lunch while having my car smogged down the street at Union Street Garage. I ordered pappardelle with pesto, and had the second half of it for lunch today. Big servings, and very reasonably priced. 
The pesto was dreamy, and every bit as good as you'd find in Liguria, allegedly the birthplace of pesto. It brought me back to some fun visits to that region, so it was a very sentimental lunch. 
I guess the atmosphere could be a bit better....the music was loud, 80s disco music, I asked them to turn it down and maybe they did a notch but it was still ANNOYING, and why? Not our finest musical hour. Still 5 stars on account of the happy memories induced by basil, garlic, olive oil and super fresh, homemade pasta.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
I don't even like pasta, but this place is so simple, fresh, and delicious. I ordered burrata salad that came in a huge portion, and fettuccine pasta with pesto sauce. Delicious! 

Cute and rustic interior.
author: J R.

description: This is as Italian as it gets, it s almost like your italian grandma is cooking. I have been here two times and tried a couple of different things, the meatballs are super good, the ravioli superb, the pasta super fresh and the wine is perfect too. I have also tried the tiramisù which is very good.
author: Antonio F.

description: Love the idea of the place. We arrived and waited to order as the drunk girl at the register (who openly shared what wine she'd been drinking was chatting with the guy at the register). When they finally finished talking, I asked her about the special and she didn't know what it was so described it as asparagusish with a little butter.  My dish arrived with ham.  I was expecting pasta with vegetables. I went back up to tell them I did not want ham and they were very rude. I said I'd just have the gnocchi roll with marina. My order then arrived and it was gnocchi (not the roll) with marinara. I told them that was not what I ordered. Again, incredibly rude about their mistake. The food is not good enough to be treated that bad. My advice is to lay off the wine and actually pay attention to your service.
author: Kasey C.

description: I always order take-out from Italian Homemade so I am a big fan of their food and customer service!However, this time when I ordered a mass order, there was a dead bug in my pasta. This was extremely disappointing especially since this food was for my business meeting, not to mention-- pretty disgusting. I called and left a message about this situation but received no call back unfortunately. Please be aware of what could possibly be in your pasta everyone!
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
I ordered the Lasagna with a meatball. It was very fresh and yummy tasting sweet red tomato sauce. I enjoyed it so much and a very large portion i had some leftover for the next day.
I ordered my lasagna through Uber eats and scheduled it to be delivered to my room. I would of used Yelp but there was a minimum order. But it ended up costing me close to $19.00. I could of gotten a salad.
author: Bonnie L.

description:
Avoided the Saturday night dinner rush and came in at around 5:00pm. Came here on a friend's recommendation. I wanted to get the gnocchi roll, but it was sold out. Guess you gotta come here early for their specialties! 

In terms of location, wish it was closer to Bart, but there's lots of shops and restaurants to check out around the area. 

Menu was pretty simple. Pick a pasta and pick a sauce. You order up front first and then find a place sit. And they'll bring the food over to you. We ordered the gnocchi with butter and sage, the ravioli with pesto, and the lasagna with meat sauce. We got the ravioli and lasagna first, but the gnocchi took a little while longer to come out of the kitchen. 

You could really taste the homemade sauce and pasta. The pesto was really similar to the ones I've made at home. It was really flavourful and delicious. Same with the ravioli. The stuffing inside was mixed well, and well seasoned. I was not a fan of the butter sage though. It was quite bland. It tasted like the sage had not steeped into the butter enough. It was definitely flavourful around the sage leaves itself, but there wasn't enough of it throughout the whole dish. The gnocchi itself was a nice chewy texture. Though, I would have preferred it to be pan seared as well for some crispiness. I started dipping the gnocchi into the meat sauce for the lasagna as there was quite a lot of it and also because it was really good.

Overall, I really liked 2 out of the 3 pastas we ordered. Would avoid the butter sage sauce though. Id love to come back and try out some of their other pastas and to get some Italian dessert!
author: Christine L.

description:
This place is awesome and so simple. Was in SF this past week and walked right past this place during the day and said I have to come back. That being said, came back that night and was surprised at how busy it was. Seeing that made me think this place must be legit. 

First off the menu is super simple and straight forward, you pick your type of pasta and you pick your sauce (I got the tagliatelle with the meatballs and the tagliere). They also have salads and also sandwiches as well. 

The pasta was cooked perfectly and the sauce was to die for. I normally avoid meatballs because I'm not a meatball person and this places has great meatballs. The tagliere was a great starter with great meat and cheese. Once we sat down and was waiting for dinner I could see that this place was very well liked as the line went out the door. 

Atmosphere is awesome and super casual has family style seating so if it's packed you may be sitting with some people you may not know. That's not a problem though because the food is awesome. 

Also if you have a gluten allergy they have gluten free pasta. Just an FYI they get their pasta from another company and it does take a little bit longer to cook, but still has an amazing taste. 

If you're looking for a cool place with great food and atmosphere this is your place.
author: Brian M.

description:
I am in love with this place.  Seriously...Italian food in the city does not get any better than this.  As soon as you walk in, you've got the guy to your right throwing pasta around on the counter.  Yes, fresh pasta...made right before your eyes.  SQUEEEEEAAAAAAL!

This place is super casual.  Head over to the register, scope out the menu, order away, and they'll deliver your items to you at your table.

For the non-pasta folks, the burrata salad is a must!!!  Their burrata is homemade and everything about this salad is perfection.  Served with pita bread also.  

Ok...onto the pasta.  I've had a few of their items here.  Pappardelle with meatballs, tortellini with parmesan sauce, and lasagna.  Honestly, you can't go wrong with anything you order here.  Also, expect to have leftovers.  The lasagna is MASSIVE...probably enough to feed 3 people.  They also accommodate vegetarians if meat is not your thing. 

Prices range approx $11-$15 depending on your extras.  Btw, you can't miss all the Italian folks behind the counter screaming in Italian to each other.  Makes the ambiance feel that much more special.  Wine can also be ordered by the glass, half bottle, or full bottle.
author: Jen W.

description: Homemade pasta. Delicious meatballs. Didn't break the bank. Yum. Would eat here every day if I could. Great energy.
author: Teri C.

description:
This is where the Italians from Italy come to hide out.

In a city this "large" you'd come across a couple of Italians here and there, but this is where they all seem to congregate. Must be good pasta, yeah?

It's affordable pasta that'll be the best you can find at this price point. For 4 of us, we ordered 2 appetizers, 4 pastas, 2 desserts, and a bottle of wine. Under $200 including tip. Whaaaaaaaaat? You can't really beat that anywhere with this quality of Italian food. You can also see people at the counter rolling and making the fresh pasta while you eat.

Every item here that we ordered was really good, from the delicious meat sauce to the tiramisu. We left dinner stuffed through half the next day (and I took home a small box of leftovers too). They also make some of the best meatballs around. Just recalling my dinner there while writing this review is making me salivate to no end.

It's super casual, very fast, delicious Italian food - can't go wrong here. It's one of my favorite restaurant spots in San Francisco!
author: Joanne Y.

description: There were 8 people in my party on a Saturday night. We walked in around 9:30 pm and ordered the best Italian food I've ever eaten.  Very friendly environment and the service was fantastic.  Every time I'm in this city, I will make it a point to make a visit.  We had eight different dishes, we all shared and not a bad thing to say about any of them.
author: Terry S.

description: This place is sooo good. I have gotten the tagliatelle bolognese and the meat lasagna, both huge portions and delicious. My favorite is the lasagna.
author: Shabnam E.

description: O M G! What a great find, never heard of this place & I've lived in the city for over 6 years. Anyway we had a need for Italian and did this place fit the bill! Alessandro was THE best host & the food? Wow! That's all I can say, amazing!! Next time we are trying the lasagna, because the meatballs & sauce were soooo tasty!!
author: Lisa F.

description:
Probably the best pasta I've ever had. In summary:

- Very cute, but small pasta restaurant in the Marina. 
- I really like the concept of this place. You stand in line to order, sit down, and they'll either call your name to get your food or bring it to you. There isn't a lot of seating but there is seating inside and outside. The service is extremely fast.
- The menu is awesome and has a lot of variety. You choose which kind of pasta noodle you want and a sauce. It comes out to around $13 or so but it's so worth it and it's very filling.
- You can taste the quality of the pasta.

I can't wait to come back!
author: Chanel H.

description: I make sure I go this place every time that I travel to San Francisco. It is soooo good. I wish there was one in Southern California. I've never had a bad thing from them. Everything is amazing
author: Mindy H.

description: 3.5. I got a pesto pappardelle. The food was pretty good, but I thought the pesto could have used a little more salt and garlic. Other than meatballs, you don't have a choice of any protein. My friend got a lasagna and really enjoyed that. We shared a burrata salad as well. Portions are good and prices are decent.
author: Annie L.

description:
I have intense debates with people over how businesses should be reviewed on Yelp. Even right now as you read this, you're probably saying something like, "I came to Yelp to read about the food, not about this d-bag's opinion about the experience of life." Who really deserves 5 stars? I mean, on a system where we can only give integers, it's a dilemma. Does every olympic athlete who is pretty dang good (or else they wouldn't be there in the first place) deserve a perfect 10 out of 10? If we can't give 4.5, 4.6, 4.7, etc., then I have a trouble giving a place 5 stars. If French Laundry demands 5 stars, does that mean a local pizza shop gets the same rating?

Anyway, I'm going to go ahead and give this place 5 stars because regarding a personal intuition of a wow factor, it'll be readily apparent here. I mean, damn, if you're craving some real deal homemade pasta, this place is for you. Do/did you also watch Master of None Season 2? Well, after watching that you should make your way here immediately and have a great time.

If you're in the Marina want to live your best life like Aziz Ansari does, you must try these items:
1) Meat Lasagna
2) Pappardelle with bolognese and meatballs
(Bolognese sauce, known in Italian as ragù alla bolognese, is a meat-based sauce originating from Bologna, Italy, hence the name. - Wikipedia)

I'll definitely be back for some fettuccini or a different pasta with that butter and sage.
The Italian Homemade Company is the truth!
author: Marlon T.

description:
The best Italian food I've had in one sitting outside of Tuscany. The piadina had perfect paper thin meat and the flatbread was hot and fresh. The meatballs are clearly a mix of several high quality meats and fall apart in your mouth, not dense and heavy like an all beef meatball. Yummy tart marinara and fresh cheese. 

The pasta was really the star of the show. Perfect thin ribbon pasta with butter and sage- honestly the best I have had in the U S of A. Reasonable prices and has a great marketplace type vibe. Will definitely be back. Wish it wasn't in the most annoying neighborhood in SF but you can't control everything, right ;) 

So happy we stumbled upon this gem!
author: Laurel M.

description:
My friend and I came here on a Friday evening to try their homemade pasta and it felt like we took a quick trip to Italy! 

First thing you see walking in is a guy hand making fresh tortellini behind the counter. Love their set up, cute tables and rustic hippie flair. Pay as you order and sit down to wait for a plate of fresh made pasta to arrive at your table. Tortellini with their crema parmagiano sauce was my favorite out of the 3 entrees we tried. Veggie ravioli with butter and sage sauce was also recommended by the workers and it was indeed a unique flavor that I'd recommend as well. At this point we were satisfied but not quite full so we ordered another plate to try their pappardelle which was recommended to pair with bolognese sauce. They were generous with meat in their sauce and pappardelle was perfection. 

I'd highly recommend this place for a cute date or a fun dinner experience with a friend who loves pasta! Carbs always win.
author: Audrey D.

description: My wife loved the Lasagna!  Definitely would come back when visiting San Francisco.  A local told us about this place & we were so glad we came. They were gracious in making adjustments to help me eat vegan.
author: Riley S.

description: The gnocchi and wine was wonderful. A great little place. Wine and pasta, the only way!!
author: Mari B.

description:
Forgot what movie the boy and I were watching but he started craving pasta... so rather than some fancy date night I had planned for him the next day, we went to go grab pasta instead. He got the meatball marinara fettuccine and I got the pesto pappardelle. Order before you sit, open seating. Serves fresh pasta. Service was quick -- probably about 5-10 minutes in, our food arrives. HOLY SMACKARONI! The texture, thickness and taste of the pasta was unworldly! Especially the pesto one -- definitely our favorite. I love wide pasta, and this pappardelle was perfection. We ended up taking 2 orders to go for later that night, ha!

Side note: We saw another table order seafood pasta, and it smelled so goood. We didn't get it because we didn't see it on the menu but best guess was that it was one of the specials...and it was in Italian.
author: Nadeen H.

description:
Love this place.  It's a neighborhood gem.
The lasagna is my favorite and the giant meatballs too!
I get uncooked pasta to go all the time. What a fantastic deal too.
author: VIOLA L.

description:
Quaint neighborhood place. We travel with a wheelchair and they only have high top but low tops outside. 

Food was good, but we just ordered basic pasta no salads would
author: Char M.

description:
Service is usually amazing! I really like the ambiance in here too. Unfortunately, the food is why I'm bringing it down to three stars. Yes, the pasta itself is amazing and tastes very fresh, however the two times I've come here, the food always seems to be under seasoned.

Last time I was here, I got the pesto gnocchi and it  was severely lacking salt. Today when I went, I got the tagliatelle with white sauce and I could not taste anything except for the areas where there were sprinkles of Parmesan cheese. The sauce was also a bit watery :( The meatball sauce my husband got tasted more seasoned than mine, but I still felt like it could have used more seasoning. 

Yes, faulty food isn't fun, but bland food is just...bland.
author: Christine L.

description: My boyfriend and I came here for the first time to try it out due to the high ratings.   There were no seats available and it felt like I was circling around an outlet parking lot on Boxing Day. We finally got two stools. I sat on the weirdest tiniest most uncomfortable stool ever. It looks like a small Kleenex box.  People were standing over us and farting. It took 40 minutes for our two bowls of pasta to come out. The food was very mediocre. The whole experience was just unpleasant.  I'll make our own pasta next time.
author: Wendy K.

description:
Do you like pasta? How about fresh, delicious pasta? Well if you answered yes to those two questions, you should definitely check this place out. I went to this location of The Italian Homemade Company on a Saturday afternoon. It's great to walk in and watch someone making fresh pasta as you order!

The menu is pretty straightforward. Pick a pasta and a sauce or a specialty item. You order at the counter before you sit down and then they bring you your food. My friend and I ordered the gnocchi roll with marina and the pappardelle with butter and sage. The gnocchi roll was super interesting: gnocchi dough with spinach and ricotta on the inside topped with marinara and served in a cream sauce. It came out piping hot and was extremely flavorful and satisfying. The pappardelle was equally as good. The butter and sage sauce was subtle and light and really allowed for the pasta to shine. The pasta itself was cooked to a perfect al dente and still retained a good bite to it. 

There is a fair amount of seating inside: a handful of tables and a few seats at the counter. There are some hipster drinking jars next to a giant metal water can on the counter for self serve water. Service was good overall.

The food here was absolutely delicious! Definitely a go to place for authentic, solid pasta dishes.
author: Lakshmi M.

description:
Great place ! Where you can find AUTHENTIC Italian food. My date really enjoyed the Lasagna and I smashed some Fettuccine  with white sauce! Not to be confused with Fettuccine Alfredo ! which the guy disgustingly said, they don't make that. However , I found it hilarious that , what I ordered was the same. Anyways... Great vibe, Gear Decor and welcoming place.
You have to order and pay before getting your food and they have a Great selection of wine.
author: Joseph G.

description: Mattia " the owner is doing big things in North Beach & the Marina he makes the pasta by hand in the morning and serves it through out the day. If your into fresh pasta made by a passionate Italian from Italy  go now" pappardelle with bolognese absolutely delicious
author: Sean K.

description: Food is really good & tasty. The place is very nice. You order first at the counter and take a sit. Plates are big, and the quality-price relationship is very good. We ordered a lasagna and a Tagliatelle with meatballs and both were very tasty. Tiramisu was also very good.
author: Laura C.

description:
This is my new favorite pasta spot in the city! Came here for a quick bite and left with a very happy tummy. Everyone loved their dishes and portions are much bigger than what it appears in pictures. It's so cool how they make the pasta right there too!

We started with the meatball platter. It tasted so delicious! It was more than enough to share as an appetizer among 5 people. I even saved the sauce to add to my leftovers the following day heh heh heh. 

I ordered the fettuccine with Bolognese sauce and it was incredible! Super fresh, perfectly cooked pasta. And the bolognese sauce was so rich, flavorful, and satisfying. Perfect dish on a cold SF day. 

Other people got the pesto, which also tasted really great! Good balance of light, garlicy flavors. 

Will definitely be back for more fresh pasta at very reasonable prices!
author: Carolyn L.

description: I found the pasta here amazing. It tasted fresh and scrumptious. I had the pappardelle with pasticciata sauce.  However the pappardelle was clumped together at some places so it was still partially raw and flour-y. The parts that were cooked were good though. Doesn't seem too hard to cook pasta nor does it take that long. The pasticciata sauce is a creamy Bolognese (tomato meat) sauce. I could swim around in this sauce. My dining companion had the meat lasagna with an extra meatball. I had a bite of both and they were both pretty good. But the wait and service is so slow. We decided to come here for dinner one night. It was around 8 on a weekend. We waited a while to put in our order, even though there were only 2 groups in front of us. I don't know if it was a lot of questions or just too much small talk. We stood around for 10 minutes before a table opened up. Then we waited another 25 more minutes for our food to come out. No, that's not right. We also ordered a full order of flatbread. That came out a few minutes after we sat down. So we got to enjoy it before our food actually came out. I really would've liked it with my food. But just ate it because it was hot. They also have a weird way of serving you. No numbers. They take your name and will kind of call it out. Or you can do what we did and leave your receipt with your name on the table and they're look for it. Seems time consuming. I would like to come back and try their gnocchi and have more of that pasticciata sauce. But maybe I'll have to call ahead and get it to go.
author: Alison W.

description:
LOVED this place. Authentic Italian food for sure. We could hardly understand the workers because of their thick Italian accents. Awesome service; very friendly. 

And the food....wow. I got the vegetarian lasagna and the sauce on it was for sure one of the best things I've ever eaten. The hubs loved his calzone. And the spaghetti and meatballs are a HUGE helping. We'd go back here for sure. Tiny little place but awesome menu with great choices to choose from.
author: Erin J.

description: The best lasagna I've ever had. I normally don't like lasagna that much, but this was TO. DIE. FOR. Tender and flavorful, everyone in our group of seven thought this was the best dish, but the gnocchi was excellent, too. Order at the counter and have a seat. Get there by 5:30 so you can get your pick of the seating and avoid a long line. Their alcohol is overpriced. Skip the salad, and enjoy the meat sauces!
author: Diana N.

description:
Very nice, easy place to get a meal. For the price and speed, it's a good deal. I have had better Italian food, but this place is quick, the noodles are good, and everything tastes fresh.  

Good espresso!  Super important. 

I will be going back.
author: tom p.

description:
Nice spot with really fresh pasta. It reminds me of Barzotto in the Mission but cheaper and higher quality - a combo that can't be beat!

The vibe is upscale but not pretentious, and folks are happy to chat if you sit at one of the many eclectic seats at the counter. Great wine selection too, which you know is a must-have with fancy pasta.

I recommend the bolognese and tagliatelle I had, though I can't wait to try something else next time I visit!
author: Nikhil S.

description: Amazing authentic Italian hole in the wall. Family owned and operated, HOUSE MADE pasta, and amazing burrata.
author: Annie C.

description:
Mama mia!!! When the moon hits your eye like a big lasagna pie, that's Italian Homemade! OK, enough of that. This casual spot on Union st. is serving up some amazing "homemade" Italian food and I love it. It's priced fairly, the service is great and you know what you're getting yourself into when you walk through the door. Authentic Italian. 

I asked the owner/cashier what I should order because everything looked so good and he recommended the meat lasagna. Naturally, I went with his suggestion and it didn't disappoint. The noodles were perfect, it had a well developed ragu and the cheese was awesome. It was also enough to feed an army and at $12 bucks, a total steal. I'll be eating it for dinner tonight too...

I'll be back. I'll be back. I'll be back.
author: Benjamin F.

description: I'm actually very disappointed about my take out order. I called in and ordered meat lasagna. The lady on the phone said it will be ready in 8 minutes. I arrived exactly 8 minutes later and and got the food. When I opened the container, the lasagna was warm like not in a good way. I ordered the béchamel sauce on top of the lasagne and the sauce laid on top like it was frosting. I felt like the order I got was sitting there maybe somebody else ordered and didn't pick it up and I ended up being the Shum that ended up getting it. I wish I took a picture of it before I tore it apart to examine the rest of the lasagne. It was really dry, and you can tell cause when I opened up the lasagne you could see the old oil. I'm so disappointed what a waste. I know they could do better and are better but my order today was terrible, I will never order their  takeout again. Next time I will check the food before driving home and opening it to be utterly disappointed and still very hungry.
author: Eva A.

description:
The pasta here is fresh made and was definitely five star quality. We ordered the bolognese, butter and sage, and gnocchi in white sauce. Each had their own unique flavor but my my favorite was the bolognese. 

Staff was super helpful and friendly. Definitely planning on coming back here
author: Sunny C.

description: If you're looking for fresh and tasty pasta, come here.  You can select the standard items off the menu or create you own pasta/sauce combination.  We stumbled onto this place through the Yelp app while looking for a place to eat on our final say in San Francisco and were not disappointed.
author: Albert S.

description:
Maybe 3.5 stars.

I went for the simple fettuccine with bolognese since I've been to Italy and feel like the simple dishes are the best if it's a really good pasta shop.

Sauce was great..meaty and homey.  I've had better pasta noodles, these were a bit grainy rather than chewy with a bite. 

Not sold on this place yet (I mean c'mon...Maggiano's! Haha jkjk), but definitely willing to come back to try other items.
author: Mon T.

description:
I eat out A LOT.  I've been to A LOT of Italian restaurants all over the country.  With that being said, this place might have the best pasta I've ever had.  Small, casual spot in Cow Hollow.  Parking can be tough sometimes, but I usually luck out and get a meter nearby.

I almost always opt for the Pappardelle with Bolognese and Meatballs.  You can't beat it for $13, and everything here is great.  Big portions, would cost almost double at a fancier sit down place, and not be nearly as good.  They make their pasta fresh daily, sometimes you can see the person in front making it.  I've never done it as I'm not local, but they also have refrigerated, fresh pasta that you can make yourself at home.  I hope this place sticks around for a LONG time, it's one of my favorite "newer" spots in SF.
author: Ryan B.

description: I heard every thing gnocchi this gnocchi that... I love all they say or wrote... I will try, me n my Wifey will come by soon to establishment... I'm looking porward to eat there ...That's all... Thank you bery mooch...C u soon
author: Fidel A.

description:
I felt like I got transported back to Italy.

Cacio e Pepe is a dish I don't find often in Italian restaurants in US, only Italy. They had it here. They also had pappardelle. I'm coming back!!

The staff speak Italian, you know its legit! And they hand cut their own pasta. 

The cacio e Pepe was so good, creamy and cheesy and the noodles were very different too. Almost underdone but not, it tasted so unique.
author: Angela O.

description: Great food humble spot. Food will not disappoint unless you do t like paper plates
author: Renee G.

description: This was great homemade pasta. It's counter service so you don't have to worry about tips, and on top of that it was really affordable for SF already (~$10-14/meal). The lasagna was by far the best that my sister or I have ever tasted. Make sure to get that. This place reminds me quite of Pasta Sisters in LA although this is more upscale. Great place in SF for a cheaper lunch or dinner
author: Tyler H.

description:
Best.Lasagna.Ever. 

While a lot of Italian spots are on the fancier side, this place is super casual and the pasta is quality.

My favorites are:

Caprese Salad -  Super refreshing with fresh arugula, soft mozzarella and tasty balsamic vinegar dressing. 

Meat lasagna - Hands down the best lasagna I've ever had in the U.S. It literally melts in your mouth. Plus the portion size is huge! 

Cacio e pepe - Not an everyday menu item. I was lucky enough to catch it on special. It is cheesy and peppery goodness. It is super rich so fair warning if that isn't your thing.
author: Melanie M.

description: Fresh handmade pastas! The Italian Homemade Company is half grocery store, half restaurant. You stand in line and watch them make fresh pasta as you pay for your food and then find a table if you're lucky. We tried pesto for the pappardelle because the bolognese sauce was the same as the lasagna but I'd get the bolognese sauce next time. They also cater so you can order delicious fresh handmade pasta for your next party!
author: Christine C.

description: We ordered take out last night and I was not impressed. We got the pappardalle with meat sauce (which my husband had no complaints about) and I ordered the lasagna. My lasagna was cold when it arrived. We only live 5 blocks from the restaurant so it wasn't the travel time. I had to put it in the oven for 20 mins to just get the middle warm. The pasta its self it good, the sauce is just ok. It has a very artificial taste or canned taste to me. We will not order here again.
author: Emily S.

description:
Food: 3/5 stars
-Fettuccine with White Sauce: This was okay. I was hoping it'd have more flavor based off the rave Yelp reviews, but it fell flat and I found myself adding red pepper flakes and salt. If you are hoping for Olive Garden-esque taste, you won't find that here. There was little to no garlic flavor in the sauce, and while it was very creamy, it didn't taste much like cheese either. More like a milk cream sauce. BUT - the fresh pasta was pretty darn good.
- Boyfriend ordered some tagliatelle with Bolognese; this was okay and definitely had more flavor than the white sauce, but still didn't have the boyfriend scraping the bowl for the leftover sauce.
- Side of meatball: This was probably the best part of the meal, very hearty and yummy
- Truffle Burrata Salad ($16): Way overpriced for a salad without any truffle flavor. I was disappointed. Also could have used a lot more dressing. I will give the burrata credit - it was fresh and creamy
- Mozzerella salad: Was okay, nothing special, could have easily made this at home for way cheaper and, again, it was underdressed
- Wine: We ordered the Sangiovese for the bolognese dish, and some other lighter red for the white sauce dish (the cashier recommended this, I would not go with it again as usually white wines pair better with white sauce). Serving sizes of the wine were also very small considering how much they cost.


Ambiance: 4/5 stars for casual dinner spot
- HOLY COW, those bar seats are SO uncomfortable. We ended up getting up and moving to a table. Nothing like having a notch in your crotch.
- The dining area was fine, nothing special, just some tables, very casual. Might be a good spot to grab a quick lunch with a friend.


Value: 2/5 stars
- We walked out of here with a $100 bill. Was the food worth $100? Definitely not.
- We both ordered a pasta dish and a salad, and while we were pretty full, we would have still been a bit hungry if we had only ordered the pasta.
- I probably won't return unless to buy their fresh pasta to take home and mix with my own sauces.
author: Amanda R.

description:
The food here was really good. I had linguini (may be misremembering the exact type if I'm being honest) with meatballs, and also tasted a bunch of meat ravioli. The ravioli was probably better but both were great.

Setup is casual - order at the counter and take a number back to your table. Several of the tables are communal.

Would return.
author: J.P. M.

description:
ALLORA!!! This is the first time I had handmade pasta and it was AMAZING!! My friend and I ordered about two plates of food, meatballs on the side, and half a liter of vino. The way this place works is 

1. Pick your type of pasta
2. Pick your sauce
3. Add any sides

This place reminded me of Master of None and gave me a much greater appreciation for quality italian food. The vibe is great. Everyone is socializing , drinking wine with prosciutto, and having a great time. The italian music just enhances the experience. I believe all the workers up front are italian and speak with a lovely italian accent.  I think this place is as Authentic as you can get but this is only the first place I been too. 

**** QUALITY A1*****
**** SERVICE A1*****
**** PRICE is average***
author: Brian C.

description:
Great flavors!! Dined on 4/4/18 for early dinner. The Grassona Piadina was DELICIOUS!  My only complaint is the flatbread was a little hard. The sausage, peppers, and onions were perfectly cooked. My husband got the Tortellini with Salsa Parmigiana. It was also very tasty.
The seating is an eclectic mix of old wooden chairs and stools made of old bicycle and motorcycle seats. The seats are not very comfortable for long meals. I'm guessing it's because it's such a small place that they don't want you hanging out too long. Overall, I'd return to try a few different dishes, but maybe get it to go.
author: Malika A.

description:
Yum!  Want authentic Italian at affordable prices? This is the place for you.

We ordered fettuccine pesto & fettuccine meatball. Both were delicious.  The Capresse was served ona bed of arugula.

We had just hiked Muir Woods and drove into the city.  This hit the spot.  Highly recommend.
author: L S.

description: The gnocchis were to DIEEEEEE for they're better than my crazy Italian moms (don't tell her or she'll kill me) but OH MY GOSH they melt in your mouth!!!!! The vegetable raviolis were good but very al dente... not very big but the ambience is perfect for young crowds who want to listen to great music while eating Italian food!
author: Camilla P.

description:
Holy moly. Or...holy cannoli? 

Anyway, this place is fantastic! The prices are so reasonable and the quality is excellent! It's Italian comfort food in every sense of the word. I ordered takeout from this location, and I always have a lower bar for takeout because it's not as good as the dish being freshly made BUT, it was as delicious and as fulfilling as having the dish in person! 

I'm a huge fan of this place and can't wait to go back for more.
author: Natalie Q.

description:
Who doesn't love Italian food? It's ingrained into our American culture and it's delicious! Buon appetito! I've been ordering food from here via Caviar for a couple of years now. So much so, I've never been to the actual restaurant -- after reading the reviews, that seems like a huge mistake on my part. 
Long story short: Delivery from here is top notch.
author: Yasi S.

description: Always my go to after a long day at work. Great food and great service. The ravioli is my favourite.
author: Richard S.

description: Great place. Unpretentious.  Wonderful homemade pasta and really good sauces. Even had Mexican coke for my daughter. Did i mention they were fast. Bravo.
author: Nicole J.

description:
This is my favorite spot in marina. It's amazing delicious, affordable and great services. Almost the time I got the lasagna is the best, I came with two friends they ordered the same and we said "This might just be the best lasagna I've had in my entire life. The meat was seasoned perfectly with an incredible blend of spices. The cheese was so creamy and tasty. The pasta was cooked to perfection and  the tomato sauce was delicious"  but everything is awesome. I come here a least one a week and the atmosphere is great, they have a Dj some days.
Bon appetite!!
author: Viviana M.

description: So this is my regular go to place because of the consistency of quality and the super fresh food. I'm vegetarian but I know you can't go wrong with anything here. My personal favourite is getting the pasta with the Marinara and Pesto sauces mixed (you have to pay for both sauces but it's worth it). The vegetarian lasagna is amazing too and is not too cheesy or heavy! Highly recommended
author: Ruchi M.

description: Don't bother. Three of the front staff (all men) spent 15 minutes flirting with three women and didn't even care that there was a very long line. They didn't even apologize and multiple people in line were complaining. The two stars is because the food is ok but the service really sucks! Guys, keep it in your pants - you weren't going to get laid anyways. Please - skip this place - and I used to love it!
author: Mira B.

description:
not bad if you order properly. not all things on this menu were created equally.  

anything with red sauce--pretty good.
fettucine with alfredo sauce--almost to dry and bland to speak about. but maybe great for certain children who have aversions to food with flavor.
also--i really have a major beef with even bringing the flat bread to the menu. almost any other italian place i've ever gone to has had wonderful italian bread.  but this flat one . . . ? is it on the menu because it doesn't go bad or because it saves space in storage?  i'd greatly have preferred a tortilla or crepe to that strange being...

service was passable but no one seemed happy to be there...
author: Philip L.

description:
I cannot bear to bring down the rating - really 4.5 - but rounding up.

For $12 I got one HUGE piece of meat lasagna (easily feeds 2 people with a salad).  Happy to say it was not microwaved b/c it was hot on the edges and slightly colder in the middle (minor gripe) also there were 2.5 hugs pieces of inedible - but obvious - bay leaves in my piece.

I am excited to come back and try more things, but I imagine it is crowded on most evenings. I hope they expand to other spots throughout SF.

Great spot!
author: Amy W.

description: Loved this place. It is in a quaint neighborhood. It was my first time there but I'm definitely going back when I'm in town. Their pasta is fresh...they are making it right there. Portions are decent, prices are excellent and the staff is friendly.
author: Karina H.

description: Literally the best Italian food I have ever had!  The meatballs were out of this world, melt in your mouth amazing. Hubby got the Classica sandwich and it was so light and delicious and I got the tagliatelle pasta with butter and sage. Insane!  I'm so sad i love two hours away. It's probably safer. I'd be a total fat kid living off their food the whole time. Come here!!!
author: Rebecca R.

description: An absolute gem in San Fran. Stumbled upon this place while traveling over the weekend. It was absolutely the most delicious and authentic meal I had during my visit. I recommend trying the lasagna as it is the crowd favorite and with good reason. The gnocchi roll is pretty amazing as well.
author: Kyil W.

description:
Hands down my favorite go-to Italian spot in SF. Their ingredients are so fresh. I truly have not had a bad dish there, and I have been multiple times since it opened in the Marina. 

Food highlights:
-Pesto gnocchi 
-Meatball cassone 
-Any pasta with their bolognese 

Their wine list isn't too bad either. Pair any pasta with their Sangiovese and it is a perfect meal.
author: Morgan W.

description:
Fresh pasta, wonderful sauces, friendly staff, chill hipster environment, and the possibility to watch them make the fresh pasta! I came here with my friend on a Friday afternoon and it wasn't packed at all. Two other people came after us, seeming like regulars at this place, and I'm sure if I lived around here, I'd come regularly as well. 

FOOD:
1) Pappardelle with Pesto (4/5) - This is a thicker pasta, and the texture was chewy, almost a bit too perfectly cooked for me. I think I would have preferred it a bit more cooked. The pesto sauce was very fresh - it's not those all green pesto sauces you normally get. Instead, you see the bits of basil combined with olive oil, allowing you to really appreciate the fresh pasta. Although when the portion comes, it might seem like not that much, it was very fulfilling and satisfying by the time I finished since it's quite a rich dish. 
2) Meat Ravioli with Parmigiano-Reggiano White Sauce (5/5) - My friend got this dish, I took a bite, and was quite blown away! First thing that came to my mind was the sauce - it's soooo smooth, but the cheese flavor was just amazing because you could really taste it. But at the same time, it wasn't overwhelmingly cheesy in my opinion as even when the dish cooled, you didn't see the sauce becoming denser. Then biting into the ravioli itself, you experience the chewiness of the pasta combined with the very soft, finely processed meat. I've never eaten ravioli like that - most that I've had contained your traditional ground meat texture. I thought it was great, but my friend said she preferred the ground meat texture. 

PARKING:
Can be a bit of a pain. There's a lot of street parking, but I also saw a parking lot nearby. Street parking was $2.25/hr
author: Jacqueline T.

description:
Hands down best bang for the buck in San Fran. My lady was hangry and we needed a quick fix. I didn't have time to make reservations nor did i want some white table cloth joint. I needed a hearty authentic meal and I needed it 5 minutes ago.

As luck would have it, this place popped up. You wait in line and order at the register. You then take a seat and wait for your food to be delivered. We only waited about 7 minutes in line on a Saturday at 630pm. My lasagna took less than 10 minutes to make.

It came out hot and ready to be crushed. The layers were easy to cut and the sauce was not short on meat. I gave it my best effort, but came up a little short and ended up with a to go box (As did the lady). Two meals and a side of flat bread was a total of $30.00. Tough to beat! We will definitely be back!
author: Mike O.

description:
YUM!
Looked for a place to eat some good Italian good in the city, and yelp did not do us wrong with showing us this spot! The food is so good, the workers are very nice, and the price is great for the food size! We ordered the lasagna, and it was huge and delicious! The Alfredo "white" sauce was bomb!
We tried each dessert and omg the panna cotta is to die for!!! Definitely would come back
author: L M.

description: Come for the pasta stay for the burrata. I got the gnocchi which needed a little more flavor but the burrata we got for the table was on point. My friend also got the lamb ragú special which was killer. I loved the load back atmosphere and the pasta is fresh!
author: Sarah F.

description: This place is good but not great ..so if you need a quick fix for italian you can get by here but not to take a date out too..you would think it would be way better because it looks great but it's not it's just okay and I swear my lasagna was microwaved to heat it up..not good people make it fresh.
author: David R.

description: We've had a great experience here, they serve delicious homemade pastas and other italian dishes. We've absolutely loved this place and would recommend it to everyone!
author: Kristof S.

description: I spent a year in Italy and was always amazed at how delicious the food tasted in the "mensa" of my company.   The food was simple, fresh, and unprocessed, and yet it was delicious.  Frankly it was the highlight of my work day to have lunch there.  I always wondered then how come our company cafeteria can't manage that.  Homemade is of course not a company cafeteria. It is run by Italians.  The pasta served there reminds me of the food at the mensa.   It is simple, good, and not too expensive.  It brought back fond memories of my stay in that beautifully country.
author: Will T.

description: Been wanting to try this place for the longest time and so I'm quite pleased to have finally been able to check it out. Real hip looking place.
