They have so many different options and combos that can be made with the pasta and sauce. My friend and I ordered the gnocchi with pesto sauce and the lasagna. Both were good. Probably going to try something different if I were to come back next time.
author: Annie H.

description:
I love it 

Very fresh pasta and a happy setting with lovely people.

The lasagna looked incredible, and I will try that next. We had an assortment of veggie ravioli, meat ravioli, and the special gnocchi of the day (with truffle and poached egg -- my favorite of the meal). Everything tastes like it was just made, and the price is fair!

Swing by after a stroll by the water or shopping in the marina... lovely way to end the day.
author: Kathy Z.

description: Love the food, but not the ambiance. I understand that they want to emphasize that they make their pasta, but they can remodel the area, so they can have a bigger dining area, instead having other people to wait for someone to leave - in which of cases - people don't and end up staying an hour longer because they enjoy the chitchat
author: Patrick T.

description:
Where to start? First of all, the place is pretty and has a cool vibe. Love the music by the way! The salad is super fresh and with excellent cheeses to choose from on their specials. My wife had lasagna and I tried it, perfectly cooked! My fettuccini with meatballs also really good , great portions that make for a good money value.
Will definitely come back!
author: Roberto V.

description:
OH MY PASTA! Currently still sitting in the restaurant because I can't wait to post about how amazing this place is. 

Pasta is made fresh daily and made right in front of you. You basically pick your pasta and the sauce. They have sandwiches that I want to try next! 
They also have a variety of drinks from coffee to wine. 

The atmosphere is pretty upbeat and every one is super friendly. I don't love nearby by but I definitely don't t mind making the journey just for their pasta because it's honestly the best pasta I've ever had in my life. Enjoy!
author: Andrea R.

description: I went to dinner here last night and had a great meal! I ordered the meat lasagna and my friend ordered the gnocchi with bolognese sauce. I typically have a hard time giving Italian restaurants 5 stars bc my family makes the best homemade pastas and it's hard to compare - but this place was spot on. The pasta is fresh, homemade and delicious. They have tons of different pasta options and sauces to choose from. The lasagna slice was ginormous and seriously so good - from the fresh noodles and the yummy bolognese sauce. My friend loved her gnocchi dish too. I will definitely be back and can't wait to try another dish!!
author: Samantha G.

description:
So this is the absolute worst restaurant I've ever been to in regards to customer service. The food was salty. My friend didn't even eat her meat sauce and as you can see in the pics neither did I. When I complained about how salty the food was, I was given attitude as if I was eating for free. Last time I checked, I paid for my food and if I say that is salty, is salty. I don't care if anyone else hasn't complained. Food was disgusting! And customer service was even more disgusting. I speak Italian so please if you're going to talk bad about your customers in front of them also make sure they don't speak Italian. Ignorance at its best!!! What's the point of ordering the sauce if it's not to eat it? 

Cashier has the worst attitude I've ever experience at any restaurant.
author: Peyton B.

description: Authentic Italian food, owned by Italian people. Great European style service. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. 100% recommended!
author: Eden N.

description:
Good pasta!! You can mix and match the pasta and sauce you want and there are pre-made ones as well. This review is coming a bit late, but I remember I enjoyed the pasta (good portions and flavor):) Cute area to explore after lunch as well! 

Solid Italian place.
author: Caley Z.

description: Talk about mouth watering and sensual flavors. This place has the taste of Italy! My husband and I love this place!
author: Karina V.

description: Delicious! Everything we've tried has been on point. Just a note, the dishes are on the smaller side compared to more Americanized Italian restaurants, so on the up side, you'll have room for their out-of-this-world tiramisu.
author: Adi F.

description: Went here for a work lunch with a large group. Plenty of seating and everyone loved the food. I would certainly go back.
author: Brandon B.

description:
The pasta and ravioli is fresh and cooked perfectly. The sauces are delicious and the lasagna is one of a kind.
I also love the salad with burrata. Just make sure they give you the bread if you order to go because they forgot once.
author: Couture A.

description: I came here specifically for the in house made pasta. The woman who took my order was so nice. I asked her which sauce would go best with the tagliatelle because you choose the type of pasta you desire and also the type of sauce, the butter sage or the cream. She said "the cream with Parmesan on top". Wow, was she right!  I'll definitely be coming back. Maybe as soon as tomorrow. It's hard to find fresh made pasta and sauce. This place nailed it.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
Last time I was in SF I was craving pasta so my I took my friend and me to this spot in the Marina. The ambience is very busy. Constant chatter, forks hitting plates, waiters carrying dishes, etc etc. 
The ordering process is very simple. Pick a type of pasta and your sauce, I believe you can also add a meat protein to your dish. 
Spent about $27 on the both of us, including 15% tip so yeah, I thought it was decent pricing considering the fast service yet casual dining set up. 
I had the veggie ravioli with white and marinara sauce mixed. I loved my dish, I ate it very quickly because it was delicious -- honestly. My friend went for the simple fettuccine with marinara and meat sauce. Hers was also delicious, she even took some to-go. 
Anyhoo, I'll definitely be back when I'm in SF again.
author: Bree S.

description:
Definitely one of the few places in the Bay Area serving original Italian food. 

Lasagna and tortellini are a must and for anyone who never tried a piadina, please order one and enjoy. I would definitely start with a classic, but the other options are also good.

If you're lucky you'll be listening to songs from Lucio Dalla in this very affordable place :)
author: Francesco D.

description:
Nice place to have a not that pricy Italian meal. Staffs are very happy which is good to see! Food is good (not everything but almost everything) Meatball is great and fresh, the sauce is very good, we ordered two kinds of pastas and the one with veg I sauce is a little weird to me. But the one with red sauce and meat ball is very good.

Desserts are good too.
author: Wen W.

description:
The bolognese is fantastic and the flat bread is God awful.

It's a lovely fast casual restaurant and I'd recommend it.
author: Michael C.

description:
Whoa people...this place is legit! Real Italians behind the counter!??? You literally see the pasta being rolled out in front of you...what??? The prices are fair for the City. They offer everything you could possibly want for an Italian dining experience and they aren't short changing you in any way. 

We ordered:

The burrata salad - omg what a winner, everyone orders this! Comes with this warm light pita type bread, perfect!

Papardelle with meatballs - the pasta is cooked perfectly and the texture was just right, meatballs were bomb-I think veal/beef mixture but I'm not sure

Lasagna - out of this world and a huge piece/very meaty, lasagna is a lot of work to make so I can definitely appreciate this

Tiramisu - very light and fluffy

Half bottle of Chardonnay - lighter side but delicious 

Everything hit the right spot and of course we took half of the pastas home and both had lunch the following day. What a deal! We'll be back soon...I just wish it wasn't such a belly buster :(
author: Guisela L.

description: Had a nice meal there!  Cozy little restaurant, had the fettuccine bolognese and it was very fresh and tasty!  Great spot for a quick lunch with a friend and a glass of wine.
author: Sarah P.

description:
I was running on fries and a pitcher of beer, which is terrible for a lightweight like me but I managed to stay alive and I knew I had to get something in my stomach quick.  We walked down Union St. to look for something appetizing and when I spotted Italian Homemade Company, I squealed with joy and attempted to run across the street until my friend stopped me from getting hit by a car.   Food can do that to you.

Meat Ravioli - Meaty, saucy, perfect dish to absorb all that beer

The person who took my order was super friendly and provided recommendations which was very helpful for someone who freaks out under pressure.  

We're probably going to make a trip to the other location soon and try the other pastas... let's throw in a pizza too while we're in the neighborhood.
author: Linda N.

description: It pains me to write this review; I've been a loyal customer since 2015. My boyfriend and I have had many memories here, even bringing friends and family. Food-wise, the quality has gone down and it is way overpriced for what it is, but we kept going for food in the same style of the region of Italy that my bf is from. However, after our experience last night, we will never be back. Upon ordering, you receive a paper with your name on it to put on the table. The servers call out your name and find you. Usually my bf orders, but I ordered for the first time last night. The paper has my korean name (Minjung) and when the server came out with my order, she walked around the restaurant twice with an angry face, not even attempting to call out my name or look at the tables. She went to the back and I saw her show the receipt with my name to two other Italian guys. She then made a disgusted face and said my name "minyuuuung???" like "ew what is this name". Unluckily, we were seated by the back and saw this happen. Later on, my bf told the staff that if a name is too hard for them, just say the last name or something but don't make a face, and they said something (I couldn't fully understand since it was all in Italian) about pronunciation. I came in and said that it isn't about pronunciation, I don't care if you mispronounce it, but you shouldn't make a negative face at anybody's name. A male staff member then proceeded to FOLLOW ME OUT OF THE RESTAURANT while arguing that I was wrong, I can "believe what I want" but that didn't happen (note that this guy was not even present when the incident happened) and that the server is just very expressive with her face. I said yes, she is, which is why she clearly made a NEGATIVE expression regarding my name. He then proceeded to loudly tell me that they are not racist, he has known the server for years and she is not racist, and they serve many different people of "other races" all the time. I didn't even mention racism until this point, I simply stated that she made a negative expression at my name, which my boyfriend and other people around us also saw firsthand. You can make your own conclusion as to why he had to be very defensive about being "not racist" when I hadn't even mentioned it, but to me it's very clear. There are many other great Italian restaurants to support (Bella Trattoria comes to mind); we will never be back.
author: Sally P.

description:
I love how fresh the food is!

Bacon cassone: 5 stars
Pesto ravioli: 4 stars
Lasagna: omg 6 stars if I could 

Everything is good and the ambiance is good too. The music is kind of techno which I thought was funny but it's a cool spot to have dinner with your friends or bae. You order in the front and then food comes out directly to you. 

I drove from Oakland to SF one night just because I was craving this so bad-- no regrets!
author: Kathy Z.

description:
the food was definitely yummy. i think the issue here for me was that i didn't order quite right. i'll have to come again. we got:

burrata salad - a little bit bitter? maybe it was the greens. i don't eat mixed greens too often. but also, cheeeeeese

bolognese with papardelle - meat with yummy pasta, a nice break from the lasagna

meat lasagna - meat and cheese and bechamel and yummy pasta

next time i'll order more of a variety to break up the flavors. good fresh pasta. very casual vibe.
author: Vanessa S.

description: This place is insane. Crazy good pasta. Particularly cook that you see a pasta chef rolling out fresh pasta as you walk in. You can't go wrong with much here, the pesto sauce is particularly good as is the bolognese sauce.
author: Amy M.

description:
Oh my, what a find! This place is delicious, not to be confused with the other location on Columbus because this location serves delicious wine in addition to some of the best fresh pasta I've ever ever tasted in this country and in Italy! 

You order at the counter and find a seat in their comfortable yet casual dining area. They bring you your beverages and plates or bowls of piping hot  amazing pasta with your choice of sauce. 
We ate here twice in 3 days with our friends from Seattle. Recommend the fettuccini with the bolognese sauce or butter/sage.  Meatballs are crazy yummy too. Also all staff are very nice and helpful. Our kids loved watching pasta being made right in front of them!
author: Amy G.

description: I was a little surprised by the great reviews I read for this place. To be fair, the pasta was very fresh and delicious but the sauces were really bland. I ordered pesto and it took a lot of added Parmesan and salt to melt it decent. Overall, not terrible but pretty disappointing.
author: Tara M.

description: My new favorite neighborhood spot! Pasta is great with so many options. It's also pretty affordable for how high quality the food is. Love it!
author: Christine L.

description:
I had the fettuccine and the pappardelle pasta. You could sense the freshness of the pasta! However, I wasn't impressed with the bechamel sauce of the fettuccine! It was just a sauce with no mushroom!  
Overall it's a good basic pasta place and quite cheap.
author: Haya D.

description:
Great food in generous portions.  We found it on Yelp when we were in San Francisco recently.  I don't know when we'll be back but when we return, we'll pay these guys another visit.  Hopefully we'll stay in a hotel that has a fridge and a microwave so we'll be able to take some leftovers with us.

I had the pesto, hubby had lasagna.  Needless to say, we shared.
author: Barbara H.

description: So. Freaking. Amazing. I've been thinking about this place for weeks. My mother and I ordered fettucine with pesto, pappardelle with butter and sage, and a meatball on the side. Both of the pastas and sauces were insanely good. Pesto tastes like I made it myself, which is as good as it gets, and the butter and sage had some kind of magic in it. The meatball was good, but I don't think it was crave-worthy. What blew me away, though, was that the side meatball was served in a cup of bolognese sauce!! The bolognese was so perfect that next time I'm just going to ask for a cup of that on the side so I can eat it with a spoon.
author: Rose B.

description:
I stumble upon this place when passing by it with no intentions of eating there. Simply walked by it, saw a server holding to plates of what appeared to be giant meatballs and bread he was going to serve to people sitting outside. I turned to my gf and immediately said, 'wow. That looks good!'. Then walked away.

We didn't get far. Probably 15ft, at most. Couldn't resist. So we ended up going back.

There are two of these restaraunts. One on Columbus is much more of a touristy spot and this is more for the locals -- the crowds are so different. But the service at both are great!

What I love:
Meatball platter (+the bread that comes with it)
Penna Cotta (strawberry flavor)

Only thing I don't like is the limited seating -- limited to which the are usually a lot of people here, not because the place is small. Guests usually are oblivious to the sign 'Please order BEFORE taking a seat' and end up saving seats when 10 people are ahead of them are now stuck standing. 

Still, overall, kudos. Will always be back here!
author: Angelo H.

description:
Seriously delicious. Stumbled upon it walking back to our hotel (from dinner!) and made a not to come back the next day. So glad we did. Like a little slice of Italy smack in the middle of San Francisco. Totally casual, totally authentic, and totally homemade. They don't make a big deal or production out of themselves, or their presentation. Just really good food. 
Order at the counter, and they'll bring your food when it's ready. Paper plates, nothing fancy, but if we had had more days, I would have eaten here every meal. As it was, we shared the tagliatelle with meatballs, and it was some of the best I've ever eaten outside Italy. Come hungry, and unfussy, but really, just come. You will not regret it! (Now I want to go back!)
author: Cindy B.

description:
This place (and of course the IHC in North Beach) is hands down the best authentic Italian food you can get. 

My boyfriend and I start with a piadina or cassone to share. I don't think anywhere in California makes these. So a def must try if you're in San Francisco. Also their salad with buratta is good to start with. And all of their pastas and sauces are amazing, and made fresh. You can even see them making it while you wait for your food. And watch for their specials! Trust me, you will come back! ;-) 

This location also serves wine and beer. And the espresso or caffe is done correctly here! Many places in US say they have "espresso" but it's rare to find restaurants who do it correctly and the right beans. Lastly their desserts!! Try their bombolone. It's like a donut. I like the one filled with Nutella or chocolate. But their panna cotta and tiramisù are also to die for!!

And just like the one in North Beach, the staff are incredible. Hard to say what my favorite dishes are as their gnocchi, tortellini, lasagna, ravioli, etc are so delicious. Like really bomb. If you want to try true authentic homemade pasta come here!
author: Nicole B.

description:
The food was OK but underseasoned (needed salt). Nice, al dente fresh pasta noodles. We ordered the bolognese and pesto. The pesto could have tasted a little fresher, the bolognese was pretty good. Wine list was lacking but not unusual for a fast-casual restaurant.

As we completed our order and were selecting our table, one of the hosts descended on me to tell me I had to order before I could sit. Um, dude, I ordered.

Great prices here but the ambiance and service were a little too helter-skelter for me. The loud club music, aggressive staff (the food runner walks through the restaurant YELLING people's names and mispronouncing them, perhaps a number system would be more effective??), and bright lights get a 0 for ambiance.
author: Tala D.

description:
I easily put an order in of pappardelle with Bolognese sauce throughly UberEats.  

Food came fairly quickly and was served still hot enough.  The noodles were cooked al dente and were luscious.  The mix of veal, pork and beef bolognese was hearty but doesn't make one feel too guilty eating it.  The sauce was perfectly balanced and the portion size was good for the price.  Only thing was that the most of the noodles were clumped together, but this is expected with takeout for the most part.  

I've had the original North Beach location bookmarked for a long time and glad to see them on UberEats for easy lunch delivery.  I'll definitely have to check out more of their menu offerings and hope to visit this location or the North Beach one in the near future.  Get your carb fix on at Italian Homemade Company and you won't regret it!
author: Cat C.

description: Great find. The lasagna was big enough for 2 people and so delicious.  It was double the size of any lasagna serving I've ever seen in a restaurant.
author: Bart L.

description:
Freshest pasta I know? Yep.
All pasta cooked perfectly every time? Yep.
Super fantastic staff? Yep.
Options for dietary needs? Yep.
Pretty close to authentic? Yep.
That's all I can say about that. Love yall.
author: Emily M.

description: The best homemade pasta by real Italians! They were super helpful with photos on the iPad showing us the different types of pastas and the sauces had descriptions on the menu. You definitely have to try the meatball... BEST meatball/sauce ever! If there is a line it is definitely worth the wait
author: Robyn A.

description: I don't eat pasta often, but when I do.. I like it fresh. It doesn't get anymore natural than this. Very casual, but supreme quality pasta and sauces. Choose your noodles and your flavors. The portions are big enough for two.
author: Syrah A.

description: Every time every location.....just perfect every time. The veggie raviolis are my favorite for sure but all their pastas, and the sauces I've tried have been amazin. Usually a line but it moves fast and the staff is real friendly. If you're lookin for some straight up bomb real deal Italian that's all made from scratch well OOOOOO BOY GET IN IT BRO
author: Adam W.

description: Their pasta and bolognese is amazing! Very high value- most restaurants charge co side table more for this caliber of food.
author: AJ G.

description: We're visiting San Francisco and saw high rating from Yelp so we decided to try it out but we had the worst experience ever. First, the cashier let people cut the line and ordered in front of us, then have the decency to argue with us about it. It should've been a red flag for us to leave, but we were already Uber'ed there and hungry. We finally got our food and lo behold, the food was cold. We were disappointed and will never go back or recommend this place.
author: Chicka B.

description:
Hi-ya!

We visited this restaurant and really enjoyed it for the chill atmosphere and fresh, fresh, fresh pasta!

The employees/owners must be European as they have a heavy authentic accent that really makes you feel like the food is legit haha.  Prices are reasonable, food comes out fairly quickly and was tasty.

The seating was bar stool-type (tall) and regular tables/chairs--almost family style seating.  When you first enter we saw them making the pasta with some kind of press.  A slow, but we'll practiced craft--as the noodle maker kept adding flour and or corn powder? To the pasta he was pressing (making it thinner and thinner).

They have wine and cutlery is what you would expect (reasonable silver wear and linen napkins, but they also have plastic cutlery for to-go.

Anyway it was pretty windy and cold the day we went and this place hit the spot.  We had the fettuccine pasta, and a couple of the red pastas w/ meat sauce.

Some of us thought the fettuccine was a little buttery tasting, but to be honest I don't know if that's how it's supposed to taste...compared to fettuccine @ Cheesecake Factory...sorry that's my only other real reference.

The bathrooms were clean and the interior of the restaurant felt modern, but with a wooden feel.  I dunno if your there you may know what I mean. 

Anyway, service was prompt, polite and good food. The only reason I can't say 5 stars is because of the buttery fettuccine (may be right/wrong?) and I just wish they had more table style seating vs. bar stools.
author: Ronny S.

description:
Legit place for Italian food! I am super impressed with the quality of food. Tasty homemade pasta!  I haven't dined in here yet but ordered through Caviar for lunch at work yesterday. 
I ordered the Gnocchi with Pesto sauce. This dish is a bomb. I liked the texture, which was firm and paired great with the pesto sauce which also tasted very fresh. Overall the dish was light and delicious.
I also ordered the Tiramisu which was amazing. It was very fluffy and creamy and so so good!

I will definitely be ordering from here again or dining in. Such a gem!
author: Steffi C.

description:
I love that you get to see someone a hand making the pasta at the front of the shop. I wish there was an option to buy pasta from them!

We arrived slightly before dinner time on Saturday and was happy to find there was no wait. 

You order at the front off of the menu on the wall. Then find yourself a table and wait for your food. Note water is self serve

Our food arrived pretty quickly, piping hot and we immediately dug in. 

I was really happy with my tortellini. The sauce was delicious but I did feel like I was in hailing a whole stick of butter with my meal. 

The pesto gnocchi was really pillowey. After a few bites we noted slight hints of banana

The third dish we got was certainly the largest of the three plates. It seemed like a much larger portion then the gnocchi or the tortellini, so maybe it's more bang for your buck?  Meatballs were delicious too
author: Kathy L.

description: This place is amazing! You can see them making the fresh pasta in front of the restaurant. The staff all spoke Italian and they were so friendly. When the food arrived it was hot and delicious. I got the pork tortellini with cream sauce. Wow! Everything else we ordered was also delicious. Highly impressed! The latte after dinner was also delicious.
author: Emily B.

description: Great Italian takeout!  Delivered as promised and when I opened the box, the aroma wafted out AND it tasted as good as it smelled!  Now to settle in and watch an old favorite flick...
author: Frank S.

description: Sooo goood! I recommend getting the gnocchi with white sauce. It's the best Gnocchi I've ever had!
author: Sydney M.

description:
I am a sucker with anything "homemade" in their name these days. This restaurant was actually bookmarked on my gf's account, so when we were looking for a quick bite in the area, she immediately recommended this place. The store itself has homemade pasta and sauces readily available, but you can order a plate of pasta and various other italian favorites to eat there. I opted for the tagliatelle with bolognese and meatballs.I was honestly pretty disappointed. Though the pasta was of the highest grade in quality, the sauce and meatballs were both lacking. 

Will come back if I am ever in the area to buy the frozen pasta to cook at home, and maybe try another sauce if I choose to dine in.
author: Alan N.

description: i'm picky so even tho this is rather a popular place among locals but i don't think it worths the price. almost $100 (tips incl. although self-service) for 2 ppl. just 2 spaghetti, some appetizer and beverage. problem is spaghetti so DRY, too dry to chew~ how to swallow?? size is small for $20 at this laidback setting restaurant. if it's a luxury style, then fine with the price range. atmosphere is nice :)
author: Emerson H.

description:
I love The Italian Homemade Company in North Beach so I decided to check out the location in the Marina. While the food is the same, the experience is so different. 

The vibe at the location in North Beach is charming and is one of the reasons I love going there. They use paper plates and is set up in a way where quality homemade pasta is the focus. 

The Marina version fits the neighborhood. It's a little louder, a little more upscale, and a little more dressed up. (The prices are the same though which is good!)

If you're equidistant from both locations, I'd go to the location in North Beach for the ambiance but if you're much closer to the location in North Beach and all you care about is the eating part of the dining experience, you'll be happy at either.
author: Charles L.

description:
This was one of the best Italian restaurants I've been to.  It's an unassuming little neighborhood restaurant that we wouldn't have found without Yelp (thanks y'all).  There's not a ton of seating, but we pushed together some outside tables and made it work.  

When you walk in, you'll notice right away that the "hand-pulled" pasta - always a very good sign.  

We got several different plates, all were outstanding (squid-ink dyed pasta with sole, meatballs with piadina flatbread, Italian sausage/pepper cassoni, piadini caprese, fettuccine with pesto).  

Definitely recommend this restaurant if you're in the area.
author: Matt K.

description: I came here for the first time for my friend's birthday dinner. The staff are primarily from Italy and the food is not just good, but amazing! They have various raviolis and sauces that you can mix and match. I cannot wait to go again. I enjoy that it feels like an intimate and local pasta shop where you can get authentic Italian food!
author: Paige L.

description:
I have to say that I was disappointed with my meal here. We came for lunch. You order at the counter and then the food is brought to you. We ordered one of the special salads - arugula, walnuts, pears in a very good vinaigrette and a garden salad - greens, cherry tomatoes, radishes. The first was very good, the other fine but s bit overdressed. Then my wife had fettuccine with bolognese - the pasta was good but the sauce salty. I had the vegetarian lasagna. It was so salty it was almost inedible and I only at half of it. Five hours later my mouth still feels parched. There is no reason for food to be this salty. And it is a shame because if not for that big flaw it was the best lasagna I've ever had. 

And the food wasn't inexpensive - no drinks and it was over $40 not including tip. And the entree were served on plastic dishes. For that price I don't want to feel like I'm back in my college co-op.
author: Marco M.

description: Loved that you can see them making the pasta fresh as we walked in. Bf and I both got fettuccini with pesto. The fettuccini was cooked perfectly and pesto tasted fresh. We regret not getting different dishes so that we can try something different but we would return to try the lasagna or a pasta with bolognese sauce!
author: Eva T.

description: This place is the best. It's small and casual and usually has a line out the door. The pasta is hand made and it shows. The espresso is the best I've had outside of Italy.
author: Andrew S.

description:
I came to The Italian Homemade Company with three of my friends on a Friday night. We were all excited to try it because we'd never had fresh pasta before!

I ended up ordering parpardelle (long, wide, flat noodles) with pasticciata sauce (bolognese + bechamel). Like I said, this was my first time having homemade pasta and I was so impressed! The noodles were chewy and had a texture that is incomparable to boxed pasta or even pasta you get at most restaurants (which is probably boxed pasta, now that I think about it haha). I don't think you can go wrong with any of their pasta choices. The sauce was really good too because the bechamel added a certain creaminess to it. They also have parmesan cheese and pepper flakes in little containers so you can add more to your dish!

My friends got their pastas with the meatball sauce and the pesto sauce, and I liked both! The meatball sauce seemed like the most worth it, price wise, because it came with the most meat! Definitely give that one a try if you are hungry. The pesto was also very noteworthy because you could tell how fresh it was. Definitely not from a plastic tub, probably made in a blender in the back or something. Delicious!!!

The portions are pretty big. I ended up saving half for another day! Service is also especially friendly. It seemed like the guys working were the ones that owned the place because they cared a lot if we enjoyed our meals! :-)
author: Tara A.

description:
Rustic. Pick your pasta. Pick your sauce.

Handmade pastas from raviolis to pappardelles. You see them make it right there on the counter. Then top it off with one of their sauces. LOVED the bolognese sauce. It was rich and meaty like it was cooking for hours. I ordered meatballs with my sauce to get some extra meat in there and it was amazing. 

Warning, it will give you stank breath though.
author: Jen P.

description: My friend brought me here for dinner and we had the Bresola salad and meat lasagna which was out of this world delicious!  Quaint, lively with an awesome menu.  Only downside is it can be quite loud as they shout out your name to deliver orders and tables are close together but will definitely be returning next time I'm in town. Highly recommend!!
author: I S.

description:
Super simple and tasty homemade pasta.

The pasta menu is pretty basic, decide on the pasta and choose a sauce. Any combination is most likely a winner. Serving size isn't massive, don't expect to be uncomfortable full after a meal. Price-wise it is on the more expensive side for a casual pasta, but I guess it is the price to pay for the good stuff.

Seating is bar seats and a bunch of tables beyond that. It can get busy and a bit tight at peak times but I have been able to get a seat the few times I have visited.

Service is casual and laid back, sometimes a bit confusing about whether food/drinks will find the table. Most times I have had to follow up on my ordered drinks. Am I meant to collect them immediately after ordering...? Next time...
author: Tristan L.

description:
Woooow... so good... I cry... ;______;

Thinking about it now makes me so hungry. I'm off work soon and all I want is pasta from the Italian Homemade Company. Too bad I live/work nowhere near any of their shops!

My friend suggested we eat here and we came this past weekend. She's been before but I haven't. I looked at a few pictures and reviews on Yelp and was so ready to try it out. The portions looked fairly generous for the price per plate, ~$10 more or less.

I ordered the veggie ravioli with pesto sauce. Friend ordered gnocchi with the butter cream (?) sauce. Both were so. good. I could definitely taste the fresh ingredients and quality in both. The pesto sauce was bomb and I scraped off as much as I could from my plate long after I was done with my ravioli. Maaan, I'm hungryyyy.

I do wish the portions were bigger (they look much bigger in the pictures) because I went through my plate like wildfire. They do act well as one person portions if you want a quick meal. So, if you want to share, I think ordering another plate or something would be best. I NEED to be back. So good.

Food came out quick too! Perfect for hungry bellies. You also seat yourself in their open dining space. Lots of quirky, mismatched tables and chairs. 

Ugh. Want pasta now. ;(
author: Shanise M.

description:
I had the cacio e pepe and it was very hearty and delicious. Don't let its simple appearance fool you; it's complex and flavorful and so satisfying. 
My husband's pappardelle was so good that he was planning a return trip to the restaurant after the second bite.
author: K. H.

description:
I was here with my Mom after visiting my stepdad in the hospital.  We were hungry and needed a late lunch and picked here because Mom wanted Italian and somewhere close to the ICU. 

We picked pasta and loved that we could see it being prepared in front of us.  The owners and workers were obviously native Italians.  We chose two dishes- pesto pasta and bolognese gnocchi.  Pesto was the preference-- bolognese was ok but a little boring/bland.  The gnocchi roll was some sort of specialty-- but next time I would go with the standard gnocchi.  

They brought us two salads instead of one to split (they were HUGE!) and happily refunded one.  Dessert was a Nutella donut-- enough said. 

No real ambiance here-- this is a place to get food to go or to have a casual, quick bite.
author: Katharine A.

description: They make the pasta in house from scratch and it so soooo good. Honestly some of the best pasta I've ever had in my life and i cant wait to go back!! The service was great too and the restaurant itself was very clean. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND
author: Jazmine Ö.

description: This location is much better than the original! It is consistent and the pasta comes out cooked perfectly al dente. Their bolognese is to die fore, definitely my favorite sauce.
author: Miki O.

description: I don't understand the love for this place. The pasta is just okay, I feel like I've had much better. Tried 2 different pastas because I was with a friend.
author: Varun B.

description: Decent food. This place is run by an Italian family (not very friendly) and sometimes it feels like they're discussing the customers in their native language. Also they stare a lot! Would have been a better experience if the staff weren't judgmentally glaring at you the whole time.  Also the space is very cramped and loud. The bar seats not so comfortable.
author: Nutcrackin C.

description: This place is great! My go-to dish is the fettuccine with bolognese. The portions are a good size and prices are great! I try to come here at least once a week! Try it out!!!
author: Kevin M.

description: Union St location in Cow Hollow is best pasta in California.   Made fresh daily with flavors that knocks you out.  Usually enjoy it's take out orders.
author: Eddie T.

description:
One of those low cost gems run by Italians who know their cuisine. Order at the counter and wait.  Not exactly the nicest dining area, but good for a quick meal. Pasta, Sandwiches and more.

 Picks:
Fusilli Bolognese ($16) Gluten Free and Eggless was really good. Nice rich 3-4 hour simmered ragu with tender pasta.  (beef and pork meat sauce)

Meat Lasagne ($12) was housemade and it shows. Bathed in the same bolognese sauce.  Excellent portion.

Meatball was large and delectable.

Just OK:
Regular Salad ($6) Lettuce, cherry tomatoes and carrots was pretty ordinary

Would not reorder:
None

Overall - Very Good
Food - Excellent
Decor - Good
Service - Good
Value - Excellent

Would we come back - Yes
author: Ellen H.

description: Freshest pasta and salads ever. 100% pure ingredients. Good service and cool ambience. One of the best Italian I've ever had.
author: John S.

description:
Went here with 3 friends, left all of us very disappointed. We were expecting decent food based on the Yelp reviews, but mine honestly tasted like $12 chef boyardee. The gnocchi was overcooked and the sauce was bland. Also, my friend ordered the meatballs and they came out cold
Maybe it was just a fluke but it's honestly the most disappointed I've been by a restaurant in years.
author: George M.

description: Really great food. I've never had pasta this good before. A little on the expensive side but definitely worth the price and for the portion they give you.
author: Taylor D.

description: Amazing pasta! Very fresh, with variety of pasta types and sauces. They also have other food options but i always get the pasta and would recommend the Classic Bolognese! When you want great Italian food this is your place! Plus wonderful desserts (tiramisu) and very kind staff.
author: Kayli G.

description:
Excellent portions, taste and texture.
I feel like I am in Italy.
Amazing atmosphere but it is too busy and service can be slow. Higher end fast food concept.
Desserts are amazing too tiramisu and pana cotta. I will come only if I leave work by 430!!
author: Alison W.

description: Simple yet very flavorful, quick, and delicious!  I think it truly represents all that is good about Italian cooking.
author: Courtney A.

description: If you don't like this place then you must have a brain defect. The meat raviolis are fantastic, the best I've had in years. Great value the quality is top notch. Casual stylish atmosphere. Skip north beach, come here instead.
author: Tim S.

description: Very fresh and tasty pasta! Especially the one with meatball sauce. This place is very genuine and we would definitely recommend it. Simple ingredients made really well, simple setting (order by the counter) but it works very well. We ordered a few different dishes to share, really nice.
author: Erik F.

description:
Such a great casual atmosphere which is perfect for families who want good quality food and not have to worry about how loud their children are being.  The raviolis are delicious and the rest of the menu (what we tasted) was great too.

We're definitely going to come back for another fun meal out with the family.
author: Blake B.

description:
Honestly, I love this place. Its casual, friendly and super fresh!

The vib is very easy going and Italian, meaning they talk to each other in Italian, they yell, they laugh, you feel very comfortable right away. I love that they make the pasta in front of you and just add sauce to it. Super simple, super delicious. 

If you are hungry get their lasagna, If not their specials - they are very good. 
Oh, and its great to go with kids. I don't have kids but I always think that SF is missing those places.
author: Beckett C.

description:
Love, love, love this place. It is my current, absolute favorite casual pasta restaurant!!

The pasta is made fresh every day. Choose your pasta, choose your sauce, find a place to sit. Boom. Carb heaven. I don't think you can really go wrong. Everything from their gnocchi to their ravioli is excellent.

While the concept and ingredients are simple, the quality comes through in the pasta making and the excellence of their ingredients. Just so damn good.

Great casual atmosphere that feels really authentic. Awesome service, too!
author: Cindy L.

description:
Two words: Meat Lasagna

So happy this location opened up near the Marina. I get delivery via Eat24 from TIHC on a regular basis and it never disappoints. This is some of the best lasagna I've had. Meaty, cheesy, and not overly rich. Definitely a bang for your buck too. You could probably make 2 meals out of it.
author: Kevin L.

description: update from my previous review, I've been getting their pasta and salads weekly from Uber Eats and thank God that they've improved their to-go service quality. We enjoyed their food and knows they've seriously got the most fresh pasta and salad in the Bay. Our favorite menus are their burrata salad , pappardelle pasta, strawberry panna cotta, and their latest new menu, squid ink pasta - definitely recommend it!
author: Karen C.

description:
Love, love, love this place. What draws you in is the in your face live preparation of Italian pasta. They do the pasta right at the front of their store, so you know it's authentic. You can either chose to dine in or take it to go or even buy fresh ones to cook it at home. You can tell that they are passionate about pasta because they're very particular when they sell and when you buy fresh ones. They make it certain that you put it in the freezer if you're not going to cook it right away. I also love their accents, it's like you are in Italy since most of them are Italians. 

I recommend the bolognese of the meatball sauce. All I can say is that they're not bashful in the sauce. It's like eating an all meat pizza in a pasta dish.
author: Jan R.

description: One of the best pasta dishes I've had. I ate here for the first time on a recent trip to San Francisco and it made me glad I don't live close by or else I'd be eating here weekly! I talked about my dinner for the rest of the night and the day after haha. The staff was also very friendly.
author: Marina S.

description: Really great Italian place. Quick, courteous and affectionate service and staff. Really love this authentic food, across the board solid Italian, oh yeah!
author: Tom P.

description: I've been to The Italian Homemade Company twice now, and I LOVE it! I don't want to say what I order because I think it sells out quickly. So I need there to be plenty left for me when I visit TIHC. HA! Go try this place. It's quick, staff is friendly, and it's delicious! I can't wait to go back!
author: Krystal M.

description: Absolutely loved this place. Took my little girls here and bf and we enjoyed very much. Service was fast and friendly. The ambience is lowkey italian classic but with a twist. They're pastas were definitely fresh. I recommend the meatballs and MUST get the lasagna!!!
author: Lea G.

description: Such amazing homemade food. Good atmosphere and super fast service! The servers are nice and the food is so dang good. I am Definitely gonna come back!
author: Colette H.

description: Delicious soul warming dishes just like mama would make in Italy. Ordered meatballs, sausage with peppers piadine. Meatballs were large and dense not filled an over abundance of breadcrumbs. Piadine was hot and filling. I would suggest sharing it.
author: Patricia R.

description:
Homemade fresh pasta, served to your liking. They have sandwiches too, but I didn't get to try them yet. Seemed pretty authentic, and the guys that run the place shout out in italian, so I can only assume they are legit :) I really like that you can customize the type of pasta you get, with the type of sauce and meat. There was plenty of parking when I came on a weekday night, and that's a bonus too! You walk in and pick out what you want to order at the counter, then you find yourself a seat. Since it's sort of halfway between a sit down and fast casual joint, people tend to move in and out kind of quickly, so you can find a seat fairly easily. I had the gnocci with pesto, and my friends had a pappardelle with bolognese or something like that. We both enjoyed our meals. It comes out on a simple white plate and we thought it was tiny but we quickly realized it's a lot more than it looks.

The awning of this place doesn't spell out italian homemade company, so I was confused for a tiny bit - but you'll figure it out!
author: Lily C.

description: Had a strong craving for some pasta and this place satisfied that craving well. Had iirc the fettuccine Bolognese and it was very tasty. Service was also pretty good. Left feeling extremely satisfied and an urge to come back again. Would def recommend.
author: Rukito M.

description: Awful service, very rude! I have ordered here numerous times because of good reviews, each time hoping it will be better-well it's not. They always get the order wrong, they never do anything to take care of it. The food comes cold and overly sauced. Do not recommend if looking for authentic Italian and good customer service.
author: Eva H.

description:
Amazing. Went with a simple tagliatelle & marinara sauce and was really impressed with the flavor and taste. It's a really easy process- place your order (if ordering pasta, you pick the type of pasta & accompanying sauce), take your receipt, and sit down at any available table, and they will bring your food out to you! 
Will definitely be back when I want some great Italian food - can't wait to try other pasta combinations!
author: Catherine S.

description: Had a great breakfast and a wonderful pie! We loved the atmosphere and everyone was so nice!
author: Shiran Y.

description: Phenomenal Italian food! One of the best in the city. Non traditional, you wait in line and order at a register instead of sitting and being waited. The food is unreal and very very authentic. Would highly recommend. Heads up the line can get a little long sometimes, probably because it's so delicious.
author: Andrew S.

description: This pasta was amazing! Very authentic and you can tell they spend all day making it. However be warned. This isn't the place you go for a date. We showed up thinking it was going to be a romantic dinner but it was more fast food style and served on paper plates. Would 100% eat there again but it definitely doesn't have the Italian restaurant atmosphere
author: Sarah B.

description: Pasta tasted like it was frozen and then reheated. Not much flavor in the sauces, and the consistency was poor. We had the meat lasagna and a lamb/nettle pasta special. There was too much meat in the lasagna and not much else.
author: Isaac J.

description: The garlic bread is a tortilla with seasoning on the top slice. Don't buy it! The lasagna however is good.
author: Dalton S.

description: The food is good and the service is fast, but the staff is completely unaware of how to manage the front of house. We were forced to take our pasta to go, because there were literally no seats available. Pasta does not travel. If there is a line don't bother - they will take your money with no consideration for your experience.
author: Eric R.

description:
Really enjoyed this spot in the Marina. One order of pasta per person. Tagliatelle w/ bolognese sauce was to die for). I personally really enjoyed their bursts salad as well but my mates found it a little too oily.

Come with an appetite! Best to enjoy this with a group so you can sample their other offerings. The Beignet was also very tasty!

Also- I ordered delivery via caviar after dining in their restaurant. While not as good as being there- it'll definitely the spot- abiet at a more expensive price :p
author: James L.

description:
I used Eat 24 on Yelp to order the highly reviewed meat lasagna and meat ravioli with butter sauce. 

They had a Super fast delivery, but delivered the food without utensils or napkins and had missing items. 
The food was unfortunately cold at delivery, and so it developed that greasy taste of coagulated oil. 

It was an unusual lasagna topped with a Béchamel sauce, but no cheese. It was just layers of pasta and meat with meat sauce. 
The pasta layers were way too soft and mushy. 
Totally disappointing given the high praise from Yelp reviews. 

The meat ravioli, was actually a cheese ravioli, with butter sauce. This had good flavor but the pasta was tough, not just al dente, for fresh made. 
This happens when the pasta is made days ahead or the dough is over-kneaded when it's made. 

Perhaps the food is better at the restaurant. 
If that's the case they shouldn't do delivery or they need some big improvement just keeping it hot.
author: SV L.

description: If you're looking for authentic Italian food in a chill environment friendly staff and great service, this is your spot.
author: Phil L.

description: Very good, authentic Italian food, but slow and noisy. I've had the meat lasagna and the salsiccia cassone (homemade sausage, bell peppers, onions, mozzarella), and both were very good (4.5 out of 5 stars). My fussy Italian friends are quite enthusiastic. Recommended, but be prepared to wait in a very loud environment.
author: John N.

description:
I visited a friend in San Francisco recently and she raved about how good this place was, so we came here. I really wanted to like this place because my family is Italian-Argentinean and we love pasta, especially homemade pasta. My experience, however, was utterly disappointing. I ordered tortellini, a personal favorite, with pesto sauce. My food was so bad I had to force myself to eat it just because I didn't want my friend to know I hated this restaurant she loved. The pesto was so greasy, and yes I know it's made with olive oil, and the flavor overpowering, not balanced at all. The worst part of the experience was my tortellini which were still raw. They were chewy and had that line through the middle of the dough that tells you it's severely undercooked. I tasted my friend's food to see if maybe it was just what I ordered. She had a meatball which was not good. It tasted like the meat in Moussaka, which I thought odd considering it's an Italian dish and not a Greek dish. Her pasta was still tough, but at least it was cooked more than mine. (And I like my pasta with a little bite, just not a leathery one.)

I still desperately want to like this place, because it is run by an Italian family and has authentic cuisine. Maybe if I had ordered a different sauce and my pasta hadn't been undercooked, I would feel differently. Also, don't order the Tortellini with pesto, even if you're a cheese lover: it's too much cheese and overpowering.
author: Sylvia G.

description: All I can say is wow!!!! I will definitely be back and I hope they expand closer to my home!  I had some pasta and a caprese salad with some wine.  All of it tasted fresh!
author: Ray B.

description: This is the best pasta I have ever had. I got the fettuccine noodles with white sauce. It was so so good. My sister came with me and got the fettuccine noodles with red sauce, and it was also really good. The place is small and cute. Nothing beats the Italian Homemade Company!!
author: Lauren B.

description: Favorite Italian food ever.. ravioli, lasagna,spaghetti with meatball is the best there!! Everything is made authentic
author: Missi B.

description:
Ah, I hate to be that one, but I wasn't blown away... My friend chose this place specifically because it had 4.5 stars and the experience was just very underwhelming to me, which makes me sad because I was pretty excited. 

Upon entering it's very easy to see that this place is a little more on the modern side. As with most places the struggle for space is real. A lot of small tables and a sign asking you to not save seats, but wait until you order. Although the person behind us didn't do that and ended up taking the seat we were going to go for... 

Tortellini was sold out that night as was a specific sauce, disappointed that I couldn't try the tortellini but I had other options. 

My friend got the meat ball ravioli with meatballs and I got the Gnocchi with white sauce (bechamel/cream/butter). 

Service from the cashier was nice, nothing to complain about or praise. Although do not expect any other service really, this is like a hybrid of a quick serve type place. Aside from a worker/manager over hearing my friend ask my opinion of the place and attempting to see if we were satisfied no one will refill things or ask if everything is alright. It's a get in and out type of system for them to provide the most turnaround for their tables. 

I'll start with the positive. 

Meatballs: Really good. It was my favorite part of both our meals and I didn't even order it. Very savory and good flavor. They weren't as juicy as I think some would expect, but they weren't dry, overall most enjoyable part. 

My friend said his ravioli was okay, he wasn't as blown away as he thought he would be by the reviews and this was exactly how I felt about my gnocchi. 

I love gnocchi and I know the texture it should be and mine was mushy. Even my friend who doesn't eat that much italian said it was on the softer side. There was a lack of firmness that made it taste very mashed potato-y. I could obviously have had it sent back and asked for a new one, but what if that was just how they made it? I also didn't want to wait again for a plate of food considering the line of people, so I ate it. Now I'm not saying it was awful, but the plate was just very underwhelming compared to what people say. The sauce for me was too light and the gnocchi was too soft. Adding salt and pepper helped with flavor, but the texture was a big disappointment. 

Perhaps it was bad luck or maybe we didn't choose the right dishes, but I had higher hopes unfortunately. I don't know if we will be back, but I'm glad to have tried the place out at least.
author: Jay K.

description: This is by far the best Italian food I have had. And I visit Italian food restaurants often being that it is my favorite. I had the lasagne noodles and they were made fresh. The taste is so different when made fresh! Soft tender and doughy! Yummmm! The meat sauce was so delicious and the portion size was HUGE!! My husband had the Gnocchi with duck sauce and he said he was super pleased with he flavors. My children had the ravioli and they said the pasta was also so fresh tasting it gave it a whole different meaning to pasta. Service was friendly, very inviting. Super authentic. Prices were very reasonable for the effort they pour into their dishes!! A definite must when visiting San Fransisco!! Its a Gem!!
author: Arleene Z.

description: Best pasta ever!!!! The meat lasagna, meatballs and gnocchi are my favs, but you honestly can't go wrong here. Homemade pasta where you can see them making it is the absolute best. I've taken so many friends and family members here and everyone is always obsessed. I always crave the pasta so I'll be back again so. :-)
author: Jackie G.

description: As always, fresh and good ingredients make up for a great meal. This place has all of that and add great people and ambience!!! Loved it!!!!
author: Agustin D.

description: Love everything here and would eat here every week if I could. Best homemade pasta. Delivery and wait time makes it not as good so I'd prefer to eat in.
author: Liz F.

description: came here on a friday night with my bf because i've been eyeing this place!! surprised that we really didn't need to wait for a table after we ordered. my bf got the meatballs and bolognese sauce with thick pasta and i got the butter and sage with thicker pasta haha i forgot what the pasta was called. when my bf got his meatballs, the outside was pretty hot but the inside was cold which possibly meant that they probably used a microwave? i was surprised because i thought this place was going to rock off my socks!! when i got my butter and sage pasta, i really didn't know what i was ordering but i saw a decent amount of pictures on yelp with butter and sage. it was okaaaaay. tbh i didn't really enjoy it because it had quite a weird taste to it. maybe i was not into sage at all. my bf and i thought it taste like the inside of a clean bathroom hahaha but i also read reviews where people enjoyed the butter and sage so i guess to each their own. the place however is very aesthetically pleasing!! very instagram worthy hahah. also i thought my pasta would be made fresh but it wasn't.. i saw a bunch of pasta just sitting in the fridge after it was cut :(
author: diane d.

description:
This is fresh, handmade pasta, as authentic as it gets. 

You choose from about 5 different types of pasta and sauces. Everything is priced a la carte. They also have sandwiches, salads and lasagna. Everyone seemed to order pasta which was what I was here for too.

I got the gnocchi with brown butter sage sauce. The gnocchi was light and fluffy and the sauce was well done. The sauce was nice and rich, though maybe a little more sage would have been nice. I also paired it with a sangiovese and my friend and I split a garden salad.

Just a warning, the flatbread with meatballs etc isn't a flatbread sandwich. The flatbread is very thin, more like a tortilla. My friend was surprised but not displeased.

The prices here are reasonable but can add up. The gnocchi and wine plus tax and 15% tip were $27. My choice to get a $10 wine of course but just be aware it may add up faster than the a la carte prices look like they would.

All in all, I'm so glad I found the most authentic Italian meal I've had in a while!
author: Ninette C.

description:
Italian Homemade Company's pasta dishes a plate-licking good. Absolutely delicious. You can tell the pasta is fresh and the sauces handmade. I've tried four of their dishes now. All amazing. I felt a wave of melancholy during my final bites. Didn't want the meal to end!

The space itself is narrow but engaging as you can watch them make fresh pasta while you wait. It's decorated simply but strike a clear note as a modern Italian kitchen. Not a ton of seats but enough for a reasonably busy night. 

The only ding was that the waiters struggle to handle busy crowds. We asked for Parmesan twice and never received it and someone else's flotsam decorated the table we took the entire meal. Not a biggie, as the waiters were polite and reasonably attentive. But a bit of a disappointment as I wouldn't have considered the crowds overwhelming.
author: Christopher M.

description: Great family place, real real Italian style. The family is super welcoming and service was great. Totally recommend trying this place out if you want real great cultural food.
author: Jeff S.

description: Food was great! Wished they had cold soft drinks, but outdoor seating was nice. We had the lasagne and fettuccine with bolongese sauce with Meatballs, which were all tasty and huge portions!
author: Sarah B.

description: Delicious lasagna, not to heavy, just plain ol' yummy! Loved the atmosphere and the pasta making.
author: Faby M.

description: This review is for delivery.  Ordered pappardelle with pesto, veggie ravioli with marinara, and tagliatelle with meatballs & meat sauce.  Delivered using UberEATS and all the pastas are fresh and hot.  YUM!
author: Kayla N.

description: The food was delicious and fast! We had the papardelle w/ Bolognese sauce and it was scrumptious. My son had the meatballs and they were to die for.
author: Heather P.

description:
Great food, amazing service. The manager noticed I didn't like what I ordered (gnocchi with baby squid - was kind of tasteless) and offered anything else from the menu. Because of the price difference we even got a free dessert, totaling more than what we originally paid.
The lasagna I eventually got was really good and the vegi pesto ravioli my wife got was tasty. 5/5.
author: Ran B.

description:
I'm from southern California and I wish we had a place like this one here, this place is delicious and has great customer service. We had the cheese ravioli with marinara sauce, spaghetti with meatballs, meat lasagna and a greens salad. To drink I had an orange Pellegrino and for desert, I had the strawberry Ricotta.

The owners are from Italy and they are very welcoming, they make everything from scratch and prepare the pasta right in front of you. 

If you want good tasting, real Italian food you have to try this place when in the area. I highly recommend it.
author: Susie K.

description:
Love the food here, especially love the lasagne.  Definitely tastes better when dining in instead of having it delivered (portion sizes the same but it wasn't warm and gooey).

Would recommend and come again! Still love the lasagne so hard for me to want to order anything else.
author: Siv L.

description: The food here is amazing and the price is just right especially for San Francisco. If you want some of the best tasting lasagna you have ever had in your life this is the place to go. The environment is wonderful with a wait staff that hails from Italy as told by their accents. Everyone in the entire restaurant is friendly and the vibe is hip busy and bustling. If you want a meal that is worthy of any expensive restaurant in San Francisco for the price of a fast food dinner this is the place to come.
author: Mike K.

description: This is a surprisingly tasty and easy place to grab a quick, filling, & affordable meal in this area. The pasta is very fresh and lovely, the sauces simple and straight forward. Eating at the restaurant tends to be crowded and loud and feels a bit rushed- I prefer getting my pasta and sauce to go and making it at home.
author: saru k.

description:
4 stars based on how legit these noodles were! I got the lasagna (meat) and my favorite part was definitely the noodles. Lasagna can be a gamble for me because I don't really like ground beef and prefer sausage or sometimes vegetarian more. But the reviews were good and I always like to try a lasagna the way it's suppose to be made at least once, in hopes of finding the best one out there.

There were reviews saying it's too salty and I can see where they are coming from. It is on the saltier side, but for someone who is sensitive to salt, I wasn't too offended with the salt level. The amount of meat that was on this dish was insane though. More than I cared for, so I scraped some off. It also wasn't as cheesy or saucy as I would like. Most of the flavor came from the meat, and it was in fact sitting in a puddle of grease from the ground beef.

Yet, I am still giving this place 4 stars because I knew what I was getting myself into when I ordered this dish. And I know for next time whatever I'll let myself order something that is sure to please.

A little about the experience:

There was a long line, but it's not ridiculously slow or anything. You can watch the pasta dude roll out long sheets of pasta while you wait! Prices weren't bad. $10-15 for pasta depending on the noodle and sauce. Carafes of wine were in the $21-25 range and only served 3 (somewhat small in my opinion) glasses.

After you order you find a table, which can be a tad tricky but the food comes out reasonably fast so people are in and out. 

It seemed like all the workers were legit Italians too, so that added to the authenticity of this place!
author: Kelly G.

description: What a great place! Pasta is made fresh, and the kids (and adults) can enjoy watching the whole process. Food was great, service was great, we all really enjoyed it!
author: Jeremy M.

description:
Good fresh pasta. The sauces aren't bad but they aren't very consistent at this restaurant. On two different occasions I ordered pappardelle with butter and sage sauce and each time the sauce had a different consistency. My only other complaint is they are VERY STINGY on their wine pours! For the price they are charging per glass you'd think they could be a bit more generous (or fair).

Overall, however, a solid place to get a good plate of pasta.
author: Steven P.

description:
Noodles are excellent. Piadina is okay. I must get around to buying the noodles and pesto sauce separately to go to make at home!

I love that it's casual, easy, and no-fuss to get in and out.
author: Victoria C.

description: This place is SO DELICIOUS! I've gotten take out from here and eaten in house. I always get the pappardelle with bolognese sauce and it does not disappoint. Their pasta is definitely homemade and fresh. Got their burrata salad once and the portion was generous. This place will definitely be my go to whenever I'm craving pasta.
author: Yuxuan N.

description:
I super love you guys!

I've only ordered takeout (THANK YOU EAT24, you're best. better than all the rest. i'm lookin at you caviar and postmates.) It's always fantastic, arrives hot, and you don't play with me on portion size. Affordable in this pricy area I can barely afford....yes, I love you. Thanks a bunch for the Italian comfort goodness food!
author: Jane R.

description:
This place is the real deal. I was coming back from Italy where I ate the most amazing fresh pasta and pizza, and was craving some REAL Italian pasta. I had heard about that place which is in up the street from me, and never went. Now I am asking myself: why did I not go before???
The pasta is truly fresh and delicious - I felt like I was in Italy again! I especially like that you can choose your own pasta and choose the sauce - unlike any other Italian restaurant. I had the parpadelle with pesto the first time - I wasn't able to finish because their portion was BIG. This week I had the fettucine with marinara. But really they are so good, that you could even eat them without sauce.
author: Caroline V.

description: This place is way overrated. Service is indifferent and even hostile at times. Seating reminds one of the worst moments in a high school lab. Food? It is OK but not that good. Nothing memorable.
author: Bill B.

description: This really is an authentic Italian with GREAT food. I had the veggie lasagne and it was the best one I ever had! Also very nice and handsome guys working here  And the prices are fair. Busstop 45 is right in front of their doorstep.
author: Ive B.

description:
You know a place is exceptional when:
1. You eat there once and dream of going back there. Again. And again!
2. The dishes is so tasty and desserts so angelic, soft and fluffy that a friend who talks way too much, has no words to explain her wonder (the remaining two sneakily finishing it off, while she pauses on account of her brain freeze).
3. 'Sharing is caring'- What is that? (Refer to point number 2)

The dishes that led to the above love are:
Veg Ravioli (Spinach and Ricotta Cheese filling) $12
Veg Lasagna (Asparagus, Zucchini and 4 kinds of cheese) $13
Tiramisu (Don't know what they put in there, but it was soooooo GOOD!)

Yaaaaas Queeeen!
author: Shruti D.

description: Pasta is deliciously fresh and tasty. You have a huge selection to choose from as well and the restaurant is very cute. This place is dangerous for me since I have a weakness for carbs soaked in cheesy sauce, but if dieting wasn't an issue, I'd probably be here once a week. All their pastas and sauces are pretty yummy and you can mix and match. OH!  And I also love that they're available on Eat24 -- lifesaver for those lazy days when I don't know what to cook.
author: Jenn N.

description: By far the best pasta I've had in a long time.  This place is all about their fresh pasta.  Small menu and operated by actual Italian guys.  This is a try place.
author: Alan W.

description: For me it's not as I expected ,although I wanted to dine there in a long time. I ordered the fettuccine with white sauce it was pretty average but one of my family ordered the veggie ravioli which I tried and it was very delicious.
author: Talal A.

description: This place has never failed!! Talk about awesome pasta, great sauce, and cool spot to visit. I always recommend this place to people who want to try good pasta without paying restaurant prices.
author: Danny F.

description: This was my first time having Italian food in sf. I wasn't too sure but I saw so many positive reviews that I just had to check it out. The staff was very friendly, and the Italian accent just made the environment of the restaurant so realistic. I love how they have vegetarian options! I tried the vegetarian lasagna and it was delicious! It was more on the creamier side which isn't my preference but it was still very tasty!
author: Navroop K.

description: Best pasta I have ever had! I had the veggie lasagna and hubby had the pesto gnocchi. Small busy place, a few tables outside. The pasta, sauces, and everything else made there. Defiantly going back!
author: Dee A.

description:
I know how superior freshly made pasta can be as I on occasion make it myself.  You see them making the dough and various pastas on their website so I had to try it.  I had their meat lasagna and my date had the pappardelle with the sage and butter sauce.  You definitely notice the freshness of the noodles with the lighter sauce but both were excellent and the pappardelle was perfectly al dente.  

Fresh pasta cooks fast so be ready to eat soon after ordering.  We also had their Burrata which was just okay.  Bring a bottle of wine as corkage is just $10.  Staff is super friendly and checked up on us often.
author: Steve C.

description: A little salty and my order was not made as I asked, I asked for pesto and marinara and just got pesto and asked for no cheese on my pasta or meatballs and got cheese on it. It was ok if you ask me.
author: Foodie S.

description:
My wife and I were visiting SF and just walking around town when we got hungry.  We saw this place and decided to give it a try.  The best decision we made on our trip!!!  The food was authentic and incredibly good!  A little pricey but so what!  It's worth every cent!

We had an awesome salad with delicious arugula, pears, walnuts, and asiago cheese.  We enjoyed some delicious Cassoni Sandwiches which included bacon, sausage, potatoes, and a few other fresh mouthwatering ingredients.  Our meal was exquisite!!!  I read some other Yelp reviews mention that the food was too salty.  My wife and I actually thought they seasoned it Just Right!!!  Drink lots of water later, you'll be perfectly fine.

Laura was our server and was very courteous, friendly, and helpful.  Great customer service from the time we walked through the front door.  Maddie was the cashier and was efficient, polite, and classy.  We definitely look forward to coming back.  Too bad there's not an Italian Homemade Company anywhere in L.A.  That would be the business!
author: Eli W.

description: Delicious fresh handmade pasta ( we had to wait 30 mins for it). We had the veggie ravioli with white sauce and parmesan- and it was delicious! Don't eat here if you're in a hurry.
author: Kristina A.

description:
You know you are in the right Italian spot if the workers there are yelling and speaking in Italian.
Before I write a yelp review and judge a place I like visit a place more than once. And after coming here many many times I can say that It is absolutely one of the best and most authentic Italian food I have ever eaten. It all tastes fresh, homemade, and the flavours are amazing, it seems to me they make everything in that kitchen from scratch. 
I would also recommend the Tiramisu, and believe me when I say that I am not a fan of those desserts, but the ones they make are an absolute exception. 
I highly recommend coming here if you are in the area. 
Another thing to mention, the place is not like a restaurant, no table service. You simply order your food from the cashier, pick a table, and a food runner comes and drops your food off when it is ready.
author: David G.

description: Absolutely delish!  My husband had the meat lasagna, I had the meatballs, my son had the their version of a calzone (made with flatbread). Everything is fresh and full of flavor.  Next time we're back in SF, we'll definitely come back!!
author: Shannon T.

description: My 2nd Time here. The lasagne is outstanding... the ravioli is so good too. Always packed.  Today's food was so good although cool in the middle. Couldn't be assed to hav it re heated. Otherwise it hadn't put me off coming back again. Delicious
author: honey k.

description: This place is for the customers you see there: post-college kids who don't mind overpriced pasta that isn't much better than what you get at the supermarket. If you don't feel like boiling noodles and warming sauce (and you can get fresh pasta & sauce at many markets in SF), there are many better places to get pasta. Consider the source when reading these reviews. If you're looking for a quality meal then find somewhere else.
author: Ruth C.

description: Al dente, love. Pick a pasta, pick a sauce, and there you go. Its not a 'dining' establishment. It is on the casual side and all about the ingredients. Quality ingredients and freshly made pasta is what you get, lovely execution, spacious eating areas and fresh creations. Ace!
author: Juls C.

description: My friend recommend me this place and we both got the lasagna. It was so huge and very delicious. For a $13+tax lasagna, it was very worth it and filling. The cashier was so friendly too! I would definitely come here again.
author: Kathy D.

description:
Love the simple yet flavorful Italian dishes IHC offers. At first the price might intimidate you, but when you see the portion and have your first bite, you forget about that first doubt as you work your way to food coma with more left for later.

Even though the Marina has a particular reputation for the demographic that populates the neighborhood, this spot is unpretentious and welcoming. I would recommend this place to everyone who simply enjoys classic dishes made by exceptional folks who runs IHC.

The only negative thing I would say is that they don't have a location near my office!
author: William Y.

description: Their Lasagna is quite delicious. Been coming here more and more now because I've heard that their Lasagna is authentic. I was super amazed by how big the slices are and how juicy it was. Defiantly worth a try. The price, not really worth it. The Lasagna itself is delicious though.
author: Winnie H.

description: Great restaurant! Went back two nights in a row! Simple menu but loads of pasta to choose from. All homemade! Lasagne is a big portion and delicious! Tagliatelle with pesto was amazing. Cooked perfectly and the food comes out quickly! Friendly staff and casual atmosphere. Definitely worth a visit!
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Food 5++   I had fettuccine with pesto sauce and that is the one of the best pasta I've had in the city! Also tiramisu was super light and tasty.  I want to try all menu so def I will come back soon!
Ambience 4 
Service 4 
Price 5
author: Tory T.

description:
OMG. So good! Ordering was easy...at the counter. They bring the food to you. It came out super fast and served hot. Noodles were cooked perfectly. I got the parpadelle with pesto (so good). My friends got different variations and we shared off each other. 

You basically pick the pasta and the sauce. Simple and classic. I will come back!
author: Katie Anne N.

description: I liked the ambiance of this place. The pasta and sauce was really good but the meatballs were just ok. I love that they sell Coke in a bottle and serve it in a wine glass with ice lol
author: Gracie N.

description: My husband, baby, and I grab food from here at least once a week. Great service and great food. It's also very fresh and you can see them make pasta while you're waiting in line.
author: Denise K.

description: Unbelievable pasta that's made fresh to order as well as the butter with sage sauce for the ravioli. Service 5 stars, food 5 stars, two thumbs up.
author: Tim J.

description:
Wonderful choice for everyone - they have vegetarian and gluten free options. There are two locations in SF, this one in the Cow Hollow/Marina area is larger and has more seating and more food choices than the location in North Beach.

You pick a pasta then you pick a sauce - the glutenous pastas are homemade in house and the gluten free pasta is cooked separately and imported from Europe. The burrata salad was amazing, the perfect amount of creamy and sweet paired with greens. I have never had a bad meal here, simple but good quality food. 

Gluten free notes: I didn't get sick here, I am confident in their cleanliness and consideration for cross contamination. Italian food always makes me nervous, but not here.
author: Shannon Z.

description: Excuse me, I have died and gone to carb heaven.  My sister found this spot when we were wandering around the sitting looking for lunch.  Right when you walk in, you see them making the pasta on your right.  The menu is simple, you choose your noodle, sauce, and any other add ons.  They also have other entree options to choose from.  My family (group of 5), all got different items, pastas, ravioli, meatballs, etc.  I had a bite of each and omg they were all amazing.  It was so fresh, simple, and delicious.  The interior is small, but not cramped, and very welcoming.  The portions are also HUGE, so prepare yourself for left overs.
author: Madeline S.

description: I came here cause of all the great reviews... it was ok.... I thought it was good but kinda bland. Nothing to write home about.
author: Fred M.

description:
I admit we geeked out a little hard on the "homemade" part of this eatery's name. And we communicated our excitement to each other using only wide eyes & dancing eyebrows when we heard two separate Mommies ahead of us order frozen pastas & ready-made sauces for dinner tonight. This place had to be good.

We each ordered a special: mushroom with a rigatoni-shaped pasta for him, puttanesca for me with a spaghetti-like pasta. (My apologies, I can't recall their carbolicious names.) 

When the plates were brought to our communal table, we noted the skimpy serving size first & the fishy aroma wafting off of the puttanesca second. I ordered it knowing there were anchovies in the recipe, but wasn't concerned because I'd had this dish (& other dishes containing anchovies) before. Offensive to the point of not being able to take more than two bites; I got a fishy, greasy taste with both forkfuls. I took several bites of his pasta just to get the taste out of my mouth. His dish was simple & good, but the one-note flavor profile was not exciting to him.
