My order was definitely a mistake; I should've stuck with ingredients like butter, oil, or marinara knowing how picky I am. I'd give them another try because I like the idea of creating my own pasta/sauce combo...pappardelle with butter next time, perhaps.
author: Fancypants X.

description: I really like this place. Very simple dishes made with love. Brought a friend here because we were on a pasta kick. The wait was long but worth it. We ordered the meatballs , papadella with bolonese sauce and a pesto gnocchi . All really good. Would recommend this place for a solid meal .
author: Jackie N.

description:
Without a doubt this is one of the best places in the city you can get authentic, homemade Italian pasta. SO good! The staff here know their pasta. They are all badass Italian guys and gals that have a passion for their food. They don't work just to work, they truly care about making a great quality product- and they deliver! 

The service is fantastic as well. You walk up to the counter, pick a pasta type, pick a sauce, sit down and they'll have your order done in 5 minutes. Simple and to the point which makes it a perfect spot for a quick lunch.

Overall, this spot is a gem. $10-12 for an amazing and filling meal that truly makes you feel like you're in Italy. The staff are all very friendly and the location is great. You won't be disappointed when you leave.
author: Alex B.

description: Hands down the best Italian pasta in town!!! The food was incredible and coming from an Italian family myself...I've never had a meatball that could compete with my grandmothers... until now...I've official found the place that beats hers!! It was magnifico!
author: Laura A.

description: Amazing ravioli. Quick service. Lovely restaurant. My only complaint is I wish they served wine.
author: Stoyan F.

description: Found the perfect lasagna stop while searching for Pokemon with my daughter. She is damn picky and fell in love with it. Also tried the prosciutto sandwich which was outta bounds. Awesome. I'm gonna' have to take some lasagna to go.
author: Carlos F.

description:
It's hard to find a legitimate bite of Italy in San Francisco without spending an arm and a leg. But look no further. Call off the search party.

Surrounded by sinful Marina bros and trust fund vixens, a Young Goodman Brown such as myself found an oasis in The Italian Homemade Company. A diamond in the rough, if you will.

Fresh pasta and friendly employees with Italian accents, this little slice of heaven had me salivating when I walked in the door. I opted for the fettuccine bolognese, a reliable staple. I received about a pound of food and it was truly delicious. Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese is a must. It was just what the doctor ordered. And now I'm Jonesing for more.

Pro tip: while your dish is being prepared, walk 3 doors down to the Bus Stop for a man soda or Appletini.

Lastly, this spot is fairly priced and doesn't skimp. What more can a growing boy ask more? Buon appetito!
author: Sean J.

description: This is the most amazing pasta place I've ever eaten at. We were walking by on our way to eat in Chinatown but saw the pasta and couldn't pass it by. We had the fettuccine  with pesto which fed two people. All the people inside are so friendly and accommodating. Whenever we are in SF we will definitely be back!
author: Emily W.

description: Wow I knew this was going to be an amazing experiences soon as we walked in! While waiting in line we watch them make homemade pasta right in front of us while trying to decide what to order !!! SUPER AFFORDABLE and SO DELICIOUS!!! Five star spot.
author: Brooke A.

description:
Freshly Made Authentic Italian Pasta 

With its friendly Italian owners, casual setting, and delicious food, the Italian Homemade Company is a great dinner place any night of the week. My boyfriend and I occassionally walk down Union Street to window shop. One particular night, we stood from outside the restaurant, reading the chalk board menu. A friendly woman passing by highly recommended the restaurant. Although we didn't go in that night, the restaurant was on the top of our list for weeks. We finally had dinner at Italian Homemade last night, and we were not disappointed!

Gnocchi with white sauce (paired with Birre beer) - small, delicious, pillows with creamy, but not thick sauce. The beer was a nice compliment, similar to a Belgian white, but in my opinion, much better!

Meat ravioli with meat sauce (red) - perfect al dente, great for any meat lover, and  noticeably fresh ingredients. I especially liked the thinnest of the ravioli, which made it less doughy in texture like typical ravioli you'd find in most restaurants.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Food is delicious! Me and my friend got the meat lasagna.
There is a lot of amazing food in the plate in front of you, I love it haha!
author: Fabien L.

description: This place has great, authentic, homemade pasta. It's cafe style and you choose your pasta, sauces, etc. The pesto with gnocchi was excellent! We also tried Pappardelle with Pasticciatta sauce. This was also excellent although it could maybe have used a little more spice. We tried the caprese salad and the burrata salad. Both were excellent although we preferred the burrata salad.
author: Julia T.

description: The pesto gnocchi was great and the service was as well. My caprese salad could of used more balsamic and a bigger menu would be nice.  Great for the price!
author: Breana W.

description: Cute place and friendly staff, order was ready quick but it was Togo and by bag was sort of drenched in oil making it a messy ride home. We had the lasagna which flavor was ok but it was really mushy , then the meat raviolis with pest which I have a feeling would have been good fresh but I had to rehear by the time I got home and it was really chewy. So for sure recommend eating in and not taking out.
author: Katie W.

description:
I have no shame at all admitting I've been to this place 3 times in one week... If you want real deal pasta served by legit Italian men then look no further! 
Their pasta and sauces are amazing! 
I've had the pappardelle, fettuccine,tagliatelle, and ravioli pasta. Their all delicious and cooked to perfection. 
Do NOT miss out on getting their meatballs or tiramisu for dessert! 
Can't wait to stuff my face with fresh pasta again sometime very soon...
author: Camille B.

description: No way will I return to this place service sucked, you don't even get Bread with your fucking meal,  this place is totally. For hipsters who don't  give a shit about Service and what they're really eating the bolognese was oily grrrr over rated
author: Luna R.

description: Went on a Friday night and it was pretty busy but not that bad. Got a spaghetti with meat sauce and meat balls,I definitely should have phoned in the order ahead. It might take a bit to find seating. Can't beat the price. Food was fresh and delicious. Would definitely come back. Real deal Italian.
author: Mario H.

description: What an amazing little spot!! The pasta was incredible, the staff was welcoming, even the music was perfect. I highly recommend this to anyone who is hungry and in the area! :)
author: Lea V.

description: Food is excellent. The only problem is you want a little more after you're done eating.  Portions are not generous but the pasta is definitely homemade and very very good.
author: J. W.

description:
Literally:  AS GOOD AS IT GETS!
UPDATE: Their meat Lasagna is EXCELLENT, there are layers and layers and layers of homemade noodles and delicious sauce, not too tart, just enough savory with a hint of sweet! The gnocchi is awesome, OMG so tender, so excellent, melts in your mouth! 
Did I mention the lasagna is excellent???? and the gnocchi is awesome! 
I have brought my friends here and they love it too! 
Previous review:  
Awesome food! Pasta and sauce were 5 stars!!! Flatbread, ravioli! Awesome! Cream sauce was  tasty, meatball delicious!!  Cant wait to go back!
author: Rose M.

description:
If you love the idea of a restaurant that does one thing really well. This is your place. Choose from a selection of fresh pastas made onsite by hand and tossed with one of a handful of sauce options. I was glad to be here with my parents and brother, everyone open to sharing. We tried the special of the day- spaghetti with cacio and pepe (cheese and pepper, very good), the talgliatelli with marinara sauce (fine, but not my fave), and my fave the paparadelle with butter and sage sauce (yum!!!). The pastas were all perfectly cooked with just the right amount of springiness when you bit into them. 

We also split 3 salads. First least to most fave (1) the roasted tomato salad which was basically a single piece of tomato topped with toasted breadcrumbs over mixed greens, (2) the special of the day- arugula salad with chunks of asiago cheese and lots of sliced red pear. Unfortunately, they loaded it with pine nuts (yuck) instead of the promised walnuts, but I was able to pick around them, (3) definitely do not miss the burrata salad- mixed green salad topped with a good size chunk of creamy fresh goodness. I asked for dressing on the side since I find places typically put too much for my taste, but the small dishes of oil and vinegar provided were tough to stir into a dressing. No matter, the greens were fresh and though a splash of vinegar would have been great, the salad was actually fine without. I didn't love the flat triangles of bread that came with the salads- we ended up leaving most all of it behind. There wasn't enough sauce for dipping and we were all pretty full by the end anyway.

Seating is pretty limited, but we were lucky to grab a table just walking in on a Friday night around 7:00. Staff was friendly and welcoming, checking on us a few times. Definitely would return to try the lasagna and the gnocchi roll. Or just another plate of the papardelle!
author: Ryen B.

description:
We were thrilled when our favorite pasta dive in North Beach opened it's doors in the Marina so we no longer have to trudge up the hills after dining there.  The food lives up to it's name.  Fresh pasta made on the premise, tossed in a sauce you desire.  Simple concept but well executed. The portions are not large but you will leave full and content.  The interior reminds me of a non-Costco version of Mario Batali's Eataly.  Good food and wine for those who want to dine in with an assortment of olive oil and etc if you want to take something home.  

Only complaint is that the gnocchi rolls were not thoroughly heated during our last visit.  It's just a hitch and the free flatbread offered during our wait made up for this.
author: Amy J.

description:
I had this for dinner last night and I'm still thinking about it! I've been eyeing this spot for a couple months now and I can't believe I waited this long to try it!

A friend and I ordered the meat ravioli with meat balls, veggie ravioli with the bolognese and (can't remember what the other part was called) sauce, and the gnocchi roll. 

Their pasta was so fresh, their sauce was perfect, and the meatballs were to die for! We decided we were coming back to try their other pasta and sauces and definitely the lasagna!
author: Dara S.

description: Way delicious. The lasagna is so amazing, some sort of creamy amazing goodness. And the pasta is good stuff yo
author: Marc G.

description:
The food here is incredible and the freshest pasta I've experienced. I would definitely come back again. 

The only knock I have about this place is the attitude of the staff. None of them are friendly and it feels a little snooty. The food balances that out.
author: Jason S.

description: Ordered delivery from this place and had high hopes. I ordered papardelle bolognese and pesto tagliatelle. Both pastas were undercooked, which with fresh pasta is not pleasant. Both sauces were also completely flavorless. The sauces had nothing to them. The pesto had tons of basil, but no salt so it barely tasted like anything and the bolognese was pretty much the same. No flavor at all.
author: Thomas E.

description:
1) The space is cute, albeit much more causal than I was expecting. But that's my fault for not looking at the pictures more closely. 

2) The pasta itself was super fresh and great. The only highlight of the meal.  

3) The marinara sauce was bland and completely uninspiring. Even some salt would've help lift the acid out of the San Marzanos. I feel like those poor tomatoes died in vain!

4) Cassone - we got the spinach, mozzerella and potato. Sure it's a weird combination, but let's give it a shot. Bland again. 

5) Service is incredibly limited, you order at a counter, but they bring you the food. You get your own beverages. Still the staff was friendly, though I wouldn't call them servers. 

Overall, Italian Homemade gets a two in my book, and I won't be going back.
author: Dimple B.

description: Amazing little spot! Just came here on a Saturday night for dinner randomly after social presidio club was closed for a private event. Brilliant concept of a make your own combination Italian/pasta restaurant that has been tried several times in SF in places like Nostra and have failed. Super reasonably priced, quick counter service but still a nice dinner ambiance. Delivered fast and piping hot even though it was packed house, which is a rarity at a restaurant in SF on a busy Saturday night. Can't wait to come back again to try different combinations.
author: saachi d.

description:
Who doesn't like fresh pasta and really good Italian food? Well this place has it! They make their own pasta fresh all day. You can watch the guy make it when you come in. This makes such a difference!  They have different sauces you can choose from for your pasta. The staff are friendly and the place is casual. I usually order for takeout since  the place is usually crowded we're just a few doors down. There is usually a line waiting to order, but it goes quickly. I don't have to wait too long for my order and they remember me when I go in there. What you get for the price is more than enough and tasty! Our favorites are the lasagna, spaghetti/bolognese with meatballs (awesome and big meatballs!)  the gnocchi, and the cassonis, The cassonis are great to eat because if you are out having a cocktail and need to eat dinner without going home, this will fill you up. It comes with sauce you can dip it in. They put the utensils and paper napkins in the bag which helps because I usually forget to put those in there. I always ask for more parmesan cheese for our pasta. The one thing I wish they would do is make pizza. But you need a brick oven for that to do it right. 
I am so glad they opened up so close by. They have another location in North Beach.  The staff go beyond to make me happy and a returning customer.  Questo è il vero affare!   Manga!
author: Fog City Girl L.

description: Where do I even start! THIS PLACE IS AMAZING. I tend to be pretty picky/ discerning with my food even though I'll eat almost anything (It takes a lot for me to think something is really good) and this place nailed it. Walk in, order and pay, and take a seat anywhere. Water is also self serve and they have balsamic, parm, crushed red pepper, etc along the counter. I ordered the pappardelle with meatballs and boyfriend got the ravioli with bolognese sauce. Both were absolutely delicious. Both the pappardelle and ravioli were cooked really well, and the sauce was rich and hearty and coated the pasta in a delicious, velvety, meaty coat. The sauce that comes with the meatball is bolognese, so you basically pay an extra $1 for 2 medium meatballs. Both dishes were served piping hot with freshly grated parmesan on top. When we came on a Friday afternoon, it seemed the majority of people walking in and out were Italian, and I even saw a couple Italian grandmothers. So I'm assuming this place has got to be good even by their standards! Even after finishing up our dishes boyfriend and I were raving about this place later that night and we agreed we have to come back and try their other dishes. Hands down one of my favorite places in SF, with a price you can't beat
author: Sandy K.

description: I just ordered here from UberEats. Their food might be great in their restaurant but don't order UberEats from them. The lasagna was warm, not hot at all. I had to microwave it for over a minute to bring back some heat. The Uber driver did not drive far so it wasn't the driver.
author: Kris R.

description: Came here around 7 on a Saturday night for dinner and there was a decent amount of people inside that we had to wait a little bit for a table to open up for 2. We ordered the meat ravioli and fettuccine with white sauce, caprese salad, and tiramisu! They were all delicious
author: Joyce L.

description: Pasta is just cooked to right, and pesto sauce being my favorite pasta sauce of all time, this place does its justice! I highly recommend it!
author: Natalie W.

description: We freaking love this place!!  It's perfect for families and groups.   My daughter gets quality pasta and mamma gets quality wine and service so everyone is happy.   Love the owner and staff.  They always take such good care of us.  The meatballs are fantastic and the pasta is imported so it's real (not genetically modified) wheat.  This means many who are allergic to wheat can actually eat this with no problem! :))) Bravo!
author: Lisa E.

description: This place is happening! Great food. Awesome service. The lost star is because the music is a bit loud and we had to speak so loud to hear each other. If you want to grab a good Italian meal in cute and charming resto, this is the place to go!
author: Bianca S.

description: Really, really enjoyed the homemade taste. Very satisfying and I love the menu. Nothing too fancy but very delicious.
author: Sillysyl R.

description: Overpriced generic Italian food. The spinach "cazzone" was basically just a thin bread exterior full of totally bland mushy potatoes and half cooked spinach. Definitely would not recommend.
author: Zohra M.

description: This might have been my worst eating experience ever! We waited 40 minutes for a calzone, served in the most uncomfortable way to eat, cut in half on a small wooden board with the bolognese on the side. Terrible stools to sit on. You have to share a table with other people whose leftovers never got cleared after they left.
author: Brigham Y.

description:
New joint in town serves up a seriously delicious meal!

Fresh pappardelle with a coat of pasticciata sauce. No frills, but it's rustic, toothsome, and totally satisfying. Yaaaaaas!
author: Steph L.

description:
First things first, grazie. 

My god, the food was amazing. Honestly, after leaving this joint, I felt a tad bit more Italian. The welcomes were welcoming. We walked in and this dude was smooth beating up the pasta man. And by beating up, I mean gently rubbing the pasta with his soft hands. Whoever's his wife is one lucky woman. The chef's pasta rub was so nice, I bet when he slaps someone they tell him "grazie." 

The food was mad yum-yum. We got the ravioli, parpadelle and the gnocchi with their array of meat sauces. Talk about saucy. I can honestly say I shed a tear when the food came out and the parmesan was nicely distributed. Whoever the chef was deserves a raise and a slap from the other guy that rubbed the pasta.
author: Vu N.

description: Another hit from the Italian menu! This place is a MUST for your salad (bufala), fresh lasagna and fresh pasta tortellini with pesto!  Fast service and great food! Taste was satisfactory and flavorful, just like the spices in Italy! Grazie and hope to see you again soon San Fran!!!
author: Josie T.

description:
Oh the most amazing pastas you'll have! You get to choose your own pastas and sauces, so you can try out combinations and create a new pasta dish everyday. My personal favorite is the cheese filled ravioli with bolognese sauce or meat balls. 
The restaurant is a small, cozy and clean place. So you may have to wait in line for a while before you can get a place. Do try out their desserts: the panne cotta and the tiramisu. The tiramisu is like a heavenly little bomb of flavor in your mouth, it melts as soon as it gets inside. The pasta or salad portions aren't really huge so you will have space for desserts in your tummy. 
The best thing about this place is they sell their dishes for house parties- I'm planning to bring the lasagna and tiramisu tray for next time I invite people over. 

Just one suggestion: please check and change your chairs! My husband's chair broke (he's really not fat so I'm guessing the chair was weak from before); and while nobody got hurt, it could have been a really bad accident. (The four star is for that and not the taste of food, which is definitely 5 star)!
author: Fatema M.

description: Delicious pasta, but even better better desert! Their tiramisu is to die for - my boyfriend and I agree it's the best we've ever had! Also love the atmosphere- they play awesome music.
author: Danielle H.

description: Love this place! If you like Italian this is the real thing. They make their own pasta and sauce from scratch. Nothing else compares. It's like eating a home made meal. Their name is exactly what you get.
author: J.  R.

description: All the yelp reviews are accurate!! The pasta here is just as good as the ones you eat in Italy. The only downfall was the guy working the register. He was rude and didn't smile at all. My husband reminded me that this place used to be American  Cupcake.. i miss that place. This is a great spot to eat at if you have an impatient child. The food doesn't take forever to come out and it's pretty casual. It's in a nice area too.
author: Mertani G.

description:
Excellent pastas (particularly the pappardelle) and sauces. Personally the gnocchi was just okay for me (although I will need to give their gnocchi roll a try) as it was not the best I've ever had but everything else was top quality. 

Italian staff were friendly and service was quick. 

Best pasta meal I've had in a long time!
author: Esther A.

description: The food here is so delicious! True homemade Italian food at its best! You can't go wrong with the vegetable lasagna or the meat lasagna. Definitely order the burrata salad! And don't forget to end the night with tiramisu and gelato! Yum!
author: Alexis H.

description: Get homemade pasta from a small spot where you line up, order your food and find a stool and table or countertop to eat.  No pizza, no wine or beer, just amazing, raviolis, lasagna and pasta dishes.
author: Robert M.

description:
Delicious food: I ordered the Pappardelle w/ bolognese sauce and meatballs.  Highly recommend.  Staff very friendly.  

Seats along the counter made w/ old bike seats - look cool but not very comfortable.

Only negative (which is why this is 4 stars) my food took a while (30 minutes) considering it's fresh pasta, and about 4 people who ordered before me got their order first.
author: Edward L.

description:
Amazing Food! Really love their Veggie Lasagna. But all the other Pastas and Sauces are equally good. Apart from this we also liked the fact that:

- You can see the kitchen staff making the Pastas in front of you. 
- The price they charge is also very reasonable.

Be prepared for a wait. This is especially problematic in the winter as the line is usually outside the door.
author: Sravan C.

description: Super fast and amazing service. I got my order taken and was out of there in no time. The food taste amazing as well.
author: Allison K.

description: My wife and I go here all the time. Best Italian food in the Bay Area. Noodles are made by hand and sauces are incredible. The tagliatelle with bolognese is maybe my favorite meal anywhere in the city. Laid back casual vibe. Simple delicious pasta at its best!
author: Joe F.

description: LOVE! Like going to Italy for a fun dinner. I recommend it to everyone who comes to SF. They even have piadinas. The lasasgne is a brick of italian flavor and the gnocchi butter and sage is my favorite go to. The crew are mostly Italians so almost feels like home!
author: Clare B.

description:
Great place for a quick lunch/dinner! Visited this place on a quiet afternoon for lunch. The location is a decent size but I can't imagine it fitting a dinner rush. Very nice decor with a viewing area of pasta being made fresh. I ordered the pappardelle pasta with a bolognese sauce. Overall, great texture of the pasta and great sauce. 

I will definitely come back and try their other items. Nothing super special, just classic pasta. Sometimes thats just all you need.
author: Arda S.

description: I've been three times in this Unit of Italian Homemade and every time is something wrong. The three times I pay for cheese ( to go home) and and I've arrived home " surprise" no cheese at all. Today is the second time that they change my dessert . I've order strawberry panacota and they've send tiramisu ( I can't eat or drink coffee because of my heart) . I feel like I can't trust this guys. This Unit it's just flying. No one pays attention. Now I'll trow that dessert and dessert I've lost my money because someone is probably sleeping in the kitchen. It's America, If you can't support your business "WAKE UP"!
author: Stephenie S.

description: Talk about a straight food coma. The food is soooo yummy and it's fun watching them make the pasta right there. I love the raviolis. Only thing was that I wish there was a little more seating as it can get a bit crowded during peak hours.
author: Jenna G.

description: They offer really good pasta at a super reasonable price! If you're a huge fan of dairy don't miss out their butter cream sauce!
author: Abigail S.

description: Their pasta noodles are freshly homemade, so it truly taste like flour bases noodles. Not those dried pasta noodles from a box. But this review is to rave their Panna Cotta dessert. I was lucky enough to be able to order a dessert from Caviar deliver service-menu and saw the dessert section, between Panna Cotta/Tiramisu. Decided to give myself a treat, since the same amount of gas is required to deliver my main entree. I'm SOO glad I decide to try it. It is probably the best Panna Cotta I've had, from any dessert menu (better than some 5-star's dessert menu). It was lightly sweeten, very creamy/cream flavored - topped with a smokey caramel. So many other panna cottas have failed me where it either tasted like vanilla jello or creme brulee mix. Not this one! So, next time you come here, just try it - you won't be sorry. :)
author: Yum Y U M.

description:
My wife enjoyed this place much more than I did (hence the 3 stars). As soon as you walk in, they are making the pasta in front of you and it looks amazing. The service was great. We ordered a sandwich, ravioli with the white sauce and the thicker noodles with meat sauce (I don't remember the names). I really liked the white sauce while it was hot, although it tasted like 30% butter and 70% heavy creamer. Once the sauce got cold it seemed to thicken and taste really gross. The ravioli hardly had any meat or anything in it. You could barely see anything.
The meat sauce was very dull and plain to me. 
The sandwich was extremely salty. 
The drink choices were very limited. 
Would not come back again.
author: A M.

description: Delicious pasta, tiny restaurant. We went for an early dinner (5:30ish) on a Sunday and the place was PACKED!
author: Stacy H.

description: We came here with our 3 year old and it was perfect for us.  The food is delicious, it came quickly, and while we were waiting our 3 year old loved watching the fresh pasta being made.  It is not particularly fancy and you can't make a reservation, but for our situation it worked very well and it will become a regular place to visit.
author: Simon C.

description: I'm a regular and I love the food here, but lately they've been keeping the music SO SO LOUD inside the restaurant that I rather have a take out.
author: Ana Claudia S.

description: What a cute place.  No table service.  Get in line and order.  I have been here about 3 times and have recommended many friends to eat here.  Decent prices, efficient service, great food...  my only comment would be the cashier and the team behind the counter are a little impatience and borderline rude.
author: On C.

description: This joint is the real deal. Fresh pasta made right in front of you by Italians! Had the pappardelle with meatball. The pasta was perfectly al dente, and the meatballs were so moist. Generous portions, and we enjoyed our dinner al fresco. My dish was enough for 2 people to share. The pasta and San Pellegrino only set me back $15! The same quality can be commanded at a schmancy place. Best.find.ever and arguably the best pasta I've had. Neighborhood gem for sure.
author: Jeanna L.

description: I just started going to this spot and I can say that I'm a fan. I really hope that I can switch it up though and try something new next time. I'm a happy happy customer!
author: Robin K.

description: This for a good delivery via Yelp app, Eat24.  I ordered the lasagna, which I hadn't had in forever.  I had never ordered from this restaurant either but it was a great pick. Delivery was 45 but I was in no hurry.  Might make my own garlic bread over their Flatbread (i.e. thin wheat tortilla)  next time.
author: Phil L.

description:
The greeting from the employees just set the mood for the entire meal. They are so energetic, friendly, and genuinely happy that you took the time to try their place. The authentic Italian workers is just the cherry on the cake. 

This isn't some chain restaurant that throws pasta and sauce together and calls it Italian food.... They make their noodles in house and hand cut it. Their sauce is amazing!!! So full of flavor and they smother your pasta in it so you're not left wishing you had more sauce. The pasta and ravioli is cooked al dente.... And the perfect al dente! 

I had the crab ravioli and it was simply amazing. It didn't taste overly crabby and the sauce was not overwhelmingly rich.

My fiancé had the pappardelle with the pasticciata sauce. His sauce was creamy not greasy and tasted like heaven. It was savory but not rich! No tummy ache from greasy foods is always a plus for us (: of course we had to try a side of meatballs and they did not let us down. Super tasty meatballs and we were glad we got them on the side. 

Our entire meal cost $33! Such a steal for legit homemade Italian food. I've never had anything like this before!!! 

We bought a pound of prosciutto for $22! Machine cut. Cheapest prosciutto ever!!

We have found our new go to place for pasta and prosciutto (: you can even buy their pasta and sauce and just make it at home!!! So yumm!! Can't wait to come back (: this is definitely one of my top 5 restaurants in the entire Bay Area!!! 

Ciao!
author: Vivian L.

description: Wanted to love this place... it was just OK. I got the pasta with meat sauce and meatballs and it was way too salty to the point of unenjoyable. The service was mediocre as the staff were not very friendly
author: Mel K.

description: Excellent pasta!!! Definitely can taste the homemade difference & the price is great!!! Try the different sauces if you go with a larger group
author: Lil H.

description:
Ok - let's stop for a sec!
From Italian, to Italians: se state cercando qualcosa che sia veramente pasta fatta in casa, con sugo fatto come va fatto, con ragu' vero e ricette originali, e tempi di cottura degni del nome, allora questo e' il posto. 
Complimenti alle chefs e agli chefs dietro al bancone: servizio impeccabile e prezzi accettabili.

Now, few words for the Italian pasta lovers of the area: this is pasta. In its real meaning. You can get maybe something better in Italy, but just if you have one of those grandmas that are short just a star from the best chefs. Sauces are made on spot and trust me, cooking in such high quantity and be able to maintain the right taste and balance of flavors is not easy. Each time I visit San Francisco, I stop there for lunch. Never got out disappointed.

On the side note, what I don't like: paper dishes. I know, it's a matter of making it easier (and I guess also to avoid cleaning dishes), but you can't imagine the urge to make scarpetta in the ragu!!!

Oh, one note for one of the italian chefs there: yes, I checked, the ravioli di magro are the spinach and ricotta ones, at least where I'm from. My mother in law is 100% sure about that! :)
author: Alberto C.

description: Went for dinner and the place was packed but the food was bland. I ordered the fettuccine marinera and the others in my party ordered the fettuccine Bolognese and we all agreed the food was quite tasteless.
author: Brandon S.

description: Love it here!! Such an authentic Italian feel, and the food is amazing. I've gotten various things including veggie ravioli with bolognese, a sausage piatina, and fettuccine with pesto, and even the simple orders such as a pasta and sauce have been fantastic.
author: Lauren M.

description: This is the most amazing place ever. All the employees are super friendly, warm, and inviting. Martina and Matalina are the best. The food is always fresh and amazing in taste. But don't forget you have to get Tara Massoud or Pana cotta for dessert!
author: Brian J.

description:
Wow, just wow! Everything made from scratch, Mama Mia! The fettuccine is excellent! Tried the Marinara sauce, Bolognese sauce, & White sauce. Even the bread is made fresh when you order it. Staff is awesome & so friendly, very affordable as well, won't break the bank eating here.

Will definitely come back my entourage again. Nothing beats fresh made pasta & sauce, mancha, mancha!
author: Z Z.

description: Amazingly great fresh-made fettuccine!! Ive been handicap so caviar delivered this to me!! Must-try for all!
author: Carmin W.

description:
I walked by the storefront and was immediately drawn in by the fact that they have one of the cooks preparing fresh pasta. My sweetheart is Italian and I knew he would love this spot. We made it in today and asked the cashier "100% Italian" what he suggests, and he steered me to the ravioli filled with meat which was prepared just minutes before. It was cooked to Al dente perfection! $30 for 2 plates of fresh pasta and 2 sodas, great Value for such tasty food. They have been open for 2 weeks and working on securing the I liquor license. 
They also sell the pasta to take home and prepare at your leisure. You can also get sandwiches which my fella was seriously contemplating, but decided to save for another day.  Casual Spot with some excellent food, lovely service and overall wonderful options for genuine tasty Italian fare.
author: Rebecky L.

description: Awesome homemade tasting Italian food! The lasagna was incredible. The tortellini and gnocchi was really good too. The food reminded us of the restaurants when we visited Italy years ago. We are from SoCal and can't wait to come back here in the future. They need to open a location in LA!
author: Jim C.

description: Thought I'd come here sit outside finish some work on my laptop and enjoy a nice plate of pasta.... Unfortunately the women was extremely rude and would not let me use their Wifi. . . They just lost a potential neighborhood customer. . .
author: Meredith A.

description:
Well oiled pasta machine. Pick your carb, pick your sauce, pick your protein. Food is simple and inexpensive but not sure if I'd come here again due to the overall lack of choice. For one, I like having vegetables in my pasta dish and had to buy an extra side salad just to have some greens on my plate.

Portion size is pretty filling but gets monotonous after a while since you're basically only ingesting flour and sauce. Pappardelle pasta definitely tasted fresh and handmade and the marinara sauce was sufficiently delicious (tasted 'homemade' woohoo!) but the meatballs were very rubbery and tough (maybe too heavy on the veal?!)
author: Arushi S.

description:
This was one of the best and most well priced meals I have had in a long time. The food was delicious. I had the lasagna with homemade noodles, parmesan béchamel sauce and beef and pork bolognese. It was layers and layers of goodness. The portions are huge and this could have been a meal for two days, but I shared mine with my young daughter. 

The atmosphere is also really good, but they probably need a few more tables. I loved hearing all the staff speak Italian.
author: Christina L.

description: This is the best pasta in SF by far. The owners are absolutely amazing. The food is fresh and always to die for. Get the meatballs and the ravioli. This place is ALWAYS busy. On Saturdays they have a line out the door. Try calling in your order earlier for pick up. Great wine list.
author: Chante E.

description:
The pasta here is the real deal--it's fresh and you can see them making it in house. The result is perfectly textured, supremely satisfying pasta whose quality you can taste. I got the fettuccine with bolognese sauce, and it was amazing. They also have additional toppings you can add to your own tastes, and I pretty much cleared out a bowl of parmesan. Their parmesan also seems freshly grated and very high quality. 

The workers are all very friendly and seem to care about the food they are serving and your experience. One of them surprised my friend and me with a tiramisu on the house, which was very delicious and literally put smiles on both of our faces for the rest of the night.

Overall, I would definitely come back for the great food, great service, and laid-back ambience. Highly recommend! :)
author: Rachel W.

description: I arrived early evening on a Friday, so street parking was easy, the restaurant was almost empty before the dinner crowds, and service was fast. I ordered three pasta dishes to-go: gnocchi with pesto, fettuccine with Parmesan sauce, and vegetarian ravioli with butter-sage sauce. The gentleman behind the counter helped me with pairing my pastas and sauces, which was helpful because I am incredibly indecisive. Everything was fresh and delicious. I'd say my favorite was the ravioli but that fettuccini with the Parmesan is kind of perfect. Adults and kinds alike will go crazy for that simple flavor combo. My family and I ate our pasta down at the marina, which I definitely recommend.
author: Heidi T.

description: Incredible fresh Italian food the way it's supposed to be made.  There is no way to go wrong with this menu.  Portions are more generous if you eat there instead of to-go, though.  I love that you're able to choose your combination of pasta and sauce.  Pricier than I'd like, but for quick and good Italian, I'd say it's worth it.
author: Maggie A.

description: One if the best pasta places; maybe little more sauce would have made it 5 stars. Other than that, tasty and fresh!
author: Nathan K.

description:
One of my favorite Italian restaurants in the city.  I am not a big connoisseur of Italian dishes (I do know my basic pasta and sauces) but this place never disappoints with their food.  All of their pastas are homemade (hence the name) and their sauces are simply delicious .  Their dishes are good portion, enough for a small left-over and will definitely satisfy your Italian food cravings.  The prices are more than reasonable considering you are getting everything made from scratch!

The staff is great!  I love how friendly they are and welcoming to everyone!  My husband and I order at least 3-5x a month from this place, and we have never been disappointed!  And did I mention they play really cool Italian music?!?!
author: Melissa T.

description:
Very good quality pasta and sauces
I've had the Tagliatelle and Gnocchi with bolongnese sauce and both were great!
author: George G.

description: Pappardelle with Bolognese and Gnocchi with Bolognese sauce and béchamel cream. Both delicious and very good value. Delivered via Amazon prime in 30 min. Recommended.
author: Jordan C.

description: Italian Homemade is fantastico!! We visit at least once a week. With the numerous pasta/sauce combinations, you'll always be in for a treat. When you arrive you'll see the authentic chef pressing, twisting, and cutting fresh strands of fettuccini, ravioli, tortellini, etc. The restaurant has most of their ingredients shipped in from Italy so you know you're getting the real deal. Pasta is literally one of my favorite foods and I promise you that this is some of the best I've ever had! Not to mention, you can't beat fresh, real food in San Francisco for less than $15 (including tip)!
author: Katie B.

description: Nice little place in a cute neighborhood. Food was really good especially the pasta. Meatballs were very tasty as well as the gnocchi. Service was awesome.
author: Jill M.

description: We ordered the gnocchi with bolognese sauce ($12) and the lasagna ($12). Washed it all down with Headlands pilsner and an americano. Portions are substantial and the food is simple and flavourful. However, the gnocchi is soft and mushy and the texture is not ideal, making this dish a bit underwhelming. The lasagna was initially cold about 1/3 into it and was sent back for reheating. The lasagna was also not al dente and on the soft side. Most people liken this to home-cooked Italian and while I am not Italian myself, I would say that most cooking enthusiasts could make this or something better with a good recipe. Nothing wrong with the meal, but nothing outstanding. Good for satisfying a pasta craving without breaking the bank.
author: V T.

description: Ever eat at Pastaficio in Rome, ever eat at a Grandmothers olive grove home in Montepulciano? If you haven't head to this gem in San Francisco. I've eaten fresh pasta all across the country from the North End in Boston to Baltimore and New York's little Italy and nothing compares to what I just ate. The special Tagliatelle with sausage and fava beans was simply out of this world. The place is charming as anything and the proprietors are super friendly and warm. Even the music selection is awesome. Just ate in Napa at Morimoto, Ad Hoc, Etc etc and this place blows it all away. Don't leave SF without eating here!
author: Ed K.

description: I don't think I've ever had Italian food as good as I had here! I enjoyed fettuccini pasta with bolognese sauce and two meatballs. All I can say is AMAZING! The pasta was perfectly cooked, sauce was very flavorful, and the meatballs were the best I've ever had. Service was fast and staff was very friendly!
author: Collin R.

description: Not impressed by the Lasagna or by the Pappardelle. Plenty of better Italian options imho.
author: Hayden H.

description: Terrific food. Kind of expensive for counter service, but the pasta is the best I've had outside of Italy.
author: Ron J.

description: I loved the way that raviolis were being made at the front of the restaurant. It definitely set the stage for the freshness and quality of the food. My friend ordered the raviolis which were served with a pesto sauce. She said they were the best she had ever had. I ordered the lasagna which I also enjoyed, although I think it was slightly overcooked because the noodles were somewhat too soft and almost gooey. The flavor and quantity of my meal was excellent and the prices were reasonable.
author: Raquelle Z.

description: Damn Gina. This is the real deal. Haven't had this good since Italy. Do it you won't regret.
author: Troy H.

description:
Oh my holy meatballs - I am SOOOOO
happy I found this place. Got it delivered off a whim and damn girl it hit the spot. I got the tomato and cheese cassoni. This. Was. The. Best. Decision. I've. Made. All. Week. The only way I can explain it is to say imagine a fancy pizza like Delfina or Delarosa with the light colored tomato sauce and the oozing cheese. Now fold it into a pocket and make the crust 250% better. It's like that. The Cassoni is a taste orgasm. Now, I also got the burrata salad- great. Also got the Tagliatelle pasta with cream sauce... spectacular as expected from the name of this restaurant.... but dayyyUM I can't stop obsessing over the Cassoni 'sandwich' aka Pocket of Heaven. I will see you again soon my friend, I will see you very soon.
author: Sophia F.

description: When my little brother came to visit me in the city, I had to find a great Italian restaurant with good serving portions because what else are you supposed to feed teenage boys, and I took him here! Now every time he visits he always asks to come here. The Italian Homemade Pasta company has become one of my favorite Italian places in the city. Everything I've had here is great and highly recommend gnocci with the butter sage sauce (truly heavenly, you're welcome).
author: Delaney D.

description: Great food, everything tastes delicious! Lasagna is my favorite. Management and service is also impeccable!
author: Srdjan S.

description: Everyone needs to check out this jewel! The ambience is so chill and the employees are so nice and helpful. Now let's talk about the lasagna! It was so delicious and full of flavor. did I mention delicious?  By far the best lasagna I have ever tasted! The picture looks amazing but the flavors are amazing!!
author: cynthia r.

description: Excellent place all around! The quality and friendliness of staff keep us coming back. Our favorites are the Gnocchi roll and papardelle.  So good. It can get busy during the lunch hour, but is totally worth it!
author: Reyna M.

description:
I have to start by saying I ordered to go. The service was great, the food... eh. 

I ordered pappardelle with bolognese, tagliatelle with meatballs, gnocchi with butter and sage, and burrata salad.

The pasta itself had great consistency, unfortunately the taste wasn't all that flavorful. I asked for cheese on all the dishes, except for the salad of course, and there was no cheese once I got home. 

Burrata salad was good, but the bread that it came with was terrible. It was hard as a rock by the time I tried eating it. 

Everyone gave this place such good reviews, I think I might give it one more try and eat at the actual restaurant.
author: Arlene R.

description: Inexpensive, tasty, casual atmosphere. This place has AMAZING pasta! I definitely found a restaurant that I'll be coming back to the next time I'm in SF.
author: Kaitlyn R.

description: I've been here twice and it's solid both times. There are no reservations and it's kinda communal at some tables, others are more intimate. Definitely more of a casual dining experience but all the food seems to be made fresh and in the shop. I've had the tortellini and fettuccini and really enjoyed both. The portions are not crazy but but the food is heavy. I have yet to finish everything I ordered. Would go again.
author: David S.

description:
It's nice to have a casual eatery that serves a simple menu, although picking and choosing between the possible combos of sauce/pasta could lead to some decision paralysis.  We may not have done the right pairing, but I think we ordered enough to get a flavor of what the restaurant offers.  I loved the gnocchi.  Light fluffy little pillows, the way they should be. 

The other pasta didn't blow my mind.  Anyone who's made fresh pasta knows a good plate of fresh pasta: but it's also something you could easily make at home.  The sauce is probably what makes a difference, and while the meat sauce was good, it wasn't that memorable.
author: Candice B.

description:
This is a great spot if you're looking for something casual on Union street. Nutrition-wise, wouldn't recommend it on the reg (there aren't any vegetables in the non-salad dishes) but great for a casual dinner anytime you're feeling a pasta craving. 

Definitely get the gnocchi with pesto. You can even watch them make it!
author: Pooja R.

description:
I've eaten at the nb location and it was pretty good.

Just had uber eats deliver from the marina location:

Garden salad: average
Flatbread: hard and inedible 
Meat lasagna: average
Vegetarian ravioli with marinara: there must have been a mistake making this. It's the saltiest dish either of us have ever tasted. Completely inedible. 

Very disappointing considering the reviews (and not cheap at almost $50).
author: Sam B.

description:
Highly recommend : Pappardelle with bolognese sauce

Will definitely be back to this place
author: Alec H.

description: Just superb. The best gnocci I have ever had, and I order gnocci everywwere I think it could be decent. Soft and fluffy pillows of potato goodness. Even my friend from northern Italy was in love with it. I was regretting my resolution to go without dairy for Lent, but the bright clean tomato flavor in the marinara sauce was a revelation. Will definitely return even though it is not nearby for me. Not too far down to the SF Historic Marina or up to Lafayette park if you are looking to earn an indulgence on the dessert menu.
author: Ria J.

description: I love coming to The Italian Homemade on Union street. My husband and I frequent the restaurant, especially for mid week takeout. The staff is always friendly and helpful and the food is delicious.  I usually order the lasagna, but most recently tried one of the specials, the squid ink puttanesca.  I don't write a lot of reviews on Yelp, but wanted to send some special praise to the staff and owner for continuing to be so accommodating and helpful
author: Gina S.

description: I am sharing a secret that is only going to make you happy. Firstly, this restaurant was recommended by two different italian friends. As I walked in for lunch I heard customers speaking italian... and the aroma of herbs and fresh pasta ignited my senses. The atmosphere and employees make you feel like welcome into their 'home'. The pasta is the best I've had in San Francisco. Full stop. I can't wait to go back and try the buratto.
author: Molly C.

description: Takeout order was wrong again. In addition to terrible service and a bad attitude. Worth going somewhere else.
author: Mark R.

description: This is seriously the best Italian food around! The place is small and intimate. I love that you can sit and watch the chefs actually making all the pasta by hand! Their skill shows in their food. My favorite dishes are the Pinta, which is a thin sandwich filled with salami arugula and melted cheese. It is simple but amazing! And very filling. My other favorite dish is the Lasagne! They give you a huge slice and it is amazing rich and creamy with so many thin layers of pasta! Love this place!
author: Laura K.

description: Very tasty meal. Absolutely amazing. You might have to order seconds. You have so many options to choose from. Whether you want to try traditional pasta or you want to explore and try their other foods such as their lasagnas. Even with the traditional pasta,  you can make it the way you want by telling them what kind of pasta and sauce you personally want. What makes this place even better is their amazing staff. They check in and make sure that you are having a good time. They will make your experience there so much more enjoyable. Overall, a very nice place to grab a quick meal.
author: Matt D.

description:
Everyone speaks Italian here and not cuz they took AP classes in high school.  

Come here for some legit pasta, served the way you'd get it in Italia.  Fresh, simple, done right.

The atmosphere is casual and inviting, grab a beer/wine or an espresso and hang for a while.

I sampled an assortment of pastas - all delicious!  If you're a party of two, I recommend sharing a salad [fresh buffalo or burrata are both fantastic] and pasta [just pick one, trust me, you can't mess this up].

Happy Dining....
author: Nader A.

description: If I could give this place 0 stars I would. We went there during the north beach festival and although this may be a busy time for a restaurant, if you can't take the heat get out of the kitchen. I have never been so disappointed in a restaurant in my entire life. The pasta was hard, undercooked, and raw. It was a miserable experience and I will never go there again. I'm generally a good advocate and a genuinely nice person, but this experience was beyond miserable and disappointing, it ruined this brand for me and it's very upsetting.
author: Katie F.

description:
Haven't had a good pasta meal like this since I was at home. The food lives up to the restaurant's name! I do wish they would give you more meat options on the pasta. Right now the only way to get meat is to add the bolognese sauce, which is very good but also pretty pedestrian.

I had an authentic Italian chinotto (bitter orange) soda with my meal. This place knows their stuff!
author: Omar Y.

description:
Nice atmosphere, good food, friendly staff and fair prices. So nice to have Italian food made by Italians. We got the meat raviolis, my husband had the bolognese & meatball witch was hearty with a deeper flavor and I had the marinara which was light with a fresh and bright flavor. Very nice. 
I left off one star purely because someone was playing music through the speakers off their phone and the phone kept ringing, and that was annoying. Vibe kill.
author: Mama S.

description: Incredibly fresh noodles that are well priced, non pretentious environment. Brought our 1 year old, small but welcoming
author: Sophia N.

description: A very strong choice for Italian food at a good price.  Casual dining with a friendly neighborhood vibe.  I have never been disappointed here.  It can get packed early in the night, but gets less crowded later at night.
author: Steve C.

description: Freshly made pasta, need I say more? But I loved this unassuming nook watching fresh pasta rolled out, charcuterie sliced to order, fresh burrata oozing with milkiness, feathery light tiramisu and cappuccinos
author: Pri S.

description: Delicious home made pasta with all kinds of combinations of noodles and sauces. Highly recommend the Bolognese and Pesto sauces.
author: David C.

description:
Great service that matches amazinggggg food! We had a group of 6 and they got each of our orders correct and even customized one! Everyone here was really nice would definitely come back again!!!

Recommendations:  
- tortellini w cheese sauce (Omg so good)
- meat lasagna (best I ever had and HUGE!)
author: Amy W.

description: Awesome food. I'm a gnocci gnut...gnocci roll has changed my life. I would give a 4.9 if i could. Great place, nice people, incredible food.
author: Ross P.

description:
My dears, I come from Romagna: land of piadina, lasagne and tagliatelle.
When I entered this place, I was home! I had a piadina, the classic one with stracchino, rucola and prosciutto. Ahhhhhhh, so good!!!!! Soooooo, freaking goooood!!!
If you want to have a taste of the Riviera Adriatica, this is the place!
Finally: la piadina vera :))))
author: Luca R.

description: While picking this place the choice was very random, just something Italian. And we've never regretted the choice. I've had a lot of pasta's in my life but this one is unforgettable. Fettuccine with marinara just go together so well, especially when you know that this pasta is home made right in front of you. We also ordered a Classica flatbread, which was great as well, with very authentic. Enjoyed this place and will come back again.
author: Alex R.

description: Great simple menu, delicious pasta, attentive staff. This place was a pleasant surprise. The meat ravioli with marinara, tagliolini with meat sauce, and a garden salad  were all solid dishes. The pasta was deliciously tender but still al dente. The decor is modern eclectic hip with zero pretension. The seating blends in some family style tables in a narrow room but they manage to keep it more cozy than cramped. The staff seem authentically Italian down to the flirty server doting on the 'merican girls in a general foods international coffee Jean-luc except Italian way. The lasagna portions looked huge and will be my next order. Only thing to change would be the wine. The cab was disgusting. Or way over priced table wine.
author: James S.

description:
I'm extremely well qualified to write this review. This was possibly the best fettuccine Bolognese I've ever had. 
Fast delicious authentic and a fun place to eat.
author: Angelo P.

description: Visiting from out of town and found this little place on google!  It is fantastic.  We had the Cassones and all 4 were outstanding.  The pasta dishes looked out of this world!  Everyone was friendly, atmosphere was fun.  My husband works in food service and he said "this place is really clean". And trust me, he never says that.  And the best part was it was super affordable!   If I lived here I would be a regular!
author: Casey S.

description:
Wonderful experience, from watching pasta being made to explanations of menu options to the food itself. Highly recommend. 

White sauce on daughter's fettuccine was quite yummy. After description of gnocchi, son enthusiastically tried I and was pleased.
author: D H.

description: O.M.G. We stumbled upon this place and are so glad we did! Great atmosphere and awesome food! If you are anywhere near the area, you MUST stop!
author: Amanda D.

description: Busy Italian Resturant - limited seating is the main con - food was good - order your food at the counter - parking can an issue as well
author: Annie H.

description: We love this place! Fresh made pasta daily. You can not beat that! Gnocchi /Lasagna /tagliatelle /pesciata sauce are our favs! My boys could eat it every night for dinner!
author: Karen F.

description: Best Italian in San Francisco. Awesome, laid back people and incredible, fresh pasta. The specials are always true Italian classics like cacio e pepe -- highly recommended.
author: Ian L.

description: This place it's amazing. Went there last night with friends , everyone was amazed by their food. We ordered 4 different types of pastas, and i couldn't know which one was my favorite. The crew it's so friendly and nice, warm environment and very clean place. This is a place where everyone should be going at least once! Can't wait to go back! Highly recommended!
author: Francesco F.

description:
Having lived in Italy, I've got to say that these guys have nailed the traditional Italian comfort food dishes (i.e.: the pasta). The sauces are rich but not overpowering, and the various fillings are very tasty. 

Also, a massive plate costs $10-12, so what's not to love?
author: Andrew K.

description:
The decor is clean, simple and creative. The food is fresh and flavorful.  It's a mix of momma's food and upscale fast food.  It also feels like a hole in the wall, but airy, lit and modern. The ambiance is interesting, but the food is the main attraction. Fresh pasta is great!!! And don't forget the dessert - classic, but good.

There is a collection of interesting motorcycle chairs arranged along the bar area that might be interesting to check out.
author: Heb A.

description: After reviewing many North Beach Italian restaurants online, I couldn't stop thinking of the pictures and reviews of this place.  The pictures, alone, were enough to sway my decision.  As soon as we walked through the door, it smelled like ITALY, like my Nonna's kitchen.  My mom and I were in the city for my birthday weekend with my three kids 11 and under... they whined about all the walking, but it was all worth the spent calories to get my hands on that gnocchi roll!  I almost licked the plate.... the Bolognese sauce was rich and creamy.... to die for.  It helped that my mom was able to speak Italian to the woman behind the counter.  The place is small and cozy, but no complaints, other than they don't serve vino.  Buon Compleanno to me!  I'm already planning a trip back, as I tend to travel with food in mind.
author: Alicia C.

description: Great casual place. Hand made tortellini with parmesan sauce is amazing, bolognese is good, everything is good! Didn't love the pesto.
author: Jonathan P.

description: Love this spot. Very casual and cozy. Great prices and the food here is very fresh. The gnocchi is a must. The service was great and can't wait to come back!
author: Norah C.

description:
Best pasta in SF, I've tried almost all the pastas in the menu and it is so hard to tell which one is the best!
I totally recommend this place
author: Katy D.

description: Really realllllllly disappointing. So disappointing that I felt compelled to write my very first yelp review after utilizing the app for years. I ordered delivery because I'm in town for work, extremely tired and hungry. I'm not familiar with the city and have to be back at work early and I use yelp consistently to find great restaurants when I'm home or traveling and this restaurant has 4.5 stars + good reviews. I ordered the burrata salad and the tagliatelle with brown butter and sage sauce. Sounds yummy right?! Well it wasn't. My order took more than an hour to arrive, only the pasta was included and it was cold. The container was completely smashed, there were no utensils, napkins, NOTHING. The receipt that was stapled to the bag listed both of the items that I ordered yet somehow one of them didn't make it into the bag? How do you miss one of only two items?? On top of all of that... the pasta was basically inedible. 100%, completely flavorless. The al dente, homemade pasta, that I was so craving and looking forward to was completely stuck together and again, FLAVORLESS. Please understand that I was not expecting an in restaurant experience. I, did however, expect better than this. Especially for the $40 I spent.
author: Susan C.

description: It's not that the wait was long (it was) but it took 25 minutes in line to place an order... And our group was third.  The pasta was ok, wasn't the best I've ever had but I enjoyed the Bolognese.  Took a bite of the pesto on gnocchi,  (gnocchi good,  pesto meh). Prices are fair for what you get.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
Came here with my husband and 3 kids at the end of May 2016. I can't remember exactly what we got, but we were all happy with our food! The fresh pasta was nothing like I've ever had before. They didn't have a kid portion, so we had our 2 smaller kids share an adult, then the 3 of us also got adult plates and when we got out food it was obvious we ordered too much. We got 4 plates and 2 San Pellegrinos and I think the total was about $70.

Pros:
-Fresh, tasty pasta
-Big portions

Cons:
-When crowded it's hard to find seating, half of our group had to sit at the counter and the seats weren't very comfortable
-My kids got a meat sauce that appeared a little too greasy, but they still ate it.

I would visit again, but I wouldn't take my smaller kids because I don't think they enjoyed it as much.
author: Dawn S.

description:
Ok - this is the best pasta I have had since I lived in Rome. Amazing homemade pasta that is not over sauced. This is my new spot!
I almost don't want to write this review so that it stays a secret.
author: Lisa M.

description: If you like your pasta al dente, definitely give this place a try! Their pasta is so good and reasonably priced. The restaurant has self-seating so you customize your pasta, pay up front, and they'll bring it out to you. The first few bites of my beef ravioli with butter and sage sauce were heavenly, but the flavor wasn't strong enough to keep up that amazing experience for the whole plate. Still really good though! I was hoping to try the beef tortellini, but they were out of it by around 7:30-8pm. The portions were just right and if I remember correctly, they also serve delicious bread with olive oil/vinaigrette before your meal. Now I don't have to go to fancy Italian restaurants to satiate my pasta cravings, yay.
author: Stephanie G.

description: The only way this could be any fresher would be for them to not cook it before plating. So delicious, so fresh, so worth making your way here. We shared a tagliatelle with the meatball sauce and we destroyed it almost immediately. I also got a side of the marinara sauce to dip the meatballs in and that sauce is excellent as well. Last night in town or we'd back again very soon. Next trip back we will be here again though!
author: John W.

description: I'm not an expert in Italian food but it seemed good... simple food with high quality ingredients. The pasta is homemade with flour imported from Italy, which has less gluten and no gmos. The staff was what made this place. They were all so charming, sweet, and accommodating, I want to go back just to see them again. Prices are very reasonable.
author: Naomi W.

description:
The pesto fettuccine was good as was the gnocchi with bolognese. However, the mozzarella​ salad was inedible. The greens were not only saturated with balsamic but also with salt.  The side of flat bread was tougher than chewed gum.

Service was incredibly slow while they took care of deliveries before the long line of customers. 

While I was in for over 25 mins to get to the counter, some people have yet to have receive their food.
author: SA W.

description:
I want to give this a good review but I can't. 

It's the old cupcake spot on Union in Cow Hollow. So it's still sort of set up the same way.

The menu is pretty straightforward. Sandwiches, salads, pastas. No appetizers or sides.

You essentially look at the menu near the entrance, then pay for your food and sit and wait for them to deliver it to your table.

Well, we waited a few minutes before someone came to the counter to take our order. I already saw a lot of Caviar receipts for to go orders so it seemed they were busy out the gate at that moment. The person who took our order looked like he was annoyed with being there. Took our order and we went to sit down.

The only spot open was at the counter. The chairs at the counter are super uncomfortable. They're either old crotch ruining tractor chairs with sharp edges to slice your jeans open, or a rectangular padded cushion you need to straddle. My wife and I were uncomfortable on the seats. I get it, it's kitschy and nostalgic, but not when it feels sharp as I start to sit down.

The pasta was good. The sauce was average. Nothing exciting.

Not a lot of tables so it's not really for large groups. I see this as more of a quick place to grab a bite to eat when you're in a pinch.

I wouldn't come back unless I was really that hungry.
author: D M.

description: NOT WORTH IT! Cool idea, halfway executed. The noodles are fine, a little gummy and thick but at least handmade! The sauces are not good. Like rage from a can not good. My dog enjoyed the meatballs I couldn't finish. Packed, dense, flavorless. The one thing I did enjoy was the burrata salad. Though it was 5 cherry tomatoes to one giant mozz ball! Steer clear seek out a more detailed place!
author: Lacey S.

description: By far the best pasta I've had outside Italy. We had the tagliatelle with bolognese and the gnocchi with pesto. So fresh and delicious. They have a counter in the front where you can watch the staff make the pasta in front of you. Will be back for the ravioli.
author: Tian B.

description:
Its wildly intimidating to enter this place at first because the cashier just stares at you. 

Seating is uncomfortable at either the bar or a table so pick your poison. 

The food is good, a solid 7/10. I had fettuccine with pesto and it worked. The food runner was nice enough to make up for the stoic cashier.
author: Ella A.

description: The best pasta I've had in San Francisco at an affordable price! The service is consistently great as well, and the quality is perfect every time I've been. Would highly recommend to locals and tourists alike!!
author: Tiffany S.

description: This is my favorite place to eat in the marina. The staff is phenomenal and the food is even better. If you have an appetite get the meat lasagna with a nice ice cold Cola.
author: Matthew C.

description: This was amazing. Stopped in for lunch with my husband and ordered the lasagna to share. I'm an atheist, but I can say that this is, without doubt, God's lasagna. So gd good I am thankful to be alive. Then we got fettuccine with meatballs to get another chance to eat the hand made pasta. Delightful! Great meatballs and you can really taste the difference btwn this homemade pasta and processed stuff. Seriously, so effing good. Also got the tiramisu which was light, airy and delicious. Highly recommend this place. I wish I could eat it every day. Also was super cool to watch ravioli being made!
author: Emily L.

description: The lasagna was on point. Good serving size for the price and super delicious. I ordered take out and it was ready within 10 mins.
author: Chris B.

description: Because of the cashier they lost one star. She was very hostile and rushed me into ordering. I ordered the fettuccini white. It was decent. No complaints about it. I did receive an order I didn't want and they took it back with no hesitation. It wasn't the most outstanding either. With all the amazing reviews I expected it to be the best I had. Still no complaints. Maybe will come back if our top 3 favorite places are closed. Overall 3.
author: Couple E.

description: I'm sorry but this place is just overrated, period. If you know how to make your own pasta, which my husband does happen to do, then it's just normal. Their portions are pretty great for the price that you're paying, but it's a very simplistic menu. If you want vegetables on the side, good luck with that. I'm sure it's great for the locals who don't know how to cook, or the college student who wanders into the Marina and needs a cheaper place to grab a bite to eat. However, the bar stools are not comfortable and the service is just mediocre.
author: Carolina S.

description: Fantastic! We were a large party and tried many things - ravioli with pesto, ravioli with marinara, gnocchi roll, vegetable lasagne, calzone and vegetable sandwich. Every item was delicious and fresh! We were recently in Rome and this is the closest we've come to experiencing a similar taste in the US! The place is tiny, but has enough seating for 20 or so. We will be back!
author: Sara V.

description: Ordered the pappardelle pasta + pasticciata sauce (bolognese sauce with bechamel cream) and ate it at the bar. It was delicious! The pasta tasted so fresh and was cooked perfectly. The sauce was tasty, but I wish it had been a bit more flavorful (I would have added salt if there had been a salt shaker by me). Would definitely recommend for anyone looking for a good pasta meal!
author: Wendy C.

description: These guys just opened in our area (they have another hugely popular location in Italian concentrated North Beach) and its gradually becoming just as popular. I haven't experienced pasta this good since some of my visits to pasta bars while traveling in Italy. Everything is made onsite and fresh right in the window area, including the handmade pastas, tortellini, and raviolis. The sauces go great with everything and they even offer take out so you can cook the fresh pasta at home. They also give great recipes for you that aren't dependent on anything they can sell you, these guys are the real deal.
author: Mark Y.

description: Food was pretty good, but the atmosphere was not. Very, very loud so if that is not your thing try somewhere else. Servers yell a lot, plus loud music (presumably why the servers must yell) and no sound dampening in the restaurant. Tables are small and close together as well. We should have sat outside and not in the chaotic dining area.
author: Mike T.

description:
What a great find! This place had been at the top of my bookmarks for a while, and I finally got a chance to try it. I was so surprised by the amazing quality of the food here. This place has a very cute, homey feel with no frills or anything else unnecessary. 

You walk in an order at the counter. The guy was so friendly and answered all of our questions with a smile! He even made some recommendation of his own, which we gladly took and were not disappointed! We ended up ordering the vegetarian lasagna, their version of "fettuccine alfredo" (which was a special that day), and the caramel panna cotta. Both pasta dishes were beyond delicious and we cleaned up plates completely. If I had to pick a favorite, it would be the fettuccine alfredo. Even though it was so simple, that pasta was cooked perfectly and the sauce was probably the best I've ever had! 

To finish it all off, the panna cotta was mouth-watering delicious! It was so yummy and even though we were pretty full from our food, we finished the dessert as well! There are so many options on the menu here, I feel like you could go back 10 times and order different things each time. Can't wait to be back!
author: Malika R.

description:
It's not your normal sit down restaurant, you show up and order before you have a sit. With that out of the way, it's actually pretty cool. 

You get to see them prepare all of the noodles and ravioli while you wait for your order to be cooked. The sitting area can get a little tight but it is worth it. Your food is brought out to you once it's ready. 

The overall food quality was great. The food tastes fresh, nothing like I've tasted before. I really enjoyed what I got, it was a fettuccine noodle with the meat sauce. Add the fresh grated Parmesan!! 

Overall the experience was nice and welcoming. The staff is friendly, and asking for feed back. Everything went well. I will definitely be coming back when I'm back in town.
author: Herbert D.

description: If you like pasta.... if you like HAND MADE, FRESH pasta,  this is a place you must try. One of my "GO- TO" straight pasta joints in the city (there is another place,  but it's not JUST pasta. That review is coming.) TIHMC is consistent,  tasty, good price, and portion size and friendly service. The shop on Union is my choice because it's easier to park if you drive (other is on Columbus). The lasagna here is pretty good, but what i prefer is the pappardelle with Bolognese and meatballs,  or fettuccine. Oh i neglected to mention,  you can choose your pasta, as well as your sauce. Pesto,  marinara,  butter & sage or Bolognese(meat sauce) Nice variety, without being overwhelming. Go early afternoon or during the day and watch the pasta being made. Pasta is cooked just right,  quite filling and the sauce is satisfying (though I've had it once when it came out a bit salty) The Cassone (aka calzone) are hand made and are a good portion,  with ample filling. Tasty! One other thing is,  they do have veggie options for those who prefer it (veg ravioli, lasagna) When you're in the Marina or just want good pasta, check this place out. By the way,  grab a passion fruit gelato on the way out,  if you find you have room left.
author: R A.

description: My go to spot for a great pasta dish. Everything from the spaghetti bolognese to the meat ravioli to the gnocchi with pesto is five stars! The meatballs are delicious and even the salads are great. I wish they provided the option of ordering a protein with the salad like grilled chicken or salmon. That would be my one critique but other than that I love it here!
author: Jenna R.

description: Great concept & very fresh pasta made right in front of you. Definitely an experience when you walk into the restaurant. Accidentally got the white sauce instead of the parmigiana, so it didn't have much flavor, but very creamy and smooth. I'd go back again.
author: Pez P.

description: Amazing tortellini and cream of parmagian. I wish I loved here so I could try everything on the menu. You just can't beat homemade noodles AND homemade sauce. A steal at these prices.
author: Devyn H.

description:
This place is all about value. $12 for a plate of homemade pasta is an incredible deal in SF. The pasta itself is excellent - fresh and silky. I also love the fact that you can watch these guys make pasta as they put time and care into every batch. 

The menu is simple and straightforward. Pick a pasta, pick a sauce. Nothing fancy here, just good ol' fashioned home cooking. The sauces are not out-of-this world, but for $12, you really can't complain.
author: Y K.

description:
If you want solid homemade pasta, this is a good spot.

I am a fan of the fettuccine or tagliatelle with butter and sage. The pasta itself is almost identical in flavor but the fettuccine is not as wide as the tagliatelle. The pappardelle with bolognese is also a solid choice.
author: Dylan T.

description: Awesome place got there before line got long. Amazing place thank carb load up before a half marathon.
author: Paul O.

description: Wow!! Visit this place with my buddy Steve and great place, the food is delicious. I've been to a few places, and this is a super Nice atmosphere, great food, service is awesome..  Prices were very reasonable, perfect place to take someone for a date or even just a stroll through if you're in SF city.  Five star all the way
author: John M.

description:
They really mean homemade! 

Right when you walk in, you see the ravioli being made fresh and the calzones being made with what looks like fresh ingredients.

The place is very small, and they suggest you order before you sit. We walked in during dinner time, and we were still able to snag some seats at the bar. 

We ordered the pappardelle pasta with the pesto and the fettuccine with the bolognaise sauce and both were excellent. The ingredients tasted fresh, the pesto had a very earth taste to it and the bolognaise sauce was meaty and sweet. They don't add a lot of cheese but fortunately you can ask for more (my American taste buds hehe) and it doesn't take away from the flavor! 

The staff was very friendly and attentive, always asking how our meal is. It feels very authentic and at-home. Will definitely visit again when I'm in town.
author: Naomi C.

description: Not all the hype. Tiramisu was very very good but I had the papadelle bolognese and it was just OK. Not a fan of the texture of the pasta. The classica flat bread was very good, but not your typical Italian flatbread.
author: Kelsey F.

description: True pasta made from scratch. See them roll cut cook and serve. The glass of mosferrato was dessert for me. I tried the pesto marinara bolognese in fettuccine tagliatelle pappardelle- all separate dishes sauces relative to the pastas. All in all marinara was light on the garlic. The pesto was phenomenal. Recommend the tagliatelle. Sit back and enjoy. You are sure to hear the lively debate of pasta cooks and knowledgable staff giving insights to the methods and types of food being served. Those accents are refreshing & sharp ;)
author: Album L.

description:
Ok - this is the best pasta I have had since I lived in Rome. Amazing homemade pasta that is not over sauced. This is my new spot!
I almost don't want to write this review so that it stays a secret.
author: Sarah P.

description:
Seriously dude?!?!
Open table when we walked in-We had a party of 5, first time, all hungry and in line to order, two of us sat at the table a guy comes over and, literally, gets in our face and tells us to move since we havent ordered-but the table of 6 Marina chicks can sit at the next table for an extra hour after they finished-never again.
author: S. M.

description:
My friends like to make fun of me for eating dinner early.  Like 5 PM early.  Grandma status.  I always argue that when you go early, 1) you never have to wait, 2) you get better service, 3) your food doesn't have to sit in your stomach, trying to digest when it's bedtime.
