After an afternoon of volunteering at the SPCA, Husband and I walked from Pac Heights to The Italian Homemade Company to have a nice hearty pasta dinner.  Though we'd passed by and knew this was open (used to be the American Cupcake Kitchen), we just never had the chance to actually go in.

It was just before 6 when we walked in, and all the tables were actually full already, but the bar seating (not really a bar, but it overlooks their refrigerator where they store fresh pasta for sale) was empty.  There were a few people ahead of us in line, so that gave us time to peruse the menu.

The choices are simple: pick a type of pasta (all homemade, including fettucine, tagliatelle, pappardelle, lasagna), then pick a sauce (marinara, bolognese, cream-based etc).  Then if you're sitting there to eat, you pick a spot, and they bring your food out to you.  You can also buy the fresh pasta and pre-packaged sauce to go to cook at home.

As soon as we ordered and sat at the bar, the line developed, and by the time we were done eating, the line was almost to the door, and it wasn't even 6:30 yet.

We both went for meatballs (2 + bolognese sauce), and I had the fettucine while Husband got the tagliatelle.  Both plates were piping hot, the noodles were perfectly al dente, the sauce was DELICIOUS.. but my meatballs were super tough, dense, hard and dry.

Husband thought his meatballs were fine, so maybe he got a different batch?  I ended up giving mine to him, and he ate it without complaints.  Maybe I'm just used to meatballs that are super tender and fall apart easily (Dobbs Ferry's, for example).

This place is no doubt one of the best places to get fresh pasta for a decent price in the Marina, if not the city in general.  It's not fancy, but it's a cozy, laid-back spot to grab a quick bite.
author: Tori S.

description:
This place is amazing. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful and the food is delicious. Since I eat here about 3 times a week, I have tried most of the menu and here are the highlights:

Pork Tortellini with Butter & Sage Sauce - the homemade butter and sage sauce wasn't what I was expecting, but I was pleasantly surprised. The sauce is thick (almost like a alfredo sauce) and pairs wonderfully with the tortellini. 

Marinara Sauce on anything - I have been pretty disappointed with the sauces at a lot of italian restaurants in San Francisco, but Italian Homemade has created a perfectly simple marinara sauce that tastes fresh and delicious. I highly recommend the gnocchi or the pappardelle. 

Meatballs - grab a side of meatballs drenched in a large portion of the meat sauce.
author: Matt S.

description: Lov love love this place. Really great fresh Italian food in a casual & comfortable setting. The lasagna and meatballs are great!
author: James L.

description:
After visiting Italy for the first time last month, we were craving some authentic Italian food and stumbled upon this place on Yelp. The food was fantastic - I got the pappardelle with the bolognese sauce and it brought us back to Rome. Fresh pasta, homemade sauce that packed a ton of flavor. 

The boyfriend got the pesto with tagliolini if I remember correctly and their pesto is amazing too. Most of the tables around us ordered the lasagna so we'll be back for that next time. 

The decor of the place is so cute from the unique tables to the open kitchen/bar area. The ordering happens at the front and then you seat yourself. The staff all had Italian accents which contributed to the atmosphere and brought us back to Italy. :-) We will most definitely be back!
author: Catherine C.

description: Yum! Fresh homemade pasta Really enjoyed this, though be prepared for a wait-- we waited around 20 mins in line, plus another 20 or so for our food
author: Neena D.

description:
Awesome place.
Inevitably exquisite food, great home made meals for the exigency of high palate eaters.
Thank you.
author: Albert G.

description: I was so exciting to try to restaurant. So disappointing. $35.00 for two pasta dishes- both not worth $1.00. Zero sauce on either. I got marinara bolognese on one and white sauce on either. Instead I got dry noodles and a little ground beef and dry noodles with about a teaspoon of white sauce for the whole order. Please don't waste your money.
author: Allie S.

description: Daaaaank.  Super authentic, really friendly staff, affordable.  A go to any time I'm around there.
author: Raul D.

description:
Came here with a few friends to carbo load for a half marathon we were running. The line was pretty much out the door and stayed that way the entire time we were there. Seating is limited and we counted ourselves lucky to find three adjacent bar seats. 

This place is cool in that you can watch the pasta being made from scratch, which means the food is super fresh (we assume anyways). In addition to pasta, ravioli, and lasagna they also make closed panini sandwiches!

A minor disappointment though was when we ordered, they had run out of pasta -_-. So I ordered ravioli with meatballs instead. I also ordered a sausage, onion, and cheese panini but later on when they got around to making it, they realized they were out of sausage! So in the end I didn't get to eat the things I wanted to try, but the food was still all right nonetheless.

I also didn't think the meatballs were as good as they were hyped up to be. They were really, really dense which I wasn't quite expecting (but maybe that is what authentic Italian meatballs are like), and they weren't really hot on the inside, probably because they are quite large and dense. 

I will say the pesto sauce looked super, super green, in a good way. I wished I had gotten that instead of the bolognese sauce. 

Anyways, definitely would come again to try more of their food. Hopefully what I want won't have run out next time.
author: Hain-Lee H.

description:
A little slice of Italy in the Marina. 

A casual eatery with simple, fresh down-home Italian fare. And pasta al dente--just like it should be!
author: Justine H.

description: Huge portions, cute location, great price. $15 for huge plate of pasta and a soda. Our group of 4 wandered in on the recommendation of a local we met.  First of all, Franciscans know how to eat! This quaint spot, right in the middle of the Italian district was perfect! Small menu was edited not limited and food was delivered hot and fast.
author: Dee J.

description: Please go to the North Beach location. So much oil in the food and the taste is very different.  The North Beach location is so good, even the marinara is different (they have a similar smell), the meat taste different. If I ate here first before the Cow Hollow location, I would of hated this place. I love Italian made in. NB, I eat there once a week.
author: Sarah T.

description:
I hate to be the first non-five star review but here goes. My boyfriend and I were looking for someplace to eat on Union St the other day and came across The Italian Homemade Company on Yelp. The owners here are very nice (and actually Italian!) and knowledgeable about ingredients which is important if you have food allergies/dietary restrictions. 

I'm vegan and was informed that none of their pastas are vegan as they are handmade and have egg, but that the gluten free pasta was an option. Apparently they are working on adding some vegan pastas in the future which is good. I settled for the gluten free pasta with marinara sauce. I feel like it's fair to judge an Italian restaurant by their marinara sauce - it's one of those things that's hard to screw up but also hard to do well. Unfortunately I was underwhelmed by their marinara...it just didn't have enough flavor compared to Zero Zero or Delarosa, to name a couple.

My boyfriend had the meat ravioli with butter and sage sauce. His feedback was that it was good but nothing to write home about. My other issue with this place is that each pasta was $14. I know that it's Union Street but $14 for a plate of pasta at a quick service restaurant is a bit steep (especially a basic pasta with marinara, no meat).

It sounds like the owners are making modifications to their menu and this place is right around the corner from me so I would be up for giving it a second shot in the future.
author: Sarah S.

description: First time visiting and will definitely be back. This is an adorable authentic Italian deli. Great location and ambiance. The staff is very friendly as well! We had the mortadella and prosciutto sandwiches. I definitely want to come back and try the pasta!
author: Nicola L.

description: The closest food to what I've had in Italy. The staff is very friendly. You get to choose your pasta and sauce. Anything I've tried has been very delicious.
author: City T.

description: I ordered the Parpadalle with meat sauce- pasta was made fresh and tasted great, though the only flavor I got from the sauce was salt. My friend got meat raviolis and had the same problem with the sauce, and was unhappy with the meat quality. It was nothing special, wouldn't come back.
author: Dominiqu A.

description: I was really excited to try this place and got the lasagna that everyone raves about, but it was waaaaaay too salty.  I couldn't eat much of it.  I probably won't try this place again.
author: Kaitlyn H.

description: Came here with my bf one evening. It was good however they were out of everything. So we basically got spaghetti with meat sauce. The place looks deceiving, good luck trying to find it!
author: Stephanie Y.

description: This has to be what italian food is like in Italy!  Fresh, delicious, bountiful, properly cooked and served, just wonderful.  Capresi salad w/mozzarella cheese was so fresh, light and awesome.  Meat ravioli w/bolognese sauce just superb.  Spaghetti w/2 meatballs was damn good and i'd keep eating it until i couldn't.  Everything was perfect and if we lived here we'd eat here at least weekly.  Must go!
author: Rick H.

description: This place is the real deal!  I loved the relaxed vibe of this eatery. Seeing the guy up front making the pasta fresh was cool. We had lasagna and gnocchi with pesto - so fresh, so delicious! The tiramisu was light and fluffy, just the right amount of sweetness. I had to try the stuffed donuts and if I hadn't already had the tiramisu, I would've gotten more donuts. Super great place!
author: Tina C.

description: Lasagna was great; the noodles were cooked just right-firm but easily cut with a fork.  My wife got the fettuccini with white parmesan sauce.  Great taste and pasta was very fresh.  I ordered a side of meatballs with sauce.  The meatball sauce was a little salty, but the taste was still rich and flavorful.  I would definitely come back and try more pasta and sauces.
author: Allen C.

description: I ordered some ravioli from here tonight and I gotta be quite honest, it's way too salty, literally uneatable. Really disappointed, ruined my only dinner after a busy busy day.
author: Luis L.

description: Had a great meal here! The staff is super friendly and food is delicious. Portions are massive and we could've easily shared a salad and entree. They make everything in house and the quality is fantastic.
author: Ashley S.

description: Delicious and inexpensive meal! One of the best lasagnas I've ever had. Adding the meat sauce is a must! It was $12 and huge, enough for two meals or to share. I was disappointed in the special truffle pasta I got which was $20. I did not taste a hint of truffle at all so it definitely wasn't quality truffle. However, the lasagna was so good that I'm excited to come back and try the build your own pasta dishes.
author: Tanya Y.

description:
Homemade pasta!!! I ordered the tagliatelle with butter sauce and my girlfriend had ravioli in a meat sauce. 
Pluses- the pasta is fresh, homemade 
Minus- the sauce in my pasta was kind of bland, I had higher hopes. 
The meat sauce in my friends pasta was good though. 
Dessert- tiramisu, can't go wrong here!
The atmosphere was loud, like really loud, or maybe I'm just sensitive.
There was a group of women who complained about the noise level and they quickly adjusted the music.  The restaurant is a little narrow so perhaps not the most kid friendly. They do have outside seating though if you're lucky enough to grab one! Overall, not bad but I expected more after reading the reviews in Yelp.
author: Jennifer T.

description: I've only been to the North Beach location.. a perfect place to order food to go.  Friends say, "Where IS this place?!" We love the Cassonis and ALL the freshly made pastas with the authentic sauces simmering on the stove. Always have had very friendly and accommodating  staff!
author: Michelle K.

description: Fantastic! Half bottle pinot. Pork tortellini with parmigiana sauce, full order flatbread, meat lasagna. Great food, great service. Expect it to be a bit salty and you'll be OK. Totally enjoyed this place.
author: Bra H.

description: Beautiful homemade pasta!!! Came here for dinner with my wife! Amazing food that should be double the price for the quality! Awesome vibe and the staff are really friendly! Definitely go there if your in need of something different from a burger!! Would definitely go again!
author: Corey B.

description:
The most YUMMY, delicious pasta dishes, and the nicest staff and owners! I live in the neighborhood and this is one of my favorite paces to have dinner. The tagliatelle with Bolognese sauce is my go-to favorite, but everything I've had has been really good. A relaxed, comfortable environment, a cup of coffee, a beer, or a glass of wine, delicious food and great customer service...  what more could you ask for? I love it here and always take all my out of town visitors here to impress them!   

Welcome to the neighborhood IHC!  I can't wait for them to open their next location in Hayes Valley (the only one that will have a GELATO stand inside, yum!)
author: Laura J.

description:
My friend and I found this place by chance. We were roaming around SF, having ice cream sundaes at Ghiradelli. We were craving for Italian food and found this place close to our location.
As soon as we walked in we loved the ambience and the staff was very warm.
We ordered the raviolli and a sandwich, both of which were fresh and delicious. Loved it all! Will definitely go back for more!
author: Mugdha J.

description:
Same amazing food in a new great new location! The Italian homemade company never stops to please Italians and food lovers. 

I had an amazing 'caprese' piadina and a 'chinotto' on the side. For dessert don't miss the 'bombolone' alla Nutella and finish your meal with one of the best espresso in the city. Authentic Italian coffee! 

The owner Mattia is a great host and the whole stuff is amazing! 

Italian homemade company is the real deal: not doubts about it!
author: Gianpiero N.

description:
Lasagna was too salty. Cassoni was too sour.  A disappointment and I was truly looking to enjoy my dinner.

Not much to add except after they charged my card they don't provide creditcard receipts.  Why???
author: Troy M.

description: Che BUONO! I've walked past this delicious spot so many times, so happy I finally tried their amazingly authentic delicious food!! I had the tagliatelle bolognese, caprese piadina and have a hard time saying I've had anything that tasted as close to pasta in Italy. You won't be disappointed!!
author: Michelle Q.

description:
Their pasta and sauce is really amazing. You see them making the fresh pasta right as you walk in. How you order is you choose a type of pasta, or ravioli, and then choose a sauce. They also have salads, lasagna, and some desserts too.

very interesting seating area. There are high top tables and regular tables and tables at the bar and none of the chairs match.
author: Carmen C.

description: Yes!!!!  Welcome to the neighborhood!!!!  Have loved the original location. Perfect fit on union street. Eat in or takeaway.
author: nick g.

description: I have eaten at the Italian Homemade twice. The food was absolutely delicious, especially ravioli which were cooked perfectly according to the Italian tradition. I tried also the "cassone", a sort of piadina stuffed with mashed potatoes and bacon, it was really good! I like the fact that you can choose your favourite variety of pasta and see how is freshly prepared and cooked right in front of you!The stuff was friendly and the place cozy and spacious! I definitely recommend it!
author: Stefania L.

description: I don't know much about proper pasta and sauce pairings, but HOLY SHIT I found an amazing combination! I had the gnocchi pasta with a cream sauce and some cheese on top, and that was soooooo amazing! They are a wonderful and delicious company!
author: Nichole P.

description: Very tasty and fresh pastas in a casual setting. Enjoyed the service (they're actually italian!) and the pappardelle with meatballs. Also tried the panna cotta with strawberry sauce. I'm a fan!
author: Zara H.

description: The food here is authentic and amazing. The tortellini with parmesan cream sauce and the meat lasagna are amazing. Ordered my tortellini with extra sauce and it was awesome!  The food was so delicious we ordered a pesto gnocchi because we had to try it.  Reasonably priced food and great service.
author: Emily E.

description:
*UPDATE
The quality of their food when delivered has improved quantity and quality-wise. There were times where the portions/quality were disappointing but recently it's been getting a lot better!

---------

DO NOT order food from here through delivery services. 

Eating at the restaurant is great but when you order through grubhub, caviar, etc, the quality and amount they give you is SIGNIFICANTLY worse than at the restaurant. The salad is usually about four spoonfuls and they on many occasions forget to put dressing on the salad. The pasta is overcooked, soggy, and flavorless. As a reputable business, they should have some quality control on what is delivered to their paying customers. If they know the food did not turn out well, they should have the dignity to redo it.
author: Jonathan J.

description: Love the food. There was 3 plates and one was lukewarm but still had great flavor. Staff was pleasant but not super engaging.
author: Terry L.

description: Ordered Italian Homemade via postmates and it was delicious! Fettuccine with pesto and meat ravioli were both great as well as the Buratta salad. Definitely want to check it out for dine-in too!
author: Caitlin C.

description: The meat lasagna is the best I've ever eaten. Mozzarella salad was very fresh very tasty dressing big enough to share. Love this place. 1st time here will be back.
author: Aaron W.

description: I really had high hopes for this place given the reviews. We tried the tortellini with a meat sauce and the spinach ravioli with sage and cream sauce. Both were recommended by the cashier. You can definitely tell that everything is made fresh and for that I think they are really awesome. But for the $$ and the fact that it was just pasta (no additional veggies, bread, etc.) that didn't really impress me in itself, I don't think we'll be back. Granted, some may say I don't have a refined enough palate to distinguish true Italian cooking, but I can only go off of what my tastebuds experienced. Very cute atmosphere though.
author: Susan G.

description:
I'm so happy that they have come to Union street. The Marina was in desperate need of some solid food contributions, and The Italian Company is a huge boost. I've had their food delivered via Caviar a few times now, from their location in North Beach (the lasagna is phenomenal), and having a local option is convenient. Plus, this one seems to have more options due to the large space. Today I had the Classic sandwich, which comes on flat bread, and it was amazing. I paired it with some sparkling water and a cappuccino. The staff was beyond friendly, and they were all in great moods and spirit.

I will be back (again and again).
author: Captain B.

description:
This place is nothing short of amazing. Been a fan of the North Beach location and can't be happier they are on Union now. This location has a much bigger menu because their kitchen and location overall is much bigger. It's just a matter of time until the whole neighborhood discovers this gem and it's packed like the original. 

Tried a lot of things and never been disappointed but the lasagna is the best. The mozzarella salad was amazing as well with delicious balsamic dressing.

Service and ambiance are great. I don't think I'll ever need to go anywhere else for pasta, especially after they start serving wine end of this month :)
author: Kristen T.

description: The pasta was delicious! It was very fresh and flavorful. It tastes almost like my moms homemade sauce. The lasagna was huge! The meatballs weren't very good. The pasta could've used more sauce because the sauce was so good!
author: Mallory B.

description:
Best pasta I've ever had. It's like WAYYY legit. 

Service was friendly. Food came out fast. Bolognese was to die for. Gnocchi roll was ridiculously yummy. It's a must go.
author: Suzanne R.

description: Had delivery from here several times. Not terrible but there are just so many other good Italian restaurants here in San Francisco. Not many rate higher sadly.. there are a few though that I give maybe a three or four star rating. They had descent lasagna or spaghetti. I am sure if not delivered it is much better fresh at the restaurant.
author: Kirk M.

description: Fabulous. Definitely authentic - fresh pasta and homemade sauces, everything cooked to perfection. Tasted all entrees at my table and each was unique and delicious. Cannot recommend strongly enough.
author: Andrea G.

description: Great true Italian food in a casual environment. These people are the real deal. Plus it's always nice to see when the workers get along so well and enjoy working together. It's a small location with counter ordering. Food came out fairly swiftly. Pasta made on site, which you can watch being done. I recommend the bolognese! Amazing!
author: Christy D.

description:
Want delicious homemade Italian food? This is the place! Waitress was kind and I loved the fact that the employees ARE Italian. 
The prices are good and the decor is cute!
author: Nicolás B.

description: If you are looking for delicious food and a casual atmosphere, this second location of the Italian Homemade Company is perfect.  Same concept as their North Beach location but a much bigger space.  Food is fantastic, with options ranging from freshly made pasta to salads.  They even have gluten free options for eating there and sold to take home.  My mom has celiac disease and loves the gluten free pasta here!  There is even a small assortment of Italian groceries to choose from.  If you are on Union Street - or in North Beach - definitely check it out!!
author: Annemarie P.

description:
I have made a couple of visits so far and tried different pasta dishes and sauces. All the pasta were fresh, perfectly cooked(Al dente) and well seasoned. Sauces are flavorful and not too heavy. Very friendly service, even when I am not the most familiar with all the different names of the choice.(In Italian I suppose? In fact I have no idea what most of them are.)

They do have seating, but it gets crowded quickly. So, something to keep in mind if you do plan to eat in.
author: J Y.

description: I ordered through UberEats, and I would not recommend it to anyone else. The fettuccine pasta did not even have enough sauce on it and the meatballs were too salty. I ordered the salad with oven baked tomato and that was awful too. How does someone mess up salad you ask? They just put olive oil on it and maybe a dash of vinegar. I saw that there was an attempt to add balsamic vinegar in it but I did not taste anything. Honestly, it was like eating cafeteria pasta. I rarely complain about food and will settle for mediocre when I'm  hungry but this ... I just had to voice about
author: annie w.

description: Hands down one of the best pasta I have ever had and I've been to many very high end restaurants. This is a legit Italian place straight from Italy! Also, had some great wine and tiramisu. Such a great little date afternoon lunch with my boyfriend. I will be a repeated customer!!!
author: Valerie W.

description: Great authentic Italian food in the heart of SF. Amazing choices even for vegetarians. A little limited seating facility, can't ask for more given the location. Good service too
author: Akshay D.

description:
Gnocchi and meatballs are delicious.  The women behind the counter was a pleasure to speak and gave better advice.  Try their Italian cheeses.

-The Arp Darp King
author: Spencer B.

description: Thrilled to have their second location in the Marina! Crazy good fresh high quality Italian food. Watch them make fresh pasta, sit down or take home. Nice modern space with old school Italian music in the background. Service staff are super friendly Italian owners. Perfect spot for a fast casual lunch or dinner and pick up some pantry staples on your way out.
author: Angela L.

description:
Eat in:  Nice full plate of pasta.  Very tasty even a simple bowl of bolognese. Lasagna was pretty good and a hearty helping.

Take out:  Disappointed. Ordered a pesto ravioli and it was unusually small order for the price.  

Not sure if I would go back based on the experience.
author: Calvin J.

description: probably the best pasta i've ever had in the US. not to sound bougie but I travelled around italy this summer and ate my way through the country and let me say this place holds up to that standard perfectly. suggestions would be the gnocchi with butter and sage sauce or the tagliatelle with pesto! both AMAZING!
author: Lara M.

description: A great place for fresh food and handmade pasta.  I am not a lasagna lover but this lasagna was amazing! The food was incredible and well worth it.  The prices aren't too bad either!
author: Alexandra P.

description: The Italian Homemade Company restaurants are arguably THE best Italian gems in SF. When I lived in north beach my weekly stops to pick up sauce and fresh cut pastas were the highlight. Moving into the marina- and finding their other restaurant has been foodie bliss. Friendly, warm, welcoming and pure deliciousness.
author: Monie P.

description: Amazing! Been looking for an authentic Italian restaurant like this for years. Finally found it don't miss this place.The price is reasonable,the atmosphere here is homey,the taste is so good!By the way, the guests' bathroom is super clean, totally impressed!
author: Craig P.

description: Loved every bite! Gorgeous salad with the best burrata I've had...and the portion was huge! Even the flatbread for dipping was homemade and amazing. We also had the pappardelle with bolognese sauce - perfectly cooked, with a delicious sauce. The owners were awesome, as well. Happy to have a great new spot in the neighborhood, and looking forward to going back!
author: Whitney S.

description: Very, very comforting, homey and delicious lasagnas! Had the vegetarian and normal version. Vegetarian had a good mix of four cheese and you can even feel the crunch from zucchini etc. The normal one was just as heart warming  it feels like Christmas with every bite I take. Prompt and friendly services with decent price!
author: Calista T.

description: We love this hidden gem. The bolognese sauce is perfect with any of the fresh pastas, and one serving is good for me and my fiancé. We also add a Cassoni with potatoes, bacon, sausage and mozzarella. It's our favorite go to order and place for the past two months. I want to try the gnocchi and lasagna as well, but am currently in love with our current selections. Give this place a try - you will not be disappointed!
author: Jen P.

description:
Solid 4 stars....  almost 5.  Ordered:
Meat Lasagna - 4.4 stars.  Started out easily as a 5, but got a bit dry in the middle; could have used more suave.  Pasta seemed fresh and portion was like a large brick.

Fettuccine Alfredo- 4.5 stars

Tagliatelle w/ pink suace (mixed marina and alfredo) - 3.5

Pistachio Gelato - 5 stars
Tiramisu - 3

Will come again and try to order a bit differently.
author: Buddha B.

description: My favorite Authentic Italian food in the city. The ingredients come from Italy and are priced very fair. The owners make fresh pasta noodles right in front of you as you are waiting to order. The owner even gave us an incredible Tiramisu to try. We have stopped by to eat the last three weeks in a row. Fun, tasty, and fast!
author: Jonathan S.

description: AMAZING. The pasta is fresh, perfectly cooked and the sauces are delicious. The staff is always friendly and welcoming. Every time I visit San Francisco, I stop for dinner, even when it's out of the way.  You won't have pasta this good anywhere else!
author: Bonnie B.

description: Fresh and delicious food in a casual setting.  Great place for a reasonably priced meal--hard to find these days.  The menu focuses on pasta and panini dishes.  Guests have the option to choose from a list of pasta shapes and sauces--hands down best pesto in town.  The meaty bolognese sauce could use a bit more tomato (to be nit picky).  Order the caprese salad for the flavorful mozzarella.  It tastes homemade!  The only complaint is that the Italian waiter could use a little training in American style service.
author: Patricia M.

description: I came here with my sister to celebrate her birthday. The experience we had here wasn't bad but not what we really expected. We started off with a salad and it was pretty good. It was fresh and the dressing was delicious. The meat ravioli my sister ordered was a little bland and a bit cold; she wasn't too impressed. I had pappardelle with pesto and I liked it a lot. It had plenty of garlic and other spices that made this dish very tasty. The dessert menu did not look very appealing to us so we decided to go somewhere else to enjoy frozen yogurt. Although it wasn't the greatest experience I had I still had a good time and I will likely give this place another shot.
author: Fede F.

description: Great casual atmosphere, fantastic food!!! Highly recommended!!! My new favorite spot!
author: Ashley T.

description: I came with a group of 6 people. 3 of us ordered pasta with the butter and sage sauce which turned out to be incredibly bland. One member of our party ordered the fettuccine with pesto and the pesto sauce tasted like it was watered down. We had an order of lasagne as well which was the only dish that was liked. At the end of the meal we ordered a tiramisu but the ladyfingers tasted a little stale. Given all the great reviews, my group was quite disappointed with our experience.
author: Mehrmah H.

description: This place was wonderful!  At first I was thinking it was too casual but when I heard Italian music playing while watching the guy make homemade ravioli, I thought "this place is going to be awesome!"  I am 100% Italian and know good Italian cooking. This place was incredible.  The marinara sauce and gnocchi was excellent!  My moms pappardelle was spot on as well!  I think we found "our place"
author: Lanee C.

description: We travel to San Francisco once a month and always make our way back here. Quite simply the best pasta in the city. The staff are friendly and the service is great!
author: Lee T.

description: I was window shopping and randomly saw this Italian store for take out. The fresh pasta caught my eye so I took a chance and bought uncooked pasta and Bolognese sauce;  enough for my family of three adults and two kids . The rich meaty sauce some of the best we've ever had and the pasta is worth every $. The ladies at the counter, all spoke Italian and were very helpful. A must visit when I'm back in SF!!
author: Sandra L.

description: I ordered the taglietelle with pesto and oh my god, it was so good. My friends ordered the lasagna and parpadelle with bolognese, and both of them were so so happy with their food. We ordered a carafe of Sangiovese for the table, which was a nice touch. The restaurant itself was pretty crowded on a Saturday night, but nothing we couldn't handle. I love how you can see them make the pasta at the front of the restaurant-that was fun. It's also so cozy and cute inside, which I loved. I think the simplicity of the dishes is what makes this restaurant stand out in my mind. Usually when I order pasta, I have to pick the type of pasta, the sauce, all of the other vegetables I want with it, etc., and sometimes that is so overwhelming!! But here, you have few choices, but it's all straightforward, and you can focus on enjoying all the yumminess! Definitely recommend checking it out, and I look forward to being back!
author: Megha M.

description: Amazing fresh pasta. Beautiful people working there, helpful and nice. Had the Gnocchi with peato, amazing. Had Fettuccine with parm sauce, uh,mazing. Meatballs, generous portion and sooo good.
author: L W.

description: If you're looking for really good and authentic Italian food, this is the place to go! They have the best authentic Italian pasta in San Francisco! I highly recommend getting a plate of salumi and cheese as an appetizer.
author: Julien B.

description: The hand-made pasta was extremely tasty! The price justify the mWe sit outside the restaurant to enjoy the ambience of union street. Lovely place to hangout and people watching.
author: Phoebe C.

description: I haven't as good Italian food since I was in Italy!  Helpful staff and amazing food. Order at the counter and food is brought to you. Had the garden salad and veggie ravioli with bolognese sauce. All fresh ingredients and pasta made onsite. Loved it!
author: Missy Freeman C.

description:
Had the spinach ravioli with marinara and the bresaoula salad. Everything was, and tasted, fresh, including the marinara, the ravioli, the spinach inside the ravioli, the salad. However I would try the sandwich (with bresaoula, definitely!) instead of the salad - we only got salad because of health needs of my other person, but I am sure everything here is fresh and good for your soul. Portions are just right, but pricey.
Eating here inspired me to cook delicious pasta. It's always good when a restaurant inspires you to cook.
author: Sara K.

description: The food is pretty good! Kind of hit and miss. The best thing I've had is the lasagna. Definitely not the best food I've ever had.
author: Austin H.

description: This is the best pasta I have ever had and the tiramisu is to die for. We're not from San Fran but when we come back it'll be the first place we'll come eat again. Definitely delicious.
author: Sarai V.

description: They have piadina, a flatbread sandwich with prosciutto and stracchino cheese, which is a rarity to see outside of Italy.  I took my Italian brother in law and he gave it his seal of approval. Oh yeah, the homemade pastas are all ridiculously good as well. A must!!!
author: Noah D.

description:
This place has really great food and isn't too expensive. The interior is pretty low-key, I don't think they are super concerned with the decor or coziness but the food is on point. You come in and order at the counter and then are seated and they bring out the food to you. There is a chalkboard that lists the different plates and options for sauce/toppings.

I got gnocchi which was very good. My boyfriend got spaghetti and meatballs and our friend had the lasagne. Everyone was happy and the service was attentive and helpfully answered our questions.
author: Rebecca M.

description: Their pasta wasn't what I was expecting. I've been to plant of Italian places and that does not include ovile garden. Just I would say judge for yourself.
author: Erit S.

description: The staff are handsome and genuine people who have the passion for their pasta. Ever moment or so, they would ask if our meal is good. Happily I said yes and I was definitely satisfied. I felt a lot of warmth and welcomed in a new environment. The pasta was delicious tagliatelle and pasticciata I'm not sure how to pronounce it, but it was delicious. Fresh pasta and delicious meatball. Highly recommended.
author: Jenny N.

description: Found this via Yelp. Oh my what a find! The food is authentic and delicious. My family had the pasta and marinara, lasagna and pasta with meatballs. Staff was friendly. Food was served quickly. If you love Italian food this place is not to be missed.
author: Sheri Y.

description: Finally I found my favorite meatball place. Fresh pasta, great meatball sauce and convenient location. Will come back!!!
author: B M.

description: Best pappardelle and pesto I've ever had. This place is legit fantastic pasta. Better than Michelin restaurants I've been too. Very authentic Italian pasta. Cannot recommend highly enough. Super quick, causal and delicious. Tiramisu is light and perfect dessert. So so well done. Great wine selection too.
author: sean s.

description: Just as good as the location over in North Beach (usually my go to), but sometimes I find myself in the Marina, so I can't resist.  This location is definitely newer looking inside, but it is just as charming as the location on Columbus Street.  As with that location, the Italian Homemade Company is always on point and never disappoints.  The pasta is deliciously fresh and homemade tasting, the sauce is always a delightful compliment and comforting.  The Bolognese sauce with meatballs is always a winner paired with whatever pasta suites your fancy that day (they are all amazing, honestly).  Also tried the pesto and marinara to mix it up, and both were just as amazing.
author: Grace S.

description: The lasagna was delicious! Since I've only tried one dish I can only give it 4 stars but look forward to returning!
author: Gina P.

description: I've recently discovered this amazing place in my neighborhood. Apparently, it's been around since 2014 and I regret I haven't known about it's existance earlier. This is a gem! In the last couple of months I've been there many times and I have tried pretty much everything on their menu: sandwiches and pies, pastas, raviolli, tortellini, salads, meats and cheeses, desserts. It's all delicious! It's first come, first serve but there are always seats available.  They deliver, too! Just try one of the major food delivery services. And all of that is pretty affordable. Rare combination of high quality, great taste and reasonable pricing in SF!
author: Yury P.

description: The fresh pasta is divine.  But the sauces lack and the service is terrible.  The fresh pasta was out of this world.  We had the marinara which was flat and desperately needed some kind of herb- basil?  Something to brighten it up.  The bolognese sauce was good but still needed something exciting.  We ordered the mozzarella salad and they forgot the mozzarella.  The staff speaks limited English so ordering extra Parmesan or trying to correct the issue is beyond difficult.  The atmosphere is very rustic and uncomfortable
author: Samantha B.

description: The best balsamic in the world! The meatballs are outstanding. They also have a great wine selection as well.
author: Christabelle P.

description: Delicious food and then literally make the past in front of you. Not a bad combination of pasta/sauce to try!
author: Brian G.

description: Well, when the pasta is being prepared from scratch right before your eyes, you know it's fresh!  How many "Italian" places can boast thusly?  And, woo! the guys preparing pasta are actually Italian.  That said, the proof is in the freshness, and both gnocchi (my fav!) and pasta are fresh. The pesto is great, the bolognese on the bland side.  One of the best things about this spot is that it's open all of the time (well, not quite -- but you can find a good meal and glass of vino here when many other spots are closed, say, mid-afternoon). No real ambiance, but if you love Italian, that's secondary -- or do take-out for your own gathering and pretend you can craft gnocchi!
author: nancy b.

description: A good friend took me here for lunch 2 weeks ago. I can't believe I've never been here before. The craftsmanship and dedication to quality alone is breathtaking but then you eat the food and it's like heaven! I LOVE homemade pasta but theirs is a step above. I had the gnocchi and my friend had ravioli- I sampled both and they were amazing!! You have a loyal follower.
author: Lupe G.

description: Pesto pasta was the best I had outside of Liguria, Italy.  Also the gelato was fantastic, strawberry & pistachio.
author: phil b.

description: The food was delicious and the service was quick, but I left hungry.  The portions were quite small, especially considering the fairly high price charged for a fast-casual style service. If you're in the mood for a light lunch or a snack, this is a great choice.  However, if you want a full meal, I would suggest looking elsewhere.
author: Nicholas K.

description: This place will not disappoint! Our family of four ordered four different items, and not a single bite was left on our plates at the end of the meal. Casual atmosphere, super friendly  service, and absolutely delicious, fresh food. We can't wait to go back to try more on the menu.
author: Rebecca R.

description: Wow. DELICIOUS homemade Italian food. This restaurant does not disappoint. Had the gnocchi and Cassoni. SO GOOD. prices are reasonable for food that is homemade.
author: Julian T.

description: Had them for lunch today and my Pesto Pappardelle was amazing.  I will make an effort to try everything on their menu
author: Kirita S.

description: The food looks nicer than it tastes. Service and speed of meals is great. My lasagne was cold in the middle and bland. The Bolognese sauce on the side had a burnt taste. Not the best meal in town that's for sure
author: Scott W.

description: Came one night for a quick meal.  It's really nice to have a casual moderately priced restaurant option.  You pick your sauce, type of pasta.  The pasta is handmade, cooked well and delicious.  We tried the pasticciata sauce (probably spelled it wrong sorry) on gnocchi.  The gnocchi were really solid, the meatballs-tender and delicious and pesto on tagliatelle.  The pesto was flavorful.  Also had the meat raviolis, interestingly the edges were a bit tough and the filling did not standout perhaps overwhelmed by the bolognese. Probably the weakest part of our meal were the red sauces.  The Pasticciata and the Bolognese were both flat, it wasn't a salt issue but rather a lack of any other flavor.  The bolognese had quite a bit of oil floating in the dish...which detracted from the dish.  We had the burrata salad also...plenty to share, salad was a touch overdressed.  I would comeback though and try different items..the pasta itself was a standout.  This for me is a soft 4 star. Very casual, a little noisy but a welcomed addition to the city dining scene.
author: Debbie L.

description: If you're in union craving authentic Italian food then come here! The employees/owners are Italian and I love the accent and authenticity. Pasta is made from scratch right in front of you in a glass room by the register.  They have a special every day and I strongly recommend being adventurous and trying it. It's a great little date spot, but I wouldn't recommend for big groups. Hope you enjoy as much as I did.
author: Terry T.

description: This place is a real gem! The food is incredible, the employees are all extremely friendly, and its quick and easy -- the perfect blend between a sit-down restaurant and a fast-food option. I was beyond thrilled with my first meal there (highly recommend the tagliatelle with pesto) and cannot wait to go back!!! The Italian Homemade Company is the real deal!
author: Caroline B.

description: This place is delicious!! I would highly recommend this find! True homemade italian food. Best italian food I've ever had in California!!
author: Ashley S.

description: Went for the first time today, not a big pasta eater, but I have to say hands down one of the best veggie raviolis I ever had! I wanted the veggie lasagna but it was sold out, regardless I wasn't disappointed. So freakin yummy I can't wait to go back!!
author: Sonia H.

description: Oh my god, this is seriously the best Italian food I have even had in my life. The pasta is fresh, like incredibly fresh. I can't wait to come back to this place.
author: David P.

description: The Italian homemade company is by far my favorite Italian place from which to order delivery. I have had their sandwiches, gnocchi, and pastas, each of which has been flavorful, fresh, and made with that intangible ingredient, love. The preparatory stations at the restaurant and the quality of the finished product suggest that you are eating in Rome.  Truly, each piece of pasta is made by hand using skilled Italian artisan cooks.   I highly recommend ordering from this restaurant.
author: Nick S.

description: What a joy! Fresh homemade pasta (watch them make it as you order) and amazing meatballs in a rich meat sauce. True northern Italian dining in a casual atmosphere. Just pastas, salads and sandwiches but they are done right! All wait people are friendly and Italian themselves. A true labor of love. Simple and delicious. Not pretentious, overrated or expensive. So much to explore. We'll be back!
author: Kerry H.

description:
Friendly, fast service, great process, and top-tier Italian food.

Do yourself a favor. Go eat at Italian Homemade, but go early! They're so popular that they are fresh out of most of their menu by the end of the night! 

The only thing that could be improved is of they could served wine. 

Cannot recommend highly enough.
author: Rob C.

description: We love Italian food and have it frequently when eating out...and my wife judged the lasagna as the best she has ever eaten. I had the pappardelle with bolognese sauce and meatballs and it made my Top 10 Best Ever list. Not much as far as decor, etc....but who cares with this food.
author: Michael L.

description: Yay for homemade! This place is seriously good. We ate here 3 times on our mini getaway to SF. I'm so glad we got to try so many of their dishes plus have a few of their desserts. The decor of the restaurant is totally hip and I love the idea of ordering at the counter and paying. Everyone that we spoke with was clearly Italian, they had really thick accents and were really sweet explaining the menu and different types of pastas and sauces that were made. You can actually watch someone making pasta all day long it seems because we ate there at different times of the day yet there was always someone making fresh pasta. It was great and the food was great. My marinara sauce was so light and delicious. And the tiramisu!!!Awesome sauce! make sure you pronounce it correctly or else they won't understand you!! Tttt tiramisu with a t. Now I've never been, but they make you feel like you're in Italy!
author: Cheefong J.

description:
This food is sooooooooooooooooo good.

Get th gnoocci!
author: dave w.

description:
Terrible terrible TERRIBLE service. Our friends were visiting all the way from Vallejo and had a craving for pasta so we decided to go here due to its pretty good reviews. We came here on a Saturday at 7pm and a direct quote from the manager as we stood in line for about 15 min was, "We are 70% out of our menu. You only have the option of to go." How is anyone 70% out of their menu on a Saturday night during peak dinner hours?? We still decided to eat here since we were the next ones up at the register. The cashier was very rude and told us that we couldn't order anything but salads, raviolli, gnocchi, lasagna, and this gnocchi roll. My friend inquired about the gnocchi roll asking her TWICE if it contained pork because he couldn't eat pork. She confirmed TWICE that it only had spinach and cheese.  When paying for our meal, she was hovering over us like an eagle ensuring that we give the restaurant tip making us feel extremely uncomfortable. After waiting for another 25 min to get our food, low and behold..there was pork on top of his gnocchi roll. I'll give a star to the manager who came by and said he'd make us another one, but seriously, we asked the lady twice..how does she not know?! What if it was a deathly food allergy!
Probably won't  be coming back here EVER again. The employees are very rude and not worth my time.
author: Kristen T.

description: The food was good and the staff was very nice.  The seating area is very small and crowded, but we made it work.  We had the pesto, marinara, and he meat sauce with meatball.  The meat sauce with the tortellini was the best.  The flat bread was also very good.
author: Ron H.

description: The pasta was hot and made upon ordering which was cool. But holy crap.....the price! I know how to make my own pasta and my own alfredo sauce and it doesn't cost $12 per plate! Plus...if you have younger kiddos... don't take them here. Pretty sure most people in this part of town hate babies, even well behaved ones. The people working there didn't seem to like people...and at the price they charge they should be singing praises to the people that come in to buy their food. I gave it 3 stars because the food was good....not great, but good. We will look elsewhere for italian food when in the city.
author: Nicolle S.

description: I had the fettuccine bolognese. It was unbelievably amazing!! Fresh, tasty, perfect. Purdue Lost | The Secret of My SucCecil https://secretofmysuccecil.com/2016/03/24/purdue-lost/
author: Cecil P.

description: Food was yummy and pretty quick service. We ordered fettuccine alfredo, lasagna, spaghetti/meatballs, and tortellini.  Oh and mozzarella salad and house salad.  My two faves were the lasagna and mozzarella salad.  Even though the register lady forgot to punch our second salad in and we had to reorder instead of her giving it to us as a courtesy for her mistake, we will likely return.  That wasn't really a showstopper but could be noted for future customer service opportunities.
author: Monica M.

description:
Homemade italian food! Very fresh and tasty.
Went few times for take-away. Love the 2 types of flatbread-based wraps, stuffed raviolis and panacotta!
I also enjoy the energy of the staff and overall cool atmosphere.
author: Tony T.

description: Got a bunch of stuff and everything was delicious and tasted homemade! LOVED the Cassone meatball!
author: Laura M.

description:
Good lawd this place is good! My first visit to the restaurant was about a month ago. I had heard good things, but was straight-up shocked as to how delicious the pasta tasted. 

However... I was also four drinks deep (thank you Brixton/Palm House for your Happy Hour) by the time I sat down to eat.

I went again this past weekend, just to 'clarify' my initial opinion of the place. Against all odds... my bolognese was even better than the first time. 

My new favorite casual-Italian spot in the city.
author: DS K.

description:
Authentic Italian recipes with the past made directly in the store (you can see the guys making pasta at the entrance counter!)

One of the best spots for quality Italian food.

Confirmed my previous review!
author: Orion A.

description: Awesome spot! Every time I work in the city I try to come in. Great staff and great food.
author: Evan W.

description: Absolutely delicious Italian food here that isn't your standard Italian fare. Recommend highly.
author: Terence P.

description: My wife and I had a lovely dining experience at the Italian Homemade Company. I ordered the gnocchi with a parmesan sauce. It was easily the best gnocchi i've ever had. It melted in my mouth. Decent serving size too. My wife ordered prosciutto stuffed tortellini. She loved it too. My wife accidentally complicated things by changing her mind on her dish after i left to use the restroom. It was misunderstood. Consequently, they brought me the wrong dish, having understood that she cancelled my gnocchi order. Anyways, they were so gracious about it and swapped it quickly. The service is A++ here. Loved it and will definitely come back. Great value too. I actually prefer paying before eating too. 2 thumbs way up.
author: Steven S.

description: Excellent. I walked in, picked my pasta, picked my sauce and walked out 5 minutes later with my fresh, warm food. I had the ravioli with meat sauce. Decent serving size and very flavorful. Not cheap- it was $16 total (that's with a 15%) tip. I will return.
author: B W.

description: Very authentic Italian food. Simple, filling, and hearty. I love that you can watch them make the pasta. We tried the hot meatball sandwich, the stuffed gnocchi, papaerdelle with meatballs, burratta salad, tirimisu, and espresso. All of it was done well. I feel like it's hard to find a place that can do all of that well. Kudos to a wonderful little gem!!
author: Delia P.

description: This place is a gem on union street! I had the gamelli today with pancetta and mushrooms in a creamy sauce it was to die for!!! For something you would think is heavy it was so light!! Everything is made fresh on the premises which is a beautiful thing especially when it comes to pasta. You cannot go wrong here plus they have Italian food products you can take home. It's mostly on the northern Italian side when it comes to dishes. Highly recommend!
author: Nadia N.

description: We basically stumbled across this place. What a pleasant surprise. People super nice. The pasta is made right there in front of you. Very simple Italian pasta dishes with enormous flavor. Very inexpensive. I have only one ting to say :" GO" and experience for yourself. You are not going to be sorry you did.
author: Karen J.

description: Horrible. Not happy. We had lasagna and it was burnt and bad. It didn't taste well at all
author: Joseline R.

description: I'm not really sure how this place gets such high reviews. I ordered a few things from there to go and everything tasted really bad. I got a vegetarian lasagna that had this weird cheesy sauce on it that wouldn't even rinse off the plate when I tried to wash the plate. It was hard as a rock. I couldn't eat it. The mushrooms in it were canned. The caprese salad was not great either. The tomatoes were not ripe and flavorless.
author: Sandra A.

description: Amazing homemade pasta! The are like my grandmas'. Service is excellent and the place is cozy. Highly recommended!!!
author: Anabela B.

description: Incredibly authentic tasting Italian food in the Cow Hollow neighborhood. We came here for dinner and was very pleased. Prices are extremely affordable. I spent about $13 for noodles and some meatballs, and I couldn't finish my meal. The noodles taste fresh. I didn't confirm but I wouldn't be surprised if they made their noodles in-house. Service was good and they had enough seating for about 20 or so people. The vibe is casual so you could come here for just about any occasion. We went on a weekday so it wasn't too busy. I will definitely be back. Enjoy!
author: Ken C.

description: Amazing pasta. One of the few authentic pasta places in San Francisco. Will be going back very soon.
author: Chirag H.

description: Some of the best Italian Food I've ever had! Great atmosphere! Made the pasta right in front of us! Awesome Lasagne!!!!!
author: Bryson H.

description: One of my new favorites! Quick, and casual place to get excellent pasta at a very reasonable price. The homemade name is especially  fitting, as 1. It tastes like it, and 2. You can watch the pasta being made on the front counter. The bolognese sauce is so good that you won't leave a drop behind! And don't pass up the delicious tiramisu for desert! (This is coming from someone who never goes for dessert...) And on top of the excellent food, the Italian guys that run the place, are very friendly and provide an excellent dining experience. You can tell how much they care, and that is why this place is one of the best!
author: Derek N.

description: Awesome! We picked up some uncooked fettuccine and bolognese sauce and made a fabulous meal at home!  I wish they had a shop down on the Peninsula!  I would be a regular customer!!
author: Mia B.

description: I came with high expectations as the previous low reviews were for vegetarian dishes which I am not. Ordered Pappardelle with meatballs and it was good, but far from being superb. Bolognese sauce has a lot of meat, but lacked flavor. Pappardelle was good, but not chewy al dente that places that have mastered pasta serve it as. Maybe I expected too much...
author: Roland L.

description: Wow, stopped in after a meeting and couldn't be more satisfied with the gnocchi role. The Bolognese is perfect and only $13! I'll be returning soon.
author: Moline D.

description: Discovered this gem while walking down Union street! I am a fan of Italian sandwiches and this place is a definitely worth a try! Brings me back to when I visited Florence and ate delicious Italian sandwiches there! Although the portions are a bit on the small side, the taste is definitely excellent! I ordered the Classica Piadina. The prosciutto was delicious and it was served on Italian flatbread. Not too overfilling and the right amount of flavor! I am definitely coming back here to try the rest of their sandwiches!
author: Daniel K.

description: Love everything on the menu!!! The pastas are delish and the sandwiches are tasty! I especially love their pana cota!!
author: Bella B.

description: Today, I was pretty firm on starting a low-carb diet tomorrow. I was very hungry and was in the area so thought I'd try my last bit of carbs until two weeks later. Had the pappardelle with bolognese and lets just say that I'll be craving this for every meal, for weeks to come. I'm blaming this place for ruining my astuteness for the diet I was about to start. So. Dang. Good... I don't even think the word "good" would suffice how awesome this place is!
author: Jen H.

description: The Best Italian Food From Emilia Romagna!!! Bravi Ragazzi We are Proud of You;) Non E' Normale!
author: Adriano P.

description:
WOW
Had pasta with white sauce (bechamel) today. 
The best bechamel I've ever had. You could tell it was freshly made.
Fettuccine were awesome!

Fantastico
author: Alessandro M.

description: I ordered vegetarian ravioli (spinach and ricotta cheese) with sage and butter sauce. My friends ordered papaderelle pasta with meat sauce and vegetarian ravioli with meat sauce. Ravioli was so fresh. Papaderelle was chewy and elastic. Very fresh and definitely have s home made feel.   I can taste the fresh tomato flavor in the meat sauce.  Will definitely come back.
author: Sunny B.

description: Some of the best Italian food I've eaten in the city bar none. Lasagna is awesome, meatballs are awesome and the deserts are surprisingly good. Will be returning often to this gem.
author: Stephen B.

description: Great new spot in the neighborhood!  Italian staff have a lot of pride and passion about the food they offer.  The burrata salad was fresh and delicious.  The gnocchi roll, ravioli and bolognese followed wonderfully.  I'm gluten free and had no issues finding options for pasta.  The pasta they used didn't get mushy like most gluten free pasta does.
author: Thalia F.

description:
This place is so cute. The decor is delightfully mismatched and unique. It's very nice but still casual.

I had a pappardelle with bolognese sauce to go and it's delicious. I love that you can pick a pasta and a sauce. The other sandwiches and things I can't pronounce looked tasty. Overheard a family raving about the meatballs.

The staff is super friendly and attentive with authentic Italian accents!
author: K C.

description: This is an awesome place to have Italian food. Pastas are delicious and very well made. I encourage everyone to go, bit expensive though.
author: Kash S.

description: The Italian Homemade Company is the BEST restaurant in San Francisco. I eat here every Sunday evening, and I've never had something on the menu I didn't fall in love with! If I have to recommend my favorite dish, GET THE PAPPERDELLE WITH PESTO! If you need meat, the meatballs are to die for. The wine list is great, and the employees are even better. Salad-wise, go with the burrata. SO fresh and SO good. When you walk in you can see them making the fresh pasta while you wait in line, and it's super fun! Can't-miss restaurant while you're in SF.
author: Clay P.

description: The best Italian food in little Italy and best price. Food Is amazing the meat balls are great service is awesome love this place I will definitely be back
author: Angel V.

description: The food was delicious, but the portions were really small considering how expensive they were. We left pretty hungry still and searching for food elsewhere.
author: Amylia P.

description: Exactly what the neighborhood needed, perfect casual Italian food. Best pasta I've had in a while, the perfect spot to either eat in or get to go and make at home. The staff is awesome too.
author: Danielle R.

description: Excellent food. Fun atmosphere. Not much care about the décor but who cares when the food is so good.
author: Alan -.

description: Im staying at a hotel that doesn't have a restaurant (no utensils available) so I ordered through UberEATS. Food came in with no utensils or condiments. Had to eat with my hands. Food was pretty bland  and pasta was dried. I called the restaurant directly to complain and the person who answered the phone said I had to specified that I needed utensils and condiments but there was no option on the app to even request them like in EAT24. Over all food not that good, tiramisu is overrated is a hard piece of bread with whip cream over it, and clearly the restaurant staff is either too. Ish or don't care
author: Artistic G.

description:
love this place! amazing homemade pasta that is to die for. the guys who run the restaurant are also really nice and friendly. great quick place to grab some pasta. you can also buy the pasta to bring home and cook.

my favorite- pappardelle with butter and sage sauce.
author: Kelli L.

description: This meal was like taking a mini trip to Italy. My family and I can only say thank you for the wonderful food and service we had. Simply delicious is how I would describe this food. The homemade fettuccine and the Cassonis (small calzone) were excellent. My daughter loved her mozzarella salad, so simply said everything was excellent.
author: Thomas W.

description: Another great location for this amazing as-original-as-it-gets Italian restaurant.
author: Alberto M.

description: This is definitely the best pasta in San Francisco.  Every pasta is fresh, even types of pasta that are never fresh at other restaurants like penne.  The sauces are all very good too and the Italian hosts, pasta makers and servers are all very friendly and proficient.
author: Alex C.

description: Oh. My. Lord. Ordered the gnocchi with marinara, fettuccini wth white sauce and a side of pesto. It was delicious, food was up within 5 minutes and gone from our plates within 10. It's a cute little spot with a good variety. We really enjoyed our meal and I will definitely be back.
author: Muhi K.

description: This place is the bomb! Sooo good, we were visiting from the east coast and we ate there twice! Plus they speak Italian! All plusses!
author: Miguel R.

description: Really delicious pastas and sauces!  Picked up spinach ravioli and meat sauce to cook at home!  Will definitely be back!
author: Samantha G.

description: I never write reviews. But this place was one of favorites. They have a simple menu, salads sandwiches and pastas but they're food was delicious. Service is fast, And the restaurant is really comfortable and cute! Definitely a must visit.
author: Erika C.

description: The food here is fantastic, have been 4-5 times and gotten all sorts of different dishes (lasagna, fettuccine, spinach ravioli, etc) and have seriously loved all of them. Good serving size for the price, cool atmosphere, and just really quality food.
author: Jordan S.

description: Totally worth the visit! The meat sauce was delicious and the gnocchi is hard to beat! We sat up at the counter on the fun-shaped bar stools while we ate and watched them make some pasta. I'll definitely be visiting again next time I'm in the area!
author: Cherie S.

description: LOVED THE FOOD. Horrible seating and too small tables inside. .Very uncomfortable. Would not go there ever again unless it was take out. The place is very small and usually packed. The tables are jammed in a small space to get as many customers in as possible no matter how uncomfortable the customers are. I would give less stars because of this, but the food was great. Order and do take out.
author: Dee J.

description: First time here and went with the Cassoni w/ meatball & 3cheeses it was sooooo gooood! Can't wait to try more things on the menu! Will be back!
author: Josh C.

description: So good!  It smells like my grandmas kitchen when she was making sauce. Can't wait to go back.
author: WC Gal Z.

description: The lasagna was probably the best one my boyfriend and I have ever eaten. It just melted in your mouth! They roll the pasta right in front of you and everyone speaks Italian there. I love it and its super cute for a casual date night!
author: Nicole S.

description: This place was awesome. Despite it being super busy we got in fairly quickly and while we were waiting we enjoyed watching them make pasta by hand. Most delicious pasta we've ever eaten, all cooked perfectly al dente. The truffle sausage special was a flavor we've never experienced, the gnocchi was perfectly sized and cooked, and their bolognese sauce was the tastiest red sauce we've ever tried. The food also came fairly quickly and while service was not as impressive as the food we also didn't find any reason to complain about it. It was also fun to listen to all the staff talk with their Italian accents and sometimes in Italian to each other as well. Five stars hands down.
author: Matt C.

description: Went for late lunch on Saturday and the secret is out. This place serves simple Italian pasta that's flavorful and fresh at unbeatable value. Had the fettuccine bolognese with meatballs and gf had vegetable ravioli. Only challenge will be to try something new as the first round was delightful.
author: Benjamin F.

description: My boyfriend and I have both ordered from this place and have yet to be let down. The food is AMAZING so fresh and flavorful! Not to mention comes at a very reasonable price.  Highly highly recommend.
author: Vanessa C.

description: Love to be able to see the MEN making pasta in the window. The food is delicious and fresh... Def big enough portions to make two meals out of it!
author: Tina S.

description: Love love love this place!  The pasta and the sauces are beyond fresh and authentic.  Totally will visit again.  The tall seats are a bit uncomfortable and the service was good.  But I tell you what that pasta is melt in your mouth amazing.  If I lived closer I would eat there tomorrow again! I wish San Jose had one of these places!  We have no great fresh pasta here :(
author: G R.

description: This is hands down the best Italian food in San Francisco at the price point. Love the veggie ravioli with butter and sage sauce.
author: Danielle L.

description: Yum. Definitely coming back here! Quick, delicious and fresh pasta - you choose the noodles and the sauce. Order at the counter and they bring it out to you. No frills, just good food. I had gnocchi with bolognese sauce ($13).
author: Nancy B.

description:
Exactly what I was craving. Simple and tasty pasta. I ordered the Fettuccine with Meat Balls. The meat balls were outstanding! The pasta was perfectly cooked and you can really taste the difference with the fresh pasta.

Super friendly staff - definitely more of a casual feel, but definitely high quality food!
author: Lizette C.

description: This place would make real Italians cry. Ordered two diff pastas (tortellini with bolognese and bechamel sauce, and spaghetti with meat sauce.. Not sure how you can mess that up. The guy at the front swore we'd like whatever on the menu, talked my friend out of ordering the same meat sauce he just recommended me.. And both meals were severely undercooked. You pay $15 for a pasta meal served on recycled paper plates, with no vino menu or bread offered (or even an option)9. My friend got a refund but I took the hit in this incredibly disappointing "little Italy" restaurant (if you can call if that) because no one spoke English, despite their extreme stray from authentic Italian cuisine. Save your money, go somewhere else.
author: Paige C.

description: Yum! Ate here on a Saturday night with my 3 kids. The interior seating was all full so we snagged seats outside, which would've been a bit too chilly but they have some exterior heaters so we were just fine. Two of us had flatbread sandwiches, which were quite good. My caprese had just the right amount of balsamic and the mozzarella was obviously fresh. Two had pasta dishes, one with meatballs, one with white sauce. There is no kid's menu so be prepared to take some home or convince the kids to split a plate. The servings are definitely large enough. My kids were taken with watching them make the pasta. We would return here for another visit!
author: Mandy W.

description: Went here with my husband during the July 4th holiday. Great to see the pasta being made as you are waiting for your meal. Super- super fresh pasta and sauce.. It was a great place to go to for pasta. Very attentive staff and very reasonable prices.
author: Sheila K.

description: Awesome gnocchi, soft but not too soft  (I've had it all over!). Very generous bolognese. Went with two cranky toddlers and was treated very nicely by staff. Food was served very quickly. Highly recommend the place. Would love to have one in my home town.
author: Vv L.

description: Really delicious, and the pasta is homemade. Only complaint is that the dining area isn't larger.
author: Stephen E.

description: Love, love, love.  A great little Italian escape right off the route from wine country to San Jose when you take the city route.  Lasagna was fabulous.  I would skip the wine as it is pretty expensive for the quality, but solid thumbs up on all of the food and take home pasta.
author: Cheryl I.

description:
Had the gnocchi with marinara sauce. It was good and would come back especially to try the gnocchi roll, which they were out of, and the pesto. 

I like the idea of being able to buy pasta by the pound to cook at home. 

I have a critical comment, but this is easily fixable. well-made and fresh pasta needs to be topped with fresh-grated cheese. Mine came with the ancient powdered Parmesan, the kind you see in shakers at hole in the wall pizza places, like the kraft sawdust shaving stuff, all sprinkled on top. This took the meal down a star for me. Just didn't make sense with a place with such a focus on fresh ingredients.
author: Megan N.

description:
Living a few blocks  away, I have been delighted to make the acquaintance of the Italian Home-made Company.   I have had the pleasure of experiencing many meals prepared at the restaurant and also a Private party catering by them on Telegraph Hill.   The pasta, the sauces, the sandwiches and, not to be forgotten, the tiramisu, were all extraordinary.   The Italian couple that opened this space not long ago are committed to genuine Italian cuisine using the finest ingredients and a commitment to technique that is all too uncommon in restaurants of any sort in this country.  While local politics have made it difficult for them to obtain a liquor license, they have continued to produce the finest Italian cuisine in the extraordinarily competitive market situated in the North Beach area. Bravo!

 In particular, many of the Italian sandwiches are simply unavailable elsewhere on the west coast and perhaps only available in this country on Arthur Avenue in the Bronx or a short list of other truly Italian neighbourhoods.  You will quickly become an aficionado of Italian sandwiches by dining here!

 If you seek and utterly authentic, professionally prepared food and with he warmest of experiences, the Italian Food Company is the place for you. Highly recommended.
author: William D.

description: We went here because of all of the great reviews. It is a nice local place, but we ordered 6 different pastas and none of them were very special.  Too bad, we had really high hopes.
author: Michael A.

description: I'm Italian and I never found a good spot that's is autentic. This restaurant is IMO the best in the city and moreover cheap!
author: Davide D.

description: so cute! so tasty! so simple! pick your pasta and your sauce. red sauce wasnt the MOST flavorful i've had, but it was super fresh and with my gnocchi made for a lovely little meal. will go back again.
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Got here early on Sunday before the crowds came in.  The food is amazing.  All of it is made fresh - you can watch them make the pasta when you walk in the door.  They also sell a small assortment of Italian grocery items (cookies, pasta, etc).  We had a pasta and a couple of desserts and all of them tasted delicious.  Would definitely stop by again when I am in town.
author: Dustin F.

description: A great stop for our last dinner before leaving San Francisco. We had to circle around a little before finding parking, but it was worth it. Very friendly service and we all loved our meals. We had Tomatoes & Mozzarella Cassoni, Gnocci with Bolognese, Fettuccine w/meatballs, Lasagna and Vegi-lasagna. Mine was the lasagna and I'm sure I'll crave it once in a while. I won't be able to find another lasagna quite like it anywhere else.
author: Ms S.

description: Really good place! So happy we found it while yelping (lol)! The food was great! Which is really why you're there but the man at the register looked like he was just not in the mood for anyone, I asked him a question about the food and he was very short with me. Otherwise, we had a total of 6 people eating 6 different foods and no complaints. Yummy!
author: Addi V.

description: Whoa, impossible to beat an Italian food restaurant w fresh pasta n the people who took my order are Italian and the folks eating there spoke Italian. Am I painting the picture of authentic n delicious Italian food good enough to attract Italians. I hope so, don't miss this very good Italian restaurant...it's the real deal!
author: DeeJay M.

description: Huge portions. Affordable prices. Tastes good but a little salty. I tried the meatballs and meat lasagna.
author: Robert S.

description: Damn good pasta with no wait!! I ordered the pappardelle with beef and pork bolognese and it was delish!  It didn't take long to order and was able to grab an outside table.  There was also plenty of seating inside.  I had at least 2 couples walking by comment that my pasta looked good.  Wished I would have had time for the tiramisu but maybe next time!
author: AC C.

description: Excellent food and friendly staff. Had the veggie lasagne and the burata salad . Inspite of being very crowded on an Easter weekend they did a great job . The ravioli also looked good
author: Naina T.

description: Fresh homemade pasta... what more can you really ask for? I had the gnocchi with bolognese sauce and it was amazing. On top of that, the decor and ambiance is really nice and relaxing and the staff is super friendly and helpful. They even gave my friend and I some complimentary tiramisu! I will definitely be coming back here.
author: Jennifer B.

description: This place is small, not meant for big groups but it's delicious. It's as authentic as possible. The pasta is handmade and they are making it right in front of you. You will be glad you went in. I can't recommend any specific dish as everything I've had, has been delicious!!!
author: Ben R.

description: Great homemade Italian food! I ordered the tortellini and thought it was fantastic. The ambiance is decent - definitely the kind of place where you can sit and have a great meal in under an hour. Price is fair. Loved that the owners are actually from Italy. Overall, very impressed and will go back again.
author: John M.

description: This place has delicious homemade rustic authentic Italian food. The real deal, it feels like eating in Rome.
author: Karim D.

description: FABULOUS food!  Authentic Italian... took me back to Florence!  Very nice staff!  This is a must stop for dining in or for take out!
author: Julie H.

description: Great casual dining... Kinda small so not the best for huge groups but the food is amazing!!!!
author: Aleccio V.

description: Amazing fresh pasta. Very chill vibe. I had the meatballs with tagliatelle. Will def return
author: Rachel M.

description: Friendly. Great pasta. Sauces were less great. "Pesto" was creamy which was an unwelcome surprise for me, but maybe that's normal or authentic.
author: Gina C.

description: I tried takeout after eating at their North Beach Location. At about $14 per pasta dish, I found the portions to be small, and the seasoning to be bland. I'm pretty biased, as I've enjoyed many home-cooked Italian American meals with family. Pasta or a serving of the flatbread with meatballs and sauce is their best dish I've tried, but I found it needed to be spiced up at home afterwards.  The pesto and salad were both deeply disappointing. I hope this new branch improves as time goes by and that the value rises those SF price points.
author: J B.

description: Small place, order at the counter and they bring your food out.  Meat lasagna was heavenly.  Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their dishes and kids liked watching them make pasta while we waited.  Would definitely go back.
author: Scott K.

description: San Francisco lacks good, inexpensive food--Italian Homemade is an exception to the rule. Pasta made in house, imported meats and cheeses, and friendly/helpful/Italian staff. Get a hot sandwich with a side of burrata. Also, it's pretty nice inside and they serve wine-- good spot for a casual date.
author: Aaron V.

description: Cacio e Pepe with a side of two meatballs. Really good. Meatballs came on a separate plate swimming in a healthy portion of bolognese. I've been to the north beach location about a year ago and this one seemed better.
author: max m.

description: I highly recommend this as a must- eat stop! We originally ate here on a food tour but enjoyed our "gnocchi roll" sample so much that we returned for dinner. The lasagna was also incredible!
author: Adam D.

description: I don't go to too many Italian restaurants, but I have to say this one is by far one of my favorites. Easy to order, great service, open seating, and delicious simple Italian food. One suggestion is to use public transportation, Uber, or Lyft because it maybe tricky to find parking around the area.
author: Richard B.

description: so authentic !!! thoroughly enjoyed it and then found a second location...awesome + nice guys running the place too.
author: E T.

description: Holy shit. I can't get over how good their lasagna is. It's like I died and went to heaven. I will say you can pass on the meatballs though.
author: Eric H.

description: Only place in SF with affordable homemade pasta - parpadelle is my favorite with ham and mushroom / meatballs - order 2 per person/ the owner and staff are always so nice and friendly when you come in !!!
author: Gina H.

description: This short and no so sweet.   I ordered to go a MORTADELLA (thinly sliced meat)  sandwich with lettuce, tomatoes and onions.   The place was not busy and the owner took my order.
